Reviewer: Angela Davis-Matthews
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Imagining with Me is a fantastic new addition to St. Charles County Mall, and it’s exactly what our community needed! There aren’t many places dedicated to young children, so this space is a breath of fresh air. I first heard about it through their social media and was excited to visit. We’ve been several times now, and my son absolutely loves it!

One of the highlights was winning free admission through their social media giveaway—such a fun bonus! The play areas are creative and engaging, with so many opportunities for little ones to explore and use their imagination. My son’s favorite is the science center, which is filled with hands-on activities that introduce STEM concepts in a fun and age-appropriate way. He especially loves the child-sized spaceship!

Personally, I love the restaurant and grocery store play areas. Watching the kids pretend to be chefs, shoppers, and cashiers is such a joy, and it sparks endless creativity. This is a place where children can learn, grow, and create lasting memories. I truly appreciate the effort that went into making Imagining with Me such a special place, and we’ll definitely be back again and again!

-----------------------

Seeing my son and daughter dressed up as doctors, astronauts and chefs was one of the highlights for me. They had so much fun!!! The business owner Keona was also very personable and friendly. Money and time well spent!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Yama Saine
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: Our family had an absolute blast at Joyland kidz! My 3 yr old son and 16-month-old daughter enjoyed every moment. From the moment you walk in, Joyland gives off a fun, energetic vibe that sets the tone for an unforgettable experience. The entire space is clean, safe, and well organized. The kids were entertained the whole time from the exciting slides and bouncing rooms to the interactive play areas. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made sure everyone felt welcomed. Customer service was top-notch, and it’s clear the team truly cares about creating a positive environment for families. I highly recommend Joyland kidz for a fun-filled day the whole family will love! We will definitely come back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Christina Walker
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: I visited Joyland on 7-1 with my 3 children ages 1, 5, and 8.

Pros:
1. Great location
2. Lots of parking
3. Very clean facility and bathrooms

Cons

1. Young girl working was on her phone as she completed my transaction and answered my questions. It’s nothing more rude than when young people have their AirPods in and are holding two conversations at once. There were times when she was looking at me but talking on her phone.
2. It was 78 degrees inside on a  95 degree day. Their air was set to 64 degrees. I don’t know if it was ventilation issues or AC issues but it was hot. You are not allowed to bring food or drinks inside. They have water fountains but they are near the bathroom (I don’t drink water fountains near bathrooms iykyk) They have a water bottle refill station but you can’t bring bottles in so it doesn’t really make sense.
3. Their price per child no matter what their age, is $15.99 for 2 hours. One adult does enter free with children. There is no different price for younger ages which was shocking to me. HyperKidz and Scramble even have a different price for toddlers vs older children. They also don’t have different weekday prices vs weekend prices.  Paying $16 for a space where my one year old could not even use half of the equipment was unsettling.
4. The space is small. It is the size of the surrounding businesses. I was so happy to have a place close to home but for $16 per child I will take my kids where it is half the price and they actually have more things to do.
5. They require non slip socks. Every indoor playground I have been to requires socks but not non slip socks. The non slip socks are a money grab. They look similar to the sky zone socks but nothing in there is slippery so I really didn’t understand the non slip socks. As I looked around almost every family had them which confirmed for me it was a money grab. Their website also didn’t have the socks under their admissions tab.

I will not be coming back. I really wanted to support a new black owned business but it seems like a money grab for the size and what they have to offer.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Christopher Higham
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited 10 months ago
Review: This could be a really nice play place, but some safety issues need to be addressed and handled better.

Fun place for ages 3+, but not for toddlers. It can get overwhelming and dangerous. The staff are uninvolved. The flooring in the main play room is warped and easy for kids to trip on.

There is another room in this place with small roller coasters, but it is not set up in a safe way, and again the staff are uninvolved. The roller coaster room was set up in a way where the kids would roll down straight into hard objects and get hurt.

They have fun foam building blocks, but some of them in the mix are unusually heavy. One energetic kid was throwing the foam blocks around, which normally wouldn't be a problem, except that some of them were the heavy ones that could cause injuries (they made a big thud sound when the kid threw them).

All the while, while kids were having fun and getting hurt, the staff were on their phones at the check in desk rather than taking turns checking on the crying kids or helping organize the dangerous messy rooms.

Also, this was at the beginning of August. If the dates on some of the other reviews are correct, the AC was out about 2 weeks ago. It was still not working. Super hot inside.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Imani Johnson
Rating: 2/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: Beware of booking a party package/room at the PG location. I planned and booked my daughter's 2nd birthday party here one month in advance. The cost to have roughly 25-30 guests in the smaller party room is $350 total. This comes with 2hr room rental, 2 pizzas, and juices for the kiddos. My issue with my booking is that the AIR CONDITIONING was busted for the weekend in the MIDDLE of July 2024. The staff kindly reached out to me the morning of the party to ask which pizza toppings I wanted for the party. (I replied pepperoni and cheese =) I'm in a good mood because it's my daughter's special day) No mention at all regarding the A/C. We arrive to setup for the party and then were told. I have 3 pregnant women and elderly guests attending the party. I was offered $50 off. The staff brought the pizzas but would not give me the pizzas until the balance was settled. I was not settling for just $50 off. The most the manager offered off was $100 and a few free waters for the inconvenience. He/she told the staff that if I wasn't happy with their final offer we would have to exit the party room immediately. So I pay the remaining balance because I'm not trying to get kicked out of the room and completely ruin the day/party. Here is the kicker, both the pizzas are cheese. Like wow lol. All in all, vet other play places for your children so you do not give an establishment your hard-earned money just for them to treat you like trash. I'm rating it a 2 instead of a 1 because one of the employees helped me set my balloon garland up.

Reviewer: Shaun
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I took my children for an outing to have some fun on a Saturday afternoon. The place was pretty crowded and there were lots of parents and kids playing. It was clean as the review stated which was a good thing. My youngest who is one wanted to play in the ball pit however the ball pit is attached in the main area so there were a lot of bigger kids which meant she wasn't able to play. I would definitely suggest putting a ball pit in the toddler room for the children to play with. I also think it would be a good idea to station a staff member in the toddler room to keep the bigger kids out. I would like to see a bit more sanitation going on while the children are there maybe someone walking through periodically and sanitizing the toys because the smaller kids of course like to put things in their mouth no matter how much you try to stop them. The price was decent And there was no time limit which was a good thing. They do have trampolines but they are in a separate room from the play equipment so if you have a child that wants to do trampolines and then a child that wants to climb the jungle gym you're going to have to split your time between both rooms. I would say the bathrooms need a little bit more attention The one that I went into definitely could have used some attention during the day It wasn't completely bad but to have children that need to use the restroom it definitely needs to be cleaned and sanitized at least once every couple of hours. Overall my kids had a good time and the place was clean which was a plus for me, however, you might want to go early in the morning when there's not a lot of kids there if you want your younger children to be able to fully experience everything without being run over by the older kids.

Reviewer: silvia gontijo
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I was at this playground last month and the experience I had wasn't the best. I'm a babysitter and was watching three children. The 3-and-a-half-year-old child accidentally dropped her pretzels on the floor while eating her snack. Then the receptionist came up to me and told me I had to clean up the mess the child had made. She had a vacuum cleaner in her hand and still made a big deal out of it. When I went to see, my child had already cleaned everything up and there were just crumbs on the floor. The receptionist handed me a spray and paper towels and told me to clean up the crumbs, even though she already had the vacuum cleaner in her hand and could just clean the crumbs ( I mean, if someone has an accident in the restroom, will she ask the person to clean the bathroom? That doesn’t make sense, when you have a business you have some responsibility even though you don’t like it) . I don't know if she did this to me because I'm a babysitter, but I'm sure she wouldn't have done what she did to me with any mother present at the playground. I found it unprofessional, and I'll think twice before taking the children to this playground again. It was an unnecessary and humiliating situation, if she is the owner, she should improve. That's not how you treat your customers. The playground itself is nice but not very big. Perfect for ages 2 to 7.

Review: Nice place but wouldn’t recommend for a birthday party.
There are no hosts working party rooms, one employee working front desk on a busy Saturday when there’s a party. Very disorganized. In their birthday package they say they will decorate the party room for you. I dropped the party decor off a day before the party to still see a box of banners and decor unused. The night prior I asked them to set it all up. I was assured they would. I got there 10 minutes after the booked party time only to be told I can set it up how I want. How will I decorate when there’s already guests there and I have children to entertain? So now I wasted money on decorations I can’t use. We had to find the employee and ask for the party bags since people were leaving (these & popcorn are included in the package we got) Seems to be a shortage of staff issue. The employee there however were very nice and it’s a fun environment for kids but definitely would not recommend a party to be held there because of our experience.

Reviewer: Vonya B
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: We recently hosted a birthday party at Action Jaxx. The website indicates 2 hours of non stop fun for the package we selected. Little did I know, it didn’t include 2 hours in the party room. I found out 3 days prior that access to the party room is only for 1.5 hours of the 2 hour timeframe and this was because I called the center to confirm other details.

I received a text the night before indicating the same. Extending my time was not an option and at this point it was too late to cancel.

We arrived at the center 20 minutes early and was only allowed access to the room at the time the party started. Once we entered, they were still setting up the room.

The day of, the owner, Kris, seemed annoyed with being asked questions or for clarification on certain things and was avoiding dealing with me and always directed me to the party host instead.

Everything was rushed. We literally had to eat in a jiffy, sing happy birthday quickly and get out of there for them to set up for another birthday party.

All in all, this is a great spot for kids to have fun but I would not recommend hosting a birthday party unless they adjust some things (set up and break down time, extending party room time, etc.) or be clear about specific details on their website. As well as, be more approachable with customers.

It was a terrible experience from an adult perspective but my son and his friends enjoyed themselves.

Review: I didn’t come here for a party. It was just a play date, and I really wanted to like this place because the kids had an amazing time. But I can’t overlook the condition of the facility.

Everything about the place feels old, dingy, and unsanitary. Several play structures were literally held together with duct tape. The ball pit had balls with missing foam or foam completely exposed. Review: We had my niece’s birthday party at Play EC in Capitol Heights. The kids had a great time on the jungle gym and play areas, but the overall experience left a lot to be desired. The party room wasn’t available until 4 p.m. even though the party was scheduled for 2:30, which was frustrating. The space is small and felt overcrowded on a busy Saturday.

It was hot inside, especially in the back where the air doesn’t circulate well. The facility could be cleaner—dust triggered my allergies, and there were items stored under the jungle gym. Staff seemed limited—only three people on site, including the manager.

They did provide pizza, juice, and handled setup, and the decor was nice, though clearly reused. Be careful with helium balloons—if one floats to the ceiling, they’ll charge up to $150 to retrieve it or you can risk your safety and try to get it down yourself, they will provide the ladder for you.

It’s probably best to go during a weekday or rent the full space if you’re planning a party. Great for kids, but not the most comfortable for adults.

Reviewer: Mystic Kila (Kila)
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: SCAMMERS!!!
We booked a birthday party at this establishment for 5:30 PM and paid $600 in advance, as required. However, we arrived at 5:47 PM and were shocked to find that we had to wait nearly two hours for a party room to become available. Despite paying for a private room for two full hours, we were not given access to a room until 7:30 PM. To make matters worse, the manager informed us that we had to vacate by 7:45 PM—after receiving only 15 minutes of use.

The experience was completely unacceptable. The pizza provided was cold, and the drinks were old Capri Sun juice boxes. This is not what we paid for, and certainly not what was advertised.

As a Black woman supporting a Black-owned business, I expected professionalism, respect, and accountability. Unfortunately, this experience confirmed why many hesitate to support our own—because some businesses treat paying customers as if their money and time don’t matter. I feel disrespected, disappointed, and frankly scammed out of $600 for a service that was never properly delivered.

For comparison, Chuck E. Cheese charges $200 less and honors their time slots. Even if you arrive late, they simply deduct that time from your reservation—they don’t force you to wait two hours for a room you already paid for.

This business failed to meet basic expectations and left my family and guests feeling disregarded. I sincerely hope this feedback is taken seriously so that no other family has to go through what we experienced.

Reviewer: Marchelle Shorts
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I’m giving this place one star solely because my child enjoyed coming here BEFORE we booked a party. However, I can confidently say this is not a 4-star establishment—don’t be misled by Google reviews. Many of the honest 1-star reviews can be found on Yelp.
The management is unprofessional, greedy, and show no appreciation for their guests. My party décor was nothing like what I requested, and both the party host and management were rude and dismissive. After the event, I sent a polite and professional email regarding my deposit, only to receive nothing but disrespect and unprofessional back-and-forth responses, as if I were arguing with a child.
They claim they’ve made “upgrades”—absolutely not. The facility still smells like feet, the foam pit cubes are falling apart and unsanitary, and to top it off, the entire place reeked of weed as we were leaving. They don’t have enough staff to monitor guests, so anyone can come and go freely, creating a safety concern.
Despite advertising that the space is for kids 8 years and younger, there were older, rough-playing kids who posed a risk to younger children. They also claim to provide waivers and wristbands for safety, but that wasn’t enforced at all.
To make matters worse, the candy wall décor contained old, stale, and hard candy—and this was during my party!
If you're considering booking a party here, think twice. They make up their own rules, have no regard for customer satisfaction, and will take your money without delivering the promised experience. I truly regret spending my hard-earned money here and not receiving my deposit back. Beware before booking! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Review: Overall, I like the concept of this play place. There is supposed to be an age cap for the range of children allowed to use the space and get on the activity play set-ups. They're too big for the play area and it's already a small space. In my opinion, it takes away from the younger children being able to fully immerse themselves in the space. When they do birthday parties, maybe they should consider charging for a few hours to rent out the entire space just for the party and close it off to the public until the party is over. The last time I was there with my grandson , it was a mixture of party goers and outside kids and it was a mess. The other children who are not a part of the party are left out and see the party favors and set up and are limited to their play time but the party kids have access to it all. This causes confusion. Other than that , it's a great place to take younger kids maybe 2-6 to play.

Reviewer: Brandon Meredith
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Upon arrival, we were directed into the paly area for our 1 of paly time. In your disclosure your company states that you “provide a safe and stimulating environment for kids 8 and under to explore because we truly believe that growing up should be a memorable experience for every child.”. However, this was NOT the case on Sunday, there were multiple kids above the maximum age and weight limit who were filliping, spinning diving and jumping of the equipment and bumping into my one and two year old babies. The children were unsupervised and there was no staff to regulate play. I had to step in and stop rough play to keep my party’s babies safe. The condition and cleanliness of the equipment and play area was also unsanitary, unsafe, and broken. There was an event of a child vomiting (which is normal due to running around) however the facility did not have the proper cleaning supplies to aid the mess. There weren’t any trash bags, no disinfectant, no clothes, no mop nothing that could sanitize the area to continue play. My family and I had to help clean the entire surface area because of the short staffing. Even after surface cleaning, we had to continue to encourage shutting down that specific area due to lack of disinfectant treatment to that area. When directed back to our party room there was a walkway full of cake, water and just spilled the entire walkway, all my guest and children walker in socks and were subject to stepping in the filth on the ground. The “Swiffer used to clean the walkway after it was brought to staffing attention was not efficient as it did not have the proper size cleaning pad.  The rest rooms were unsanitary and had food and trash everywhere. The facility was not cleaned regularly during playtime.

During the celebration in the party room, we were not provided“ trained party host to ensure a stress-free experience” as stated in the companies. There were not enough napkins, plates, no utensils for the guest. All of which had to be retrieved upon consistent requests. The chairs and tables were filthy, torn and not in presentable condition. I cannot stress enough the lack of staffing we experienced at this facility. I was under the impression that there would be a capacity limit at which I know were not carefully monitored because the individuals in my party as well as incoming guest were not accounted for. The “memorable, safe, clean and courteous” environment promised for the amount myself and husband had to pay for our daughter wasn’t not delivered at this facility. My daughters first birthday experience as well as our guest was ultimately ruined.

NEVER AGAIN, OVERPRICED UNPROFESSIONAL AND BEYONG FILTHY.

Other than that though perfect for a night of “letting them tire themselves out”

{Reviewer: Sarah Zaman
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 hours ago
Review: We visited Kids Emporium in Glen Allen on Thursday afternoon (July 3rd), and I’m so glad we found this gem! I went with my brother’s family and a friend, and our kids—ranging from 4 to 11 years old—had the BEST time. Between the glow-in-the-dark dance room, awesome slides, race cars, and claw machines, there was something for everyone. They played for hours and left happy (and tired)!

The space is wonderfully clean and well-organized, with plenty of comfortable seating for parents to relax while the kids play. I really appreciated the separate infant area, which makes it feel safe and thoughtfully designed for all age groups. There’s also a little snack bar with a great variety of kid-friendly snacks like go-gurts, juices, cookies, and chips.

The sign-in process was simple, though it takes a few minutes if it’s your first time because you’ll need to register your kids and sign waivers—but it’s totally worth it.

What truly stood out to me was the customer service. The two staff members working that day were fantastic—kind, patient, and respectful (which is not always easy when you’re surrounded by excited, tired, or hungry kids!). They made great recommendations when I felt overwhelmed, which made my life as a mom so much easier.

I especially want to thank Rachel, who is a mom of four herself. She was so incredibly warm and understanding—when she saw me juggling a couple of hangry little ones, she not only helped with snacks and suggestions but even shared sweet stories about her own children. That personal connection meant so much to me.

This place is a wonderful option for families with infants through tweens—whether you’re looking to burn off some energy on a rainy day or just want a fun outing with friends.

Pro tip: have your kids wear socks with some traction to keep them from slipping during play.

We’ll definitely be back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Amy Moreno
Rating: 5/5
Time: 22 hours ago
Review: I was surprisingly impressed by this place. It is very clean and well put together so I didn’t have to worry about anyone getting injured seriously.

The giant playset in the middle is a really good mix of being challenging, but not hard. There’s plenty of space to maneuver and adults didn’t have to go save kids from getting stuck every few minutes. There was just enough challenge to make it difficult, but not terrifying or dangerous. I did not have to spend my entire visit cringing and hovering around the kids.

You can purchase a reusable game card, which doesn’t list the prices online, but each of the credits are around $.20 each purchased in five dollar increments. They have these little motorcycles you can ride on that was a bit of a waste for us for a dollar, because it is a very, very short ride and every time you even look at the wall, the motorcycle would stop working. They did have crane machines, though for eight and 16 credits, and I did like that the 16 credit machine gives you 20 chances to win a prize. It did not feel like a waste when my little one was able to snag a stuffed animal for four dollars.

I also really liked that you get to play all day for the price, so we walked across the parking lot to IHOP for lunch and then we’re able to come back and pick right up with our playing. It is definitely a better bargain than some of the places we go to that charge per hour for jump time... on a hot summer day, $20 to play essentially all day in an air-conditioned building is a steal. We will definitely be back this summer.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Noelle Chase
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I love that it’s affordable, but you are definitely paying the right price for the place. I was hoping to like this place, but unfortunately, it was very unkept. The establishment really needs to work on the cleanliness (wiping down every hour, the smell, the look of the equipment - some equipment was held together by duct tape, etc). It is a kids play space, which breeds germs and I didn’t feel comfortable letting my little stay too long due to it. Hoping that can change so that we can go back.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Skyia Cooley
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Posting this here since I can’t seem to contact them via email or phone.

Hello. This is Skyia, Aryia’s mom who had a party with you guys this past Saturday. Please confirm you have received my email and if not I’ll have it attached below.

Hello,

I am reaching out regarding a party I had with you guys today from 4:30-6:30 for Aryia Johnson.

I am very displeased with how the party turned out, how unorganized everything was, and at how there were so many safety hazards that were not listed on your website nor in the photos you have on your website.

I arrive to this party with the intention that I didn’t have access to my party room until after 1 hour of play. When I got there I was told I had access. The pizza was placed in my room around 4:40pm. My party started at 4:30. When it was time for the kids to eat, I have 3 boxes of cold pizza, while 2 other boxes were in the warmer. Arriving it was VERY hot in the play area and in the party room. As I was going through the jungle gym I saw and took photos of a ripped netting with lots of totes, back drops, and random things that is under the slide. Kids should NOT have access to that. If I  wouldn’t have gone with my child I wouldn’t have known that was there. There were MULTIPLE things in the play area that did not work which means we were not able to use which I also have photos of. ALL  of the swings in the play area are being secured by TAPE and hanging by a thread which I also have photos of. And MANY MORE safety hazards for kids.

The ENTIRE play area felt like 82 degrees as well as my room. When going to eat in the room, I was able to get to my COLD pizzas . No party host , no one called my party to the room, no one checked on the party. Then, to have 20-30kids running around playing and then come to eat and drink, they have HOT caprisuns and COLD pizza. This was RIDICULOUS.

I am requesting a refund of my party. This was absolutely absurd. I have photos as well as 30 adults in my party and 4 adults that were in the play area, who’s contact information I have. Please advise on
This ASAP. I am willing to take further legal action if necessary.

Thanks.
Skyia Cooley

The spinning dolphins had the kids going crazy 😂. Birthday package was 🔥🔥

Hack for people wanting to make sure you have a good time… set your birthday party early. Be the first or second party in the building. That’ll make sure your run into less issues and people in the main room. It’s like a clothing store. It gets messier as the day goes. I’m a real person lol. Some people might have unrealistic expectations for this place. This place is Ross, not TJ Maxx or Homegoods.

Reviewer: Joanna Hodges
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: To Whom It May Concern:

I am sending this email in regards to a party I had there for my son just about a month ago. I should've known from the response prior to the party; this place was going to be a problem. The employees were rude and not helpful. We felt after paying, we were on our own. There was no party host. We had to continue to ask for things we needed that were supposed to be included in our package. When some of our guests arrived, they were told they could not get in because we had reached our limit which was totally not true. We were told we could have 30 guests we could invite. We never came close to that. The facility had another party going on at the same time or around the same time and your staff were mixing the guests up and giving the other party our wristbands. After realizing what was going on, we brought the mistake to the employee's attention who then stated she would give us a few additional wristbands as if she was doing us a favor.

In addition, there was hardly anyone at the front desk to assist guests where they should go or provide the wristbands needed. Many of my guests told us they walked right in and walked around until they found myself or my son's father. I also had another one of our guests who was stopped midway coming into the party room who was told she had to go back to the front and pay and several other guests who were denied entry until I was called to the front to see what was really going on. Who does that? The party was paid for by myself and my son's father. If there was anything additional to pay, that was the facility's duty to speak to him or myself, NOT OUR GUESTS.

To add to all this madness, the pizza was cold. I was told in advance I could purchase drinks for $1 to add to my order when I arrived. When my son's father went to the front to purchase the drinks, he was then told a different amount. We were totally disgusted with this place. My son had been there before in the past for a birthday party and this place was NOTHING as such. Not sure if this place is under new management or not, but I would not recommend this place to ANYONE and my son will NEVER be back. You all need to learn how to talk to people, learn how to run a business with more than two staff members with a number of parties going on at one time, know what you're talking about when you quote prices and most of all CLEAN THE RESTROOMS that WERE working and the equipment these kids are using. We had a number of complaints about how dirty and trifling the bathrooms were and how most of the stalls were not working. I was absolutely EMBARRASSED that I had even chosen a place like this to have my son's party. This was the absolute first time I have EVER had a party at a facility and ran into this many issues. I would hate to take this any further and report this place. DO BETTER! People are paying their hard earned money to have a nice time. I'm not looking for a response, but wanted to let you know all the drama myself and guests had to go through for something so simple.

Reviewer: Tiarra Clarke
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: If you’re here reading reviews for consideration of if this is the right venue for your child’s party, Id love to share my personal opinion. I’ve both attended a party here and hosted a private party here Nov 2024. I too read through all these reviews before making the decision to make kidzden the place for my 5 yo bday party. The venue offers a lot of fun for kids of varying ages and it’s indoors which is a huge plus. If you have the ability to do so, a private party is 100% the way to go and eliminates a lot of areas of disappointment you see in the lower star reviews. I didn’t have to deal with a crowd of strangers/multiple parties at a time, I could use the largest party room at the venue, I didn’t have to limit my guest list, the place was clean without the leftover trash or recreational smells of other guests before us, the venue staff was attentive and helpful with both the planning beforehand (answering calls and emails promptly) and during the party. Our guests from the ages of 1-9 had the time of their lives. The adults had a great few hours hands off; letting the kids have at it. The waiver, rules and inclusion details are all transparent on the website. There were no surprises when it came time to pay my invoice, when guests were asked about the waiver or when reminded to take off shoes because as the host I made sure to over communicate that prior to the date of the party.  If private party isn’t in your budget it can still be a great fun place the kids, most importantly, will love. As with anything that has multiple bookings, there’ll be a room turnaround time, juggling of parties and various venue upkeep priorities, as well as many guests outside of your party. These are standard considerations anywhere you may publicly rent party space. I can see the justification for both the good and bad reviews. I don’t take away from anyone’s experience being met with rudeness or attitude, however that was just so far from our experience from start to finish. Don’t count them out.

Review: My experience on 05/04/24(Saturday afternoon around 430pm:

1. The waiting area is small, also the shoe storages are broken with alot of exposed nails which is hazardous.

2. The play area: overcrowded with stuff, not enough space to move around especially when overcrowded with adults and kids running around. One yellow object seemed to be broken and was just laying on the floor. The metal piece could easily harm a child(should be removed).

3. Crowd control: There should be a capacity limitation that includes adults especially when hosting multiple large parties.

Presently this is not an indoor playground that we would be interested in returning too.

Review: This indoor playground is an absolute gem for families! The cleanliness here is unmatched: from the play equipment to the bathrooms, everything is spotless. The staff is constantly on the floor sanitizing, tidying, and making sure the space stays safe and welcoming. They also enforce the right rules, which helps create a fun yet orderly environment that parents can truly appreciate.

We come here regularly when it’s too hot, too cold, or raining, and it’s always a lifesaver. We also recently celebrated our child’s birthday here, and it was amazing and truly memorable.  The party was well-organized, the kids had a blast, and the staff went above and beyond to make it special.

Reviewer: Turtle
Rating: 4/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Recess Play Center is an amazing indoor playground for children. Walk ins only. Booking a party on the other hand is kinda not where I would go. The reason I say this is because the standard package we book states each additional adult is $5 more. I had over 10 adults. Upon arrival at Recess, ask the attendee at the front desk. I am going to have over 10 possible kids and 10 adults as included with my set package. I specifically ask can teenage kids who are not gonna play, who are just observers. Can they be charged as an adult? I was told by the wife owner and other associate that will be fine as long as they are 15 & over. Some how three teenagers were given a payed wristband before the rest of the younger kids came. so upon the younger kids that came later, I was told to pay the full $25 fee when I specifically request to give the payed bands to the younger kids and add the additional $5 observer fee to my remaining balance. We did come up with a resolution after 15 mins of back and forth 😒Another issue I had was the size of the room. I understand that I booked that particular size but if you see that my party has grown, I would expect that they will have moved to another room as we were the only party there on Thursday evening. Most of my guests couldn't even sit down to eat. Also, didn't like we have to wait until the second hour to go in the party room that is explained on the website, but that should be changed.

unfortunately they do not provide any type of food for you so come with your own food or you could pay for some snacks at the concession stand, only snacks like ice cream soda chips Do not except for some chicken, pizza, or any other hot food. LOL. Please note regardless if you not playing or just have to use the restroom. To go to the back you have to remove your shoes. Another thing is I was charger a gratuity fee (that felt mandatory) when it is not stated on the site or during the booking. SMH

Thats why I give it a four star. It was amazing other than the issue we had earlier. I am thankful for the amazing experience the children had and I definitely will take my kids back again, but only as a walk-in, I cannot do a party. LOL

On a good note, the entire playground was clean. It was sanitized. It was much fun. I had fun as a big kid at heart myself.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lorenzo L
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Dear Recess Play Center Management,

I recently visited your facility in Silver Spring, MD, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. While I appreciate the clean and spacious environment, I found the pricing to be unreasonably high compared to similar play centers in the area. Given the cost, I expected a better overall experience.

Additionally, I was surprised to find that no food options were available on-site. Many play centers offer snacks, drinks, or at least a designated area for families to eat, making visits more convenient for parents and children alike. The lack of food services significantly impacted our visit, as we had to leave earlier than planned to find a suitable dining option elsewhere.

I wanted to bring these concerns to your attention in hopes that you might reconsider your pricing structure and improve amenities to better serve families. I would appreciate a response regarding any steps you plan to take to address these issue. I will never go here again.

Reviewer: Jay Perrine
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Had my 3 year olds birthday party here and it was perfect! Jenn and Drew (the owners) were so amazing and helpful and FLEXIBLE with us as we navigated this day.
The Room: the covered tables were set up with cups, plates, and napkins. They even INCLUDED cool spidey Balloon decorations to go with our theme. We got to take the balloons home after! The room is equipped with Bluetooth so we could play music. We were allowed to bring food, drinks, and cake and Recess supplied some chips and drinks as well. Jenn came in during the party to help hand out pizza and just in general be helpful.
The playspace:
Omg so we've LOVED the playspace since day one. We are frequent fliers haha. There is so much to do for the kids from bikes, to wall climbing, to exploring the playspace. There's a ball pit (the best part about that for this germ fearing nanny is that they have a ball cleaner! The balls get cleaned on a weekly basis i think). There are 6 different areas (7 if you include the wall with the...idk what to even call that. Remember that toy ((millennials I'm talking to you!)) That you put your hand on and it made the imprint and we would of course put our face in it? Yea they have a huge body size one of those!!). They have an area for your little crawlers with plenty for them to climb and explore. The playspace is big enough for me to get in and climb with my 3 year old. There are 3 slides and a section with a "ball volcano!) They also have ball launchers in the upper area. It's a plenty big space for kids to run around. Oh they also have a cool light color wall! And you can buy snacks from honest juice to some coke products to teddy grams.

I can keep singing this places praises all day! You definitely want to go here for a playdate or a birthday party!! We will.be back friday!

-----------------------

Review: My 16 month old daughter and I checked it out for the first time on a very cold Tuesday morning after hearing several families rave about it. We loved it! I was impressed by the wide variety of things for my enthusiastic and toddling daughter to do - from STEM activities with balls to slides to a giant Light Bright.
It felt safe and secure to leave our coats and shoes in the cubby. The attention to detail was impressive - like guest Crocs by the bathrooms so the gym socks stay clean, the hand sanitizer stations sprinkled throughout the building, clear signs where direction was needed.... it added up to be a very fun, engaging, positive morning.
We are looking forward to going back again!

Review: Have your child’s birthday party here!  It was AMAZING.  We had my son’s fourth birthday here today and the execution was flawless. We walked in the party room when it was our time and it looked spectacular, everything was set up and ready to go!  Drew was wonderful to work with and made the whole experience so easy.  He handled everything from start to finish and went above and beyond to ensure our friends and family had a wonderful day.  This was by far the easiest, nicest party.  We’ve been to other play places that have made parents rush in, set up/decorate in 10 minutes and then clean up and rush out.  Recess does the exact opposite — they set up and clean up.  All you have to do is show up and bring any extras you want to have, they do the rest.  The entire staff was wonderful and so accommodating.  This place is clean, the staff is knowledgeable, friendly and KIND.  I cannot recommend them enough.  All our friends and family were also so impressed. The owner was incredibly friendly and took the time to explain everything about the delightful play area.

I asked for napkins and only got 1 tiny pack. I had to keep running around to find a host, front desk had 1 Spanish speaker who was refusing to speak to my guest in Spanish which luckily I stood at the front and helped most of my guest. Also they didn’t help me set up anything besides push like 2 stands in, im grateful I had friends and family who helped. I will definitely be returning as a customer, but definitely not for parties. The employees are young and I understand but lacking respect has nothing to do with their age.

{Reviewer: Dani Ponce
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: We were pleasantly surprised by this indoor playground. We visited DC during a heat wave and needed a safe and cool place for our toddler to play. We came here during a weekday and paid $15 for u limited play time + $5 for an extra adult. Our son has a great time and played for hours. He’s 2.5 and could do almost everything. The staff was polite and they did well to intervene if certain spaces were too crowded and/or in unsafe situations. The place is very clean and we saw multiple sanitizer stations throughout. We’d come back on a very hot or rainy day.

Reviewer: Faseka Sheferaw
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Yesterday, March 15, 2025, I attended Magic Ground for the first time with my kids for a birthday party. I arrived early, and even though the party host hadn't arrived yet, the staff kindly allowed us to enter and let the kids start playing. Getting in was completely hassle-free.

Having been to many indoor play areas, I can confidently say that while Magic Ground is smaller than most, it is by far the best one I've experienced. The manager, Franklin, and his staff were beyond amazing—attentive, pleasant, and genuinely focused on making the experience enjoyable for everyone.

Unlike many other venues that rush parties and offer minimal assistance, Magic Ground provided exceptional service. The atmosphere was welcoming, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure everything ran smoothly. The kids had an absolute blast, and I would highly recommend it to anyone planning a children's party.

-----------------------

Time: 4 months ago
Review: This place isn't bad. It was much smaller than we expected it to be. There are 2 slides, a small trampoline, and a bunch of climbing structures. There's a book corner with books and a whiteboard. But the markers were all dried up. There is a section for under 3. There is a ball pit at the base of a slide with some space behind it to play in. Also a little ball pit for under 3. There were several tables to eat on. There isn't much space for your things and shoes. It being DC, we did have to park in a garage and pay for that. On the wknd it's $14 for one hour or $19 unlimited. It is secure, gate by the exit, and staff at the front. And heaven forbid a kid takes a ball out of the pit for a second. There's someone constantly watching the kids and reminding them of the rules. I understand making sure rules are followed but it felt a bit overbearing.
I think what threw us off was the size. We're used to omnifun, hyperkidz, jolly yolly, etc. My 4yr old said she "did everything" rather quickly. I think it was because there wasn't as much diversity of things to do.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ronald Díaz
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: As a concerned parent, I must express my disappointment with the recent visit to Magic Ground. Our experience was far from enjoyable due to several concerning factors that compromised the safety and cleanliness of the facility.First and foremost, the presence of mice within the playground is unacceptable and poses a serious health risk to the children playing there. Not only is it unsanitary, but it also creates an environment that is not conducive to a fun and carefree play experience. It's alarming that such a fundamental issue like pest control is being neglected.Additionally, the lack of enforcement regarding the "socks at all times" rule is concerning. This rule exists for a reason - to maintain hygiene and prevent the spread of germs and bacteria. However, during our visit, it was evident that many children were running around barefoot, completely disregarding this rule. This negligence on the part of the staff is disappointing and reflects poorly on the overall management of the playground.Furthermore, I was deeply troubled by the staff's lack of attentiveness to children who were hurting others. It is imperative for playground staff to actively monitor the interactions between children and intervene when necessary to prevent any harm or conflicts from escalating. Unfortunately, this was not the case during our visit, and it resulted in several incidents where children were left vulnerable to injury.In conclusion, my experience at Magic Ground was marred by unsanitary conditions, lax enforcement of rules, and inadequate supervision.
As a parent, I cannot in good conscience recommend this playground to others until these issues are addressed and resolved.
Children's safety and well-being should always be the top priority, and it's disheartening to see these standards being overlooked.

Minus one star because there is at most one working marker for the whiteboards, and half the Wii U stations were out of order. Also, if you are planning to rely on their food, you might want to call first to see if it is open. On Presidents’ Day no food or snacks were being served.

Review: Love love this place. My daughter just turned two and is obsessed with dinosaurs. I’m so glad we found a place that caters to Dino loving kiddos, or any kiddo. We were able to rent the entire place and the decor is absolutely beautiful, cute, posh, and kid friendly. It was just wonderful to have alerting taken care of for you. We purchased the package that included cupcakes and the Dino that comes out to dance. I was also impressed with how organized it was and there were different play areas each with its own play theme. My daughter loved the little kitchen area and some of our little guests enjoyed wearing the costumes that were set up in the back. Jill helped us coordinate our party and was just absolutely kind and walked me through everything. They did let us bring our own cake and food. Some of the parents went next door to get some coffee because with that many kids running around, you need to keep up. That in itself was convenient for the adults. The goody bags that were provided had some fun quality toys in there. We appreciated the nice personal touches like the slide show photos of our daughter and the little sign with her picture on it was so sweet. Dino Kidz really went that extra mile.This is the Allen location. I would’ve chosen the one in Carrollton, but most of our guests live closer to Allen. We can’t wait to visit the Carrollton location soon.

Reviewer: Lauren Dial
Rating: 5/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: We have been coming here since they opened and have always loved it. Today we celebrated my daughter’s first birthday here and I literally can’t even put into words to explain my gratitude and happiness for this place. First of all let’s talk about cleanliness and space, this is hands the cleanest play place in all of DFW. Everything always looks so immaculate  every time we come in. You can tell they care a lot about the health of children with how clean they keep it. They’re always adding new things, the space is open, and there is so much to do for all ages, from a babies to 9 year olds. Second, price point, which for me is huge. So many play places now a days don’t have many budget friendly options. Dino kidz has that still while having the cutest special customizing that’s included in your package which just made our party feel so elevated! Like the slideshow of pictures of our daughter and the sign out front. Lastly, Jill and the girls are actual angels from heaven and decorated everything so beautifully. They were helpful, kind, informative, and loving to us and all of guests. Anyone who disagrees with that, must have a mental illness. I literally couldn't have gotten through the day without these ladies. Jill is also so good with the kids, she came and sat on the ground and played with my daughter and I for a minute, and my daughter tried to hold on to her which she doesn’t do to most people! They explain the rules about the keeping the door shut and yucky bins and that’s it! Normal rules about not carrying toys when climbing, which thank goodness for that right? We have some wild brothers and older kids in our party, no one broke the rules, no one got yelled at, kids were able to be kids! I love the music and activities they have planned and the schedule for their parties, it keeps the kids interested and no one is sitting around bored. The good-bye bubble party at the end is the best idea. The pictures I took don't even do it justice. I would have my kids party over and over again at Dino Kidz! We thank you guys for giving us the best party for our baby girl. We will never forget it. If you’re looking to plan a party here, I wouldn’t think twice! 10/10

Reviewer: Tamica McDonald
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Honest Review….
There are newer & better buildings to throw a kid’s party. I was very hesitant when I came to visit the spot after booking online.
The CONS:
1. The themed decorations were nice but could have been a lot better.
2. The pizza was cold after sitting too long.
3. The staff was friendly but didn’t know much about what my party consists of. We had a themed character, a balloonist, & a face painter. The host was not aware until she looked it up.
4. They only clean 15 minutes before the next party
They leave previous party balloons out even when they don’t match current theme.
5. Need newer play equipment
6. Behind the counter is chaotic clutter
7. Vegetable & Fruit Platter should have been a better presentation. I can get better from Kroger.
8. Buy your own cupcakes, the ones provided were just ok.
9. For $1700, I expected a lot more from Dino Kidz not the 3rd party vendors.

The PROS:
1. You get the place just for your party
2. 3rd party vendors really know how to hype a party, the balloonist was exceptional. The face painter was also wonderful.
3. The staff was friendly & good at hosting
4. They set-up & clean up
5. The dance party was great
6. The slideshow was a very special touch

Overall, because of the balloonist & the themed character we were able to hype the party & make a really nice time. The kids of course loved it & that’s what mattered.

Reviewer: Jeffrey Palumbo
Rating: 2/5
Time: 4 days ago
Review: POOR CLEANLINESS. HEALTH RISK. This was our second time visiting Hyper Kidz and came from southern Maryland (1.5hrs) since southern Maryland doesn't offer much for things like this to do with kids. Yesterday we visited and made a day trip with our 3YO daughter. We always pack water from home, but our daughter was thirsty and the water fountains were right there. It wasn't until about 30 seconds of her drinking from the fountain that I noticed the collection of dark mold all around the spicket where the water passes through for consumption.  The other fountain next to it had pink mold around that one. It is evident they do not clean these at all or as frequently which is crazy considering the amount of children that passes through in there and use these. I mentioned this to the front desk and they offered a free water bottle and notified another employee. It looked like the employee they notified went into a closet and I assumed there were going to take care of that right away and clean it. Wrong- instead she came out and decided cleaning the front door glass was more important. I watched for a while and no-one came to clean fountains. Guess they're okay with children drinking from their molded fountains. Following this, my daughter began to complain of stomach pain and has been coughing and sneezing. Coincidence, maybe but she was symptom free before she arrived.  Bottom line- the place lacks cleanliness and I see there's been other complaints regarding cleanliness. I hope they take their cleaning practices more seriously in the future. Fun place, but they need to do better.

data.reviews:
{Reviewer: Lisa
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: Just visited  Kids Jungle Land in White Marsh, Maryland, and I can  say this place is a hidden gem for families with young kids! From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm welcome and a vibrant, jungle-themed atmosphere that immediately caught my children’s attention.

The facility is super clean, well-organized, and packed with fun. The indoor play structures are impressive — colorful slides, climbing tunnels, obstacle courses, and even a separate toddler area, which I really appreciated. It’s the perfect mix of safe and adventurous.

What stood out the most to me was how engaged and energetic the staff were, Stacy and Ashley ! They  are such sweethearts!🌷they kept everything running smoothly, ensured safety rules were followed without being overbearing, and were always smiling and happy to help and very easy to talk to and very  welcoming ! This is definitely the place to bring your children. They will go home tired And out your hair!😂 Definitely worth the visit!

-----------------------

Reviewer: elizabeth horner
Rating: 1/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My kids and I had a wonderful time! Absolutely no complaints on the facility or the staff; except who I’m assuming is the manager, old white lady with glasses. She was very rude to me and my family when we came in and spoke over me when checking in. She seems to make her employees do all the dirty work and not take initiative her self, if you are representing the company as the manager you should be nicer and take the initiative yourself instead of leaving it to your younger employees. I also saw her sitting down on her phone while the other employees were running around tending to other guests, which I believe is heavily unprofessional. The rest of the staff were very friendly and welcoming and would kindly inform parents and children of the rules, but every time she would come out she was rude with the children and some of the adults, I understand having policies and rules to follow but there is no need to be rude especially when talking to children. I also think if there is a problem to come to the parent if possible because most children can’t comprehend what they’re being told. Other than that, my experience was good and my family and I will definitely be coming back and I highly recommend this place!! Just fix the management she is not a good face for your company.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Nagendra Singh
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: Wonderful Experience at Kidz Jungle Land – Thanks to Ms. Stacy!

We’ve been coming to Kidz Jungle Land at White Marsh almost every day, and I can’t say enough great things about Ms. Stacy, the manager. She has been absolutely amazing!

Ms. Stacy is extremely attentive to the safety of every child. She’s always alert, making sure no child is ever left unattended or near the exit unsupervised. Her dedication to keeping the play area clean and organized is impressive, even during busy weekends. It's clear she takes pride in ensuring the space is both fun and safe for all families.

She’s also very pleasant and interactive with the kids. My 4-year-old son absolutely adores her and is always excited to see her. She has a special way of making children feel welcome and cared for.

A few months ago, we hosted our son’s birthday party at Kidz Jungle Land. Ms. Stacy and Ash went above and beyond to help us decorate and manage the event. They made the whole experience smooth and stress-free for us. Hosting a party in a large, active space is no small task, but they handled everything like true professionals.

Running such a big facility smoothly—especially during weekends—isn’t easy, but Ms. Stacy and her team consistently do an outstanding job. They not only maintain the space beautifully but also treat every guest with kindness, professionalism, and a strong focus on safety.

Big thanks to Ms. Stacy and everyone at Kidz Jungle Land! We truly appreciate all you do.

Reviewer: Jess Posluszny
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We hosted a private “Dino-FOUR” themed birthday party at Kids Jungleland, and I cannot say enough amazing things about Stacy, the manager. From the very beginning, Stacy went above and beyond — her communication was clear, friendly, and super helpful. She guided us through planning and decision-making, explained all of our options in detail, and made the process completely stress-free.

What really stood out was her dedication. Stacy normally has Mondays off, but she made sure she was there specifically for our party — and she didn’t miss a beat. She helped carry in decorations, set up the party room, and constantly checked in to offer help or handle little things behind the scenes that made a big difference. You could tell she genuinely cared about making sure everything went smoothly!

The two party attendants working with her were also fantastic — helping with cleanup, making sure the pizza and drinks were out on time, and just keeping everything on track without ever being in the way.

The kids had an absolute blast, and honestly, I think the adults had just as much fun. I’m beyond grateful for all the help and care we received. We would absolutely consider hosting another party here again. Thank you, Stacy and the whole Kids Jungleland team, for making sure our little dude had a blast!

Reviewer: v k
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I booked this venue before ever stepping foot inside due to the location and amenities offered. Summer birthday with an ice room? Why not?! To my surprise, my daughter had a blast and talks about her birthday at Snowy Fun still!  The party rooms are the biggest we’ve had at a venue which I can appreciate because it’s not only the kids we are catering to, the kids’ parents also need a place to sit while the kids are enjoying their time. I have a few suggestions for party hosts and party structure to make the transition from one party to the next a lot smoother - 1) hosts should organize and plan ahead for each party and prepare supplies and utensils in advanced to avoid having to leave the room during the party causing delays. 2) if only there was a way to allow each party to separate into the trampoline and play area without having to mix in and share with turn crowd - similar to Pump it up’s technique to avoid chaos. Lastly, have an option for gratuity to add for party hosts during check out.  Overall, the owners are kind and accommodating and hopefully these recommendations are helpful and does not come off rude. We would return as the kids had so much fun there! We also appreciate not allowing older kids to jump with young kids because you know kids aren’t aware and don’t look out for the younger ones.

Reviewer: S. Loveliaz
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Vaseem is by far the worst and disrespectful owner I’ve encountered at a kids’ indoor playland. I visited Dino Kidz with my children on a Tuesday afternoon, about two and a half hours before closing time. I had previously purchased a 10-pass package and planned to use it. However, the front desk staff told me the pass had expired back in December of last year.

This confused me because I clearly remembered visiting recently, so I asked when my last visit was. The staff checked and confirmed that I had been there in February of this year. That means I had already used the pass even after it supposedly expired, and at that time, no one informed me that the pass was no longer valid. In fact, I was told I had two passes remaining.

When I pointed out this inconsistency, the staff allowed me to speak with the owner, Vaseem. During the call, he told me, “You already brought your kids in for free in February—now you want to do it again?” He accused me of trying to manipulate the situation.

But the truth is, I didn’t enter for free—I had already paid for the 10-pass package in advance. He continued to imply that I was trying to get something for nothing and spoke to me with condescension and sarcasm.

At no point was I informed that my pass had expired or that I wouldn’t be able to use the remaining visits. No notice or reminder was ever sent out. As a busy mom juggling a lot, how am I expected to keep exact track of the expiry date of a kids’ indoor play pass?

Despite the fact that the place was nearly empty and closing time was approaching, and even though I was simply trying to use something I had already paid for, Vaseem told me to either purchase at least one single pass (since I had two kids with me) or leave. He claimed this was the “best favor” he could offer and told me, “Take it or leave it.”

The way he treated me—like someone trying to freeload—was incredibly insulting. I’ve visited this place many times before, often for playdates with friends. But after experiencing this petty and disrespectful behavior from the owner, I will absolutely not be returning, nor will I recommend this place to anyone else.

Review: Why is this review not 5 stars?

The gun. Everyone knows what I’m talking about. In the ball put there’s a “ball canon” that uses air pressure to shoot balls. That’s cool. Fun.

But there’s an INCREDIBLY LOUD “hammer cock and machine gun” that plays for a couple of minutes with every button press. The air pressure vacuum for it is also loud, but it’s a bass note and you can still hear yourself over it.

This sound effect is loud enough to drown out the music, any direction to your kids’ conversation. It is awful.

To the owners: TURN THIS SOUND EFFECT DOWN. I’ve asked the teenager running the facility a few times and they always kind of shrug.

Edit: Still loud as hell.

Review: I scheduled my daughter’s 4th birthday here and it was awesome! The play areas is nice and new. Lots of options for toys and activities for the kids to play. While I would highly suggest everyone to book Dino Kidz for their child’s birthday party, I do have a couple of suggestions for the owner/management.

1. Shorten the dance party. After a couple songs, the kids lost interest and just wanted to play. I’m sure this varies with age.
2. Order from a different pizza place. Several of the kids didn’t care for the pizza. And kids eat anything.
3. Wrap the gift from your facility for the birthday kid! All kids like to open presents. It will make the gift more appealing and the kid feel super special.
4. If you are going to have machines with “play card” options, maybe include a couple free cards pending which party package the family chooses.

Review: We just wasted $670 on a terrible birthday experience for my 3 y/o. Completely Unknowledgeable staff. Zero help, zero direction, zero communication. Literally felt like we paid for a room. It was embarrassing as all my guest felt awkward and lost as well. I  then went to whom I thought was the boss, she was also absolutely no help. Zero apologies. Had to ask if I needed to serve pizza. Had to ask for juice. It was so bad. Slow to do everything but extremely quick to ask for us to leave and for the final deposit. Which was rudely asked for in front of guest. And one of the most upsetting things; I was never told that it was an additional fee (nor is this pricing listed online) to close the play area to the public (different from other locations) so to our surprise had soooo many other kids there.
I called Jill (in charge of parties based out of Allen location) and whom had been great and super responsive. She seemed extremely concerned and was very apologetic.
Final verdict- they refunded me $50!! And one free visit. - a complete joke.
Save your money go elsewhere. We had last years party at cheeky monkey and it was complete day and night experience. Never again.
We have visited this location before and I should have known by the lack of attentiveness of staff on this visits how this would end. Kids up front on their phone the entire time. And when I asked about booking a party I was swatted away and told it was all done online, later debunked by Jill.

Reviewer: Galina Goncharova
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We've visited this place multiple times over the past two years and have experienced it in various conditions. In June 2024, we saw positive improvements—the floors were replaced, equipment was repaired, and new toys were added. However, by December 2024, the facility had deteriorated significantly. The play area was filthy, with spilled Goldfish crackers and cheese stick wrappers scattered around. Equipment was covered in dust and fingerprints, the air was musty and humid, and several pieces of equipment were broken.

The bathroom conditions were particularly bad. The women's restroom needs a new soap dispenser, as excess soap drips onto the floor, creating a large puddle. Another dispenser has a sign stating it's clogged, which means both dispensers are unreliable. Additionally, the sock policy isn’t consistently enforced—some children play without socks, and kids frequently move balls from the ball pit into the building block area, creating a safety hazard since most children walk there.

To improve cleanliness and safety, I recommend that staff conduct hourly walkthroughs to pick up trash, vacuum dirty areas (including the shoe area), wipe down equipment, and organize toys. Broken balls and damaged building blocks should also be removed regularly. A deep cleaning at least once a year would help tackle dust buildup in hard-to-reach areas.

On the positive side, despite the broken equipment and cleanliness issues, we still manage to have fun here. We also appreciate the convenience of the available snacks and drinks.

In summary, this place has potential but suffers from inconsistent maintenance. When properly cleaned and maintained, it’s a great spot for kids to play. However, poor upkeep—especially in the play area and bathrooms—makes visits less enjoyable. Regular cleaning, better enforcement of policies, and occasional deep cleaning would make a huge difference. Some families have mentioned catching bugs after visiting, though we haven’t personally experienced that issue.

Rating: 1/5

Review: My child is 2 years old and we have been here multiple times on weekdays.

My kid loves to play at the tot zone but there are always children older than 3 years old.
I have never complained about this, but during today's visit, two girls over 3 years old blocked the tot zone slide and kept my child away.
I didn't know where these children's parents were, and no one stopped them to do.

So I went to the front desk and asked, isn't the tot zone only available for children up to 3 years old, and the answer was "everyone can get in."
Then why did you write “Tot zone (ages 0 to 3) ” in big letters? Is it fair to inform consumers that there is a tot zone, but in reality anyone can get in there?

It was a very very disappointed experience.
I will never want to visit again.

When we first arrived, we told them that we were new and here for a birthday party and the hostess didn't give us any information as to how this place works...basically winging it as I sit here and type. I had to come up and ask if we could finally enter beyond the gated area
Also, the kids all got separated and we're playing separately because it was so crowded. Never coming back! Place seems very clean, though. UPDATE: We missed the party because we couldn't hear the name of our host being called. Terrible! I miss Hopper's in Eldersburg!

Review: I've never been a fan of this indoor playground, but the kids enjoy it. It's not the kind of place that makes it easy for parents to see their children at all times or that is well staffed for safety and cleanliness. Some of the electronic features have been broken seemingly for months, there is debris accumulating between play spaces, and there is general evidence the owners and staff don't care, e.g. the foam legos break often as noted by the pile of broken and tossed aside bricks in a makeshift storage area clearly visible immediately adjacent to the play space. Parents check out and let their kids climb slides and run over younger kids, often even in the toddler play space. Again, no staff is visible maintaining any space or ensuring safety for all. Bottom line: it's a gross indoor playground that is falling apart with indifferent owners and staff.

Review: I used to give this indoor playground a 5 star. Today, I brought my three kids and as I entered, the air was musty. It was crowded and the a/c setting was in the 70s! The area now is very dirty. The bathroom is nasty. The 2 staff are cocky when I asked for the air quality to be improved because it is crowded and the air wasn't circulating at all they werent interested to make the change until I asked to talk to the owner. They only gave me an email to contact not the phone of the onwer. They weren't opening the doors to let out the musty air and let fresh aowner. One of the staff sprayed an air freshener instead which is not very healthy to mix with a non circulating air. One of my kids is allergic to air freshner to make matters worse. The floors are dirty and not swept and not mopped clean. This place used to be sanitized, clean and fresh but the condition today was below average. The bathroom was dirty and stinky. I had to keep going outside to get some fresh air because the air quality is giving me a lot of headache already. I hope this improves as we really love to support local businesses in our town.

Review: Comparable to Bubala and could even be better than Bubala if the facility was better maintained; many of the sections were broken (and remain broken since we've returned). It seems like this place does very well so I do not understand why repairs haven't taken place. Not to mention, every time we've gone, the restrooms are incredibly dirty. I realize it's a busy place, but all the more reason for frequent cleaning. Lastly, and maybe this is just a peeve, but the storage in between the playpens with the unsightly boxes and whatever else just reaffirms the carelessness for appearance. I do get that it's an indoor children's playground (aka madhouse) but folks are paying a lot of money for their children to play here. All in all, my children did have fun but my toddler was very frustrated that only one ball tube worked. I'm sure we'll be back but not as often as they'd like; a bit pricey when you consider the above.

Reviewer: D C
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Quality of staff has lowered significantly; we went today at a quiet time and the girl behind the desk had to take her headphones off just to check us in where we weren’t asked for our information or to sign a waiver. The second employee was just reading a book. I wouldn’t see this as an issue, but when we told them that a child had tracked blood throughout the playground, it took a good bit of time for them to actually get up with a disinfectant wipe and wipe the immediately obvious spots without doing a complete walkthrough of the entire facility. This poor cleaning standard is reflected throughout the facility as there is an easily visible thick layer of dust on just about every surface that can’t be reached without a step stool. The storage of extra materials under the equipment is understandable and a strong effort is made to keep children from these areas, but the amount of dust and random socks/trash under there could definitely be fixed.

Along with the lack of investment in time to clean, there doesn’t seem to be much investment into up keeping the equipment. I’m sure it’s expensive to repair and maintain, but some things really should be prioritized. I saw safety nets that are torn and tied together with string, many of the seams are tearing on everything, the tubes for the slides are deflated, and the one attraction that allows you to spin the inner ring has been duct taped so many times that where the tape has worn there is exposed metal.

We used to have a great time here, I’m not quite sure what happened!

-----------------------

The owners should either limit the number of people or do something about the ventilation.

Review: Our previous visits to Me land were enjoyable, but our most recent experience on Saturday, Jan 20th was disappointing. I'm saddened to say that the place was absolutely filthy, adults were not being supervised not that they should need but it seems that common sense is not so common for some people as they had their shoes on in the play area dragging all the melted snow and dirt from outside. Not only was the floor dirty, there were big hairballs, napkins, water bottles and all kinds of trash all over the place. I approached the employees and kindly asked if someone could pick up the trash on the play area,  there were four employees standing at the register, one of them say they will and never did, we stay an hour and not one single employees picked any of the trash or asked the people with shoes to take them off. Also, the same employees were wearing the shoes inside the area. It is a shame that such a nice place turned into a filthy area. All in all, an okay spot.

Reviewer: Jason C
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 2 months ago
Review: I came to Me Land to attend my grandson's birthday party. As a place for kids, it's fantastic — no complaints there. However, when it comes to customer service, I have to say it was very disappointing and needs a complete overhaul.

Starting with the front desk, I felt like I was imposing on their time. While they were friendly, they didn’t come across as very welcoming. I essentially had to coach them into giving me the information I needed to find the party.

Another issue arose when it was time to leave. The staff members who came into the party room were disrespectful — they saw that we were in the process of breaking down and cleaning up, yet they just turned off the lights on us. How unprofessional!

I would recommend Me Land for kids to play, but I would not suggest using them to host a party. While I'm not sure about the cost to host an event there, I believe you can find a better and host your party elsewhere.

Review: I am giving the facility this rating based on our positive experiences and my hope that what I’m about to describe was just a misunderstanding or coincidence. We are happy here and have always been treated kindly by staff. We are a white family.

Today upon arrival we were told that the credit card machine was not working. However, a staff member got on the phone with a technician and was able to charge my credit card while he was following their troubleshooting instructions.

Then a black family came in and was told the credit card machine was not working, and they left.

Later when my son was done playing I bought him a juice box and paid for it with my credit card with no issue.

I can’t prove that the credit card machine magically worked both times I needed it and not when the other family was trying to pay admission, but it feels like the staff was trying to deny them admission and they used the credit card machine as an excuse.

Review: I do not recommend having birthday party at Me Land unless you have your own helpers to assist you.

My party was supposed to start at 1 pm, but the holster didn't show up until 1:30 pm.
The staff at the front desk displayed rudeness when I approached them with questions. Later, it seemed deliberate when they provided us with a faulty lighter that failed to light the birthday candle.
Plus, there were not enough good parking spots close to the door, so I had to park three minutes away and lug everything for the party. Me Land only gave me one cart to carry stuff from my car to the party room.

So, I had to take care of my supper exciting 5-year-old son at the parking lot with cars come and go while making five trips back and forth between my car and the party room, each round taking about six minutes. It was a lot to handle by myself.

The holster is limited to taking orders from you; Me Land did not train the holster to effectively host the party. If you expect to have holster that can really help you to host the party, try other gyms which I did see capable holsters in there.
