Reviewer: Afton Alvarado
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I took my two and one year old for the first time to Me Land and was worried after reading the reviews about it not being clean but like any review, sometimes you have to take it like a grain of salt. It surpassed all my expectations and I didn’t think it was dirty at all. Granted I didn’t use the bathrooms instead I took my kids to the car to change diapers and eat but they let me and the kids back in after running out to the car.

Definitely a good place for a 2 and 1 year old. I always worry when I’m taking my kids places to play because of the age gap and keeping them from killing themselves when I turn an eye but this place was totally safe and engaging for both my kids and also myself. And the music wasn’t too loud! I was so happy that the sound wasn’t obnoxiously loud and they play GOOD music!

There’s a massive ball pit with a safe climbing area where the kids can go up padded stairs in numerous areas and walk around to different slides. There’s enough space for kids to spread out and play :)

For babies, they have a nice area with a small ball pit and a HUGE light Bright board and foam blocks.

Staff were nice and pleasant and didn’t appear to hate their jobs which I wouldn’t have really cared one way or the other because I’m sure it’s difficult listening to screaming kids and parents all day.

So over all, this place earned its 5 star review and I do plan on returning!

Reviewer: Vidi Horwich
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: We visited Kidz Jungle World on Christmas Eve, and it was an absolute delight! Despite being a busy holiday, the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. The play equipment was impressively clean, showing the care and effort put into maintaining the facility.

One of the standout features for us was the high weight limit on the equipment, allowing parents to join in the fun without worry. It’s also fantastic that parents enter for free – a thoughtful touch that sets this soft play centre apart from others.

The entrance fee being a whole-day pass is excellent value, and we appreciated the flexibility it gave us. Our two-year-old absolutely loved exploring all the different areas, and we would have stayed even longer if we didn’t have other commitments.

Overall, we had a wonderful time and would highly recommend Kidz Jungle World to anyone looking for a fun, family-friendly outing. It’s a perfect spot for kids to play, laugh, and burn off energy while parents can relax or join in. A solid 5/5 experience!

Reviewer: Yoomie Huynh
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: Posted 3/29/2024

There’s not very many indoor play areas for younger toddlers so I was happy to discover this place. It’s a cute play environment,  and I wanted to reserve semi-private party. ($499 for 12 kids,  20 adults) for my daughter on a Sunday morning. However, I had to go through the manager/owner and her customer service skills are less than stellar - constant interruptions and roundabout answering. All I wanted to know was why advertise entrance fee of $18/kid (weekdays)/$20/kid (weekends) for “all day play” when that’s not applicable for party rentals (that fact should be clearly stated their the website) as all party members have to vacate both the party room AND the Kids Play Gallery when the agreed upon two hour duration has reached even though the $499 party rental fee includes the $240 (12 kids X $20 entrance fee) entrance fee. Needless to say, I am looking for a different place to have my daughter’s party.

Reaction to ventor review posted on 4/21/2024:

The above review was an honest costumer review who had visited with her husband and 18 mo toddler to play at Kids Play Gallery once before, and after an interaction with both your employee in-person at the Play Gallery and a phone call with the manger/owner regarding for a semi-private 12 children/20 adult $499 package. I gave my opinion and reaction based on what I had read on your website (at the time) and stated facts that were quoted, PLUS on the "less than stellar" (as stated in my post) phone customer service by the owner (which was not addressed in your reaction). How is that "trying to hurt" your small business? There will several points that I raised that were red flags in my review of the Kids Play Gallery; your party policy was the least of my overall negative reaction - it was the rude attitude in which I was treated and my questions addressed. It was not because I wanted to nickel and dime a small business. A part of running a business is to try take ALL reactions and comments to your business neutrally and make the changes.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Gheorghe Caminschi
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Kids Play Gallery in Gaithersburg, MD, is a popular destination for families with young children. The play area is designed to provide a safe, stimulating environment where kids can explore, play, and learn.

One of the things that stand out about Kids Play Gallery is the variety of activities available. There are several play areas, including a soft play zone for younger children, a climbing structure, a ball pit, and an obstacle course. The gallery also has a dress-up area, a pretend play section, and a mini-golf course, ensuring that kids of all ages can find something they enjoy.

The facility is clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The management also prioritizes the safety of children, with strict rules in place to ensure that kids are supervised and that everyone follows the rules.

Parents also appreciate the convenient location of Kids Play Gallery, which is easily accessible from major highways and has plenty of parking available.

Overall, Kids Play Gallery is a fun and engaging play space that offers a wide range of activities for kids. It's a great place for families to spend a few hours, especially during inclement weather or when looking for a break from outdoor activities.

Reviewer: Nina Zhang
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: We love Kids Play Gallery - both for playdates AND birthday parties! All of our friends with young kids who we have brought here have loved it too. Rowena, the owner, and her team are amazing.

1) Great activities - My kids can play for SUCH a long time (~2 hrs once!), uninterrupted, with limited help
2) Great size - It's a contained space and I can see my kids all the time without losing sight of them. Also, the entrance is secured/gated.
3) CLEAN - Rowena's team is always organizing and cleaning the space
4) FANTASTIC PRIVATE PARTY SPACE - Rowena is so easy to work with. Communicates well. Also has great decorations that I did not have to worry about. Her and her team made my 4 year old BDAY party go so smoothly for myself, our guests and the kids

I cannot recommend this space enough. Love it.

Reviewer: Elizabeth Burch
Rating: 3/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Went today for the first time. Was fun for the first 30 minutes until an extremely large birthday party showed up and there were so many people that my kid and I couldn’t even walk let alone play. Paid $20 to leave after 45 minutes. It would be nice if they reserved the entire space for the party instead of letting the public in to that chaos. Don’t know if I’ll be back and risk being overwhelmed again and wasting money.

Edited to add: I see in another review that the maximum is 213 based on the square footage. That doesn’t mean that 213 people will comfortably fit in here and allow children to play. You’re forgetting some of the square footage is not a play area- it’s the lobby, the back sink and little hall area, and the closed off party room. In addition you have play equipment squeezed into this space along with your 213 people. So while it’s the maximum for safety concerns according to the county, the comfort of the people who pay should be put as first priority as safety is considered. 213 can not comfortably play here.

And even if it’s a “smaller” birthday party, there should still be regulation on how many people are allowed, anticipating the birthday party attendance. With kids and parents all running around, I literally walked into three parents and three kids just trying to get out. Again, there should be a different way to regulate it. If I had called when I planned on coming (right at 930 when it opened), I would have been told it wasn’t busy. Needs to be more organized if I’m going to pay $20 to “stay as long as you want” but realistically can only survive 45 minutes because too many people are let in. Maybe consider timed tickets in advance? But it was enough of a drive that I wouldn’t consider it if it’s only going to be another 45 minutes stay.

Reviewer: Maureen Maldonado
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: We celebrated our daughter’s 2nd birthday at Kids Play Gallery and all the kids had such a fun time! Rowena and her staff were excellent and made the planning process so easy. There’s so many toys and activities to keep kids engaged, learning, and having fun. The staff is constantly cleaning and sanitizing the toys and play areas, so cleanliness is definitely not an issue here. We’ve been coming to KPG with our daughter since before she could even walk. It’s the perfect place for her to go and expend some of that endless energy, and it makes putting her down for her afternoon nap MUCH easier (hint hint to parents out there!). Needless to say, we will keep coming back here for many years to come!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Melissa Spencer
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: We celebrated our daughter’s 3rd birthday here and OMG it was perfect!! The owner was extremely accommodating- you won’t get this anywhere else I guarantee! Our guests had a great time! The gallery space is phenomenal. It’s not too small and not overwhelmingly big. Parents can hang out in one spot and easily watch their kids as opposed to running around after them. My daughter had so much fun she didn’t want to leave! Moms- planning parties can be a lot. You will not be disappointed here. I just showed up and enjoyed myself stress free!! 😁😁😁

-----------------------

Reviewer: Catherine Duplin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: We went yesterday for the first time. My son just turned 3 and he had so much fun. I walked in thinking we’d spend an hour or so playing, get out of the house for a little, but we were there just shy of 4 hours, and my son still could have played longer. All the little areas are so cute and I felt each “building” was adequately equipped with toys and accessories to keep him entertained. It was extremely clean, and the worker was cleaning and disinfecting toys as the kids were finished playing with them. I also have a 5 month old, and I liked that I could sit on the benches in the middle of the room with him and still keep an eye on my older son no matter where he was playing. My son is already asking to go back, and we will most definitely be returning.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Fatima J
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: There are so many wonderful things to say about Kids Play Gallery! The staff are so kind, the place is so clean, open, and organized, and the staff consistently sanitizing after a play station has been used.

The toys are for most age ranges. Infants to 6 year olds will have such a blast here. My child keeps going back to work his imagination and play. We love especially love the diner which simulates a real life diner experience where my son loves to serve me play food and coffee outside the window. We enjoy pretending we are getting haircuts at the hair salon, our cars serviced at the auto center, more gas at the gas station, saving animals at the vet hospital, shopping for groceries at the play store, building at the train area, and saving lives and fighting fire while driving the fire truck and rescuing from the fire house. IT’S SO MUCH FUN!

My son had his 4th birthday at KPG. It was wonderful. The children had a blast. I called the owner a week in advance to plan, and she contacted me for a head count. She suggested that we pay our fee the day of the event which I loved because things sometimes happen and parties don’t go as planned. It also showed their honesty and loyalty.

I threw my son a themed party, so I paid for additional decorations that I wanted, but we could have kept it more simple. What I loved was that the owner let me come in a day before to prepare and offered me a little cart to put my supplies in so I could set up. I had my son with me and he enjoyed setting up for his party.

The following day, infants to 5 year olds came to the birthday party. The kids played, had so much fun, and then an announcement was made to go to the back room for pizza and cake. The employees there helped us serve the pizza which came with our package along with juice (which had already been set up), and and sliced the cake.

This was such an amazing party and served different age ranges. The kids and the parents who joined had such a great time and could not stop talking about it. Some of them had already been familiar with KPG, but loved the idea of having a party there, while others had never been to a play area like KPG and couldn’t wait to bring their children back.

Thank you so much to the employees who made my child’s birthday party so wonderful, so organized, and fun!

-----------------------

Reviewer: beyondTabu
Rating: 4/5

Review: This place is nice. The different stations have role play that kids see every day, like a fire station, gas station/ mechanic shop and the fast food rest.
Parents can also participate as well as relax on the benches provided while still keeping kids within eyesight.

My kid enjoyed the boat and fishing station as well as the police car.

Adding a few more interactive toys to the stations would make it perfect.

Reviewer: Ashley Ruttenberg
Rating: 5/5

Review: This is the cutest and my kids love it. Pros: exceptionally clean. Friendly staff. Open and easy to keep track of kids. Promotes imaginative play, building, and cooperation; not just bouncing on a trampoline or playing in a ball pit. Helps kids explore role play in areas they may not have and promotes crossing normal “gender roles” such as fishing, mechanic, hair salon. Cons: my kids can’t live here! Haha! Seriously, this place is the best!

Reviewer: Keli Dimari
Rating: 3/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: It's a nice space.  If I were rating just on the space itself, I would give that part a 5/5.  The "town" is cute and well made, and wonderfully sized just for kiddos.  A lot of thought was put into the original design, and details of the kids' buildings are good.  Staff was very polite, non-intrusive.  The carpet was clean and things were generally dust free.

Safety-wise, I have some serious concerns with flaking paint from toys marked "Made in China" on the bottom.  The flaking paint, a 1/5....I totally didn't let my kid keep playing with those, but it was super annoying to try to check all of them before he started playing; I shouldn't have to be checking all of their worn toys to keep my kid safe.  This should have been a safe place; they should remove toys from use for either repairs or replacement when they start to pose a hazard.

I was also concerned with the lack of social distancing and lack of facemasks, when the entire target audience for this is pretty much not vaccinated (all kids <12 don't have vaccines yet.)  CDC's guidance to relax masks is primarily for outdoor spaces and non crowded spaces, where they are assuming most of the population is vaccinated.  However, none of the kids are vaccinated and not all of the adults are.  The COVID stuff, I would give maybe a 2/5 because it would have been easy for them to verbally remind people as part of the introduction, to try to keep their child/children 6ft away from others.  I totally understand that it is difficult sometimes, but some of the parents are not watching their kids at all, and only one of the kids there wore a mask at all.  All of the kids were less than 12 years old (at the time of this post, 12+ can get vaccines, but none developed for <12).  It made me want to leave, because some people just let their kids rampage into your kid and touch you kid.  Also, I don't know if or how they sanitize the food-looking toys.  It would be great if they did that more often, since kids keep putting that stuff in mouths.

Many of the toys are incomplete (train tracks missing a ton of pieces, a lot of broken parts on tracks, broken bridges with sharp parts), worn out (pink rocking horse, for example, and some of the large to vehicles), or lacking a lot of things (only one real set of food in the diner....and not many tools in the car shop).  That might work if there is only one kid playing, but kids are kids, and many kids try to play with the same things at the same time.  Would be helpful if they sort of freshened up some of the toys, a bit.  Maybe they would consider donating some of the older toys and get things where the paint isn't coming off.  When you get to your kid's eye level and play with your kid, and the toys there, you can't help but start to notice a lot of wear and tear, a lot of incomplete things, some sharp edges, etc.

Don't get me wrong; I genuinely love the concept and that it exists.  I am delighted and extremely grateful for a place my child can play, even if it is raining or extremely hot outside....but I wish they would get rid of the old, broken, or incomplete toys and replace them.  There are things like Toys for Tots or other events they could go to, to pick up more complete sets or newer toys to make the store a bit better, without spending much.

The planning required minimal effort on my part as the owner, Rowena and her staff handled everything very professionally. They not only did all the set up but also finished all the clean up. We ordered pizza for kids and adults through them which was delicious. They have very reasonable event packages and everyone is very friendly. We love this place as it gives the perfect amount of stimulation to 1-10 year olds and it is super fun for the parents to watch them enjoy and use their imagination while playing. We highly recommend Kids Play Gallery to all parents who are looking for a safe space to organize a fun event or a play date for their kids, or an exciting play area where kids can go to to play any day.

Reviewer: Juliana Beaver
Rating: 3/5
Time: 5 years ago
Review: This place is very pretty and a great place to bring your small ones. However, my experience is based on an encounter from last week which I believe was handled poorly. I have 3 small kids. I arrived at 5:00pm on the dot, after getting all 3 of them ready for ONE full hour of play.

I should mention, I have an infant, a 2 year old and a 3 year old. Their opening house on their website claims they close at 6pm. When I got there, as I was about to pay, the cashier said, "just so you know,  you will need to leave at 5:30" - "excuse me?"
"yes, I need to start cleaning at 5:30, so you can't be inside the play area after 5:30" - after going back and forth about how it says on the website they close at 6pm, she then said "what's the difference? 5:50pm or 6? - same thing, I'm just telling you because the other day a customer got mad that I Was vacuuming while he was still inside and I don't want the same thing to happen today."

I stated that if that was the case, they need to update their website and say they close at 5:30pm, NOT 6pm. That is false advertising. I wasn't going to pay for 3 kids for 30 minutes of play. Not to mention, she could have at least offered a discount or honor the time it said on the website. She said I should come back another day and insisted she didn't know what the big deal was. She also stated the owner was aware of that, after I asked "is the owner aware of this?". Owner, if you are in fact aware, that is poor handling of your business. Please update the schedule on your website or kindly have your staff start cleaning AFTER 6pm.

If you are a mom, you understand how long it takes to get 2 toddlers and one infant out of the door. We ended up going back home. Thanks for the lovely afternoon!

Reviewer: Patti Kurtz
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 years ago
Review: I just had a terrible experience here. Came with my 7 month old and 4.5 year old in hopes of having fun together. AFTER I paid and when the person working the desk saw I had a baby in the stroller, she told me I was not allowed to bring in a stroller. My 7 month old had just fallen asleep (and not in the car seat because, well, read every advice column about not letting babies sleep in car seats for too long) I was so looking forward to actually playing with my 4 year old while my 7 month old was sleeping. I let my son go in to play only to be told minutes later that he was in some area he wasn't supposed to be in without socks. Not a problem except I didn't want to leave my baby. And it's principal - you won't let me bring my sleeping baby in but want me to be next to my son? I was checking my phone to see if there was any mention of no strollers on the website but there was nothing mentioned.

When I asked for my money back and had to tell my 4 year old we had to leave as this scenario was chaotic at best, she only THEN said I could bring in my stroller as long as the wheels were clean. I get it - no dirty strollers and they don't want loads of strollers jamming up the play areas. But it was not busy at all and there were so many areas I could have parked the stroller, out of harm's way.

Therefore we will never come back to this place and I'll make sure every mom who talks about this place knows about my terrible experience. Being a stay at home mom of two kids is hard enough. Even the play places make it hard on us?! There are times to make an exception and this was clearly one of them. No one would have been impacted by my sleeping baby in a stroller - the only one hurt by it was this sleep deprived mom.

Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I never usually write negative reviews but I have to say something. First of all, it is such a lovely place that is very clean and plenty of toys to play with. I had such a good time with with my 1 and 2 year old that I bought a 3 month pass BUT this place misrepresented and purposefully led me to believe that this pass was for 3 months when instead it was for 5 visits. I would have no problem buying the 5 visit option (in fact I would have been able to plan my visits better) instead I had to again pay the entrance fee (because who is saying no to two toddlers right at the door when we drove 30min to get there?!) it was very frustrating and the front desk attendant was pretty condescending and rude in her interaction with me regarding this exchange. Needless to say, I’m not coming back. I’m annoyed that I was mislead. I encourage you to ask ALL the questions before you buy.

Reviewer: C. Burton
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited Kids Ground, and while the play structures were sturdy, clean, and loads of fun, there were a few concerns that I couldn't ignore. Both play areas were well-maintained and provided an enjoyable experience for the kids. However, the floors throughout the facility left much to be desired in terms of safety as the “padded” areas are raised AND not secure. My toddler tripped several times, it's also concerning that there was no padding on the walls in the area with the “wooden chips”, which could be a potential hazard.

One particular area with "wooden chips" lacked floor padding, which struck me as odd. Additionally, there was a sign warning against allowing children to throw the wooden chips outside of the designated section, which somewhat limited the play possibilities.

Cleanliness was another issue that raised questions for me. While the play structures appeared clean, I had reservations about the overall cleanliness of the facility. Kids were required to remove their shoes, which is great, but the same rule didn't apply to adults. It can be quite unhygienic to wear shoes indoors, and this policy seemed inconsistent.

On the positive side, the staff at Kids Ground was friendly and accommodating, and they had refreshments for purchase. This added a touch of convenience to the visit. In summary, while Kids Ground has its merits, the safety and cleanliness concerns need attention to make it an ideal indoor playground for families.

Reviewer: Huma Haque
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 3 years ago
Review: I’m sharing this info so others don’t face the same unfortunate fate as me. I was exploring venues for my daughter’s birthday and called Kids Ground to inquire about date and time availability.  The employee I spoke to said the deposit was refundable up until 10 days before the day of the event. I remember this explicitly because I said let me talk to my husband and get back to you. Since I was under the impression I could cancel without penalty, I went ahead with the deposit, as I still needed to check the date/time with out of town guests.

Then, once I paid the deposit, I received an email confirmation that stated the deposit is non-refundable. I called Kids Ground three times and was bounced around from one staff member to another (apparently none of them could address my question about why they weren’t honoring what was told to me on the phone). I finally received an email from the same person who I had made the booking with - her memory failed her because she couldn’t recall our phone conversation and the fact that she told me the deposit was refundable up until 10 days before the event.

Hope they learn better customer service. I won’t be taking my kids here ever again.

In response to the business' response below: 1) The 2 staff members said they would get back to me about why I was the deposit was refundable and I never heard from either until a couple days later when the original employee I dealt with emailed me 2) I did not send back an email to the confirmation email. I responded to the waiver form email to acknowledge receipt of the form. For the record, Kids Ground signed the waiver for me. Maybe the employee I dealt with was new? Better and consistent training should be implemented to ensure that all employees know accurate policies so they can accurately address customer inquiries.

-----------------------

Review: Kidzville with the boys last night in Perry Hall!  I was pleasantly surprised how cool the place is and they didn’t try to upcharge everything.  There weren’t any arcade games which I loved.  No tickets to win and cash in for some unnecessary junk. I think admission was 13.99 and you need slipper socks.  They were $2.95 so very reasonable.  It was a big indoor playground with lots of stuff for the kids to do. Perfrct for a rainy night.

The only food they sold was cheese or pepperoni pizza.  You had to buy a whole pizza.  $18 for a 16 inch cheese which was reasonable.  The pizza was also really good.

In addition to the pizzas they had a freezer of ice creams.  They also had water, juice, sodas and coffee pods.  Waters were $2 and juice was $2.50.  Thats all they had which was perfect.  They didn’t even sell candy. Prices were very reasonable!

The boys were exhausted when we left there.

I will definitely go back.

Reviewer: Ian Hawes
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I attended a 5 year old’s birthday party with my 3 children, one of whom is 11 months old and requires a high chair. I asked the front desk if they had any high chairs, to which they told the party host it would be another $12.99 “add-on”. Considering they had already paid almost $500 to rent the space plus $200 in pizza, I didn’t want to burden them with another unreasonable fee. Literally every restaurant in the world has high chairs available for free, so charging a “rental fee” is unreasonable.

The website for We Rock The Spectrum says that you get 2 hours, but in reality you only get 1 hour of play time plus 1 hour for pizza/cake. In reality, this was a late afternoon party and most of the kids were done eating fairly quickly (or had already had lunch and weren’t hungry) and could’ve continued playing, but the staff did not hesitate to corral us into the small party room and tell the kids they wouldn’t be returning to the play area.

Overall this place is very disappointing if you’re attending or hosting a birthday party.

Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Reviewer: Aurora Webster
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: I held my daughters 3rd birthday here today. Me and my family have been here one other time, and were completely SOLD. Today just sealed the deal! Everyone was so sweet and considerate from the very beginning! They made sure they went above and beyond to make sure everything was clean and prepared! They had the complete itinerary planned, but always confirmed with me prior to calling the announcements. Everything has gone absolutely smooth as a whistle this entire experience, from the first visit until now. The pizza was delicious and my party loved it. I have never had a smoother child's birthday party!  We all really liked it especially since  the parents got to stay and play too! We got card credits for the arcade so the bigger kids (and husbands) got to have fun more their age! They even had an alcohol menu which was great for the parents! They even had their version of a build-a-bear, that wasn't there the last time we went, so it was a super great surprise!! And the kids loved it! Everyone that got the bear got a discount too! It's so clean and they seriously were so accommodating it wasn't even funny!! We will definitely be back!!! 10/10 RECOMMEND!!!! 💛💛💛💛

Reviewer: Leslie Timuat
Rating: 4/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: We have been going to Hyperkids (Derwood/ Rockville location) since it opened December 2024 at least twice a month and I can say that the facility is spacious and the mazes are challenging enough for my 4 year old. They do their best in keeping the place clean and equipment is well maintained overall but there is one part of the maze where the lights have been never replaced since the lights went out maybe around February 2025 keeping that corner dark. The staff go around making sure that the place is clean. Same goes with their restrooms.
The only critique I have is that the staff don't check that the wristbands of the parent and child match, thus not giving me the assurance of safety. Although I know as a parent this is primarily my job but with a place this big it could be hard to keep track of your child.
I would still recommend this place for it's cleanliness and my son has so much fun playing here and never gets bored.

The facility was not too crowded, even though we were there on a holiday, and everyone was so kind. They have refreshments and snacks available for a small price, in case you forget to pack your own, and toys and treats available for purchase, as well. Love this little gem, we’ll definitely be back! 💎

Reviewer: M. K.
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited 2 weeks ago
Review: This gym has become our go-to indoor gym. The staff is great and the gym has so many different activities that we discover something new to try every time. One of my kids has been coming since he was 18 months old and every time he's had a blast so this gym is great for the new walkers and up. My older kid is on the spectrum, and this was the one place he could go, not be overwhelmed and have tons to do. So many places are pretend play focused and it didn't work for him. We did a birthday party here and all the kids and parents said that they had a great time.

Reviewer: Alexis Santos
Rating: 4/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I did research around 2 months before my daughter's 4th birthday because she said she wanted to celebrate with both family and friends. I love celebrating my daughter so we went to a bunch of places near our area, and decided on We Rock the Spectrum Gaithersburg. It's not the first time I've had an event at a play gym, so I kind of knew what to expect. I met Pam when we came to visit, and she was also there to welcome me when I came to drop off decorations on the event date. I never do things half way, so if I plan a party, I'll do it in my style. I wanted to decorate it myself and since the room was free, she let me in and said I could set up. The party was a success. All the kids had a blast! We had the whole area for 2 hours, 4-6pm, the time flew and around 5:40pm, I asked Pam if I could extend time, an hour or 30 min. I felt Kristina was rude in telling me it would be $175 for an extra hour and she was clearly annoyed. I looked over at Pam and tried asking, but we left it at an extra 30 minutes for $75. The party for the kids was great, but I left feeling a certain way. Kristina had charged me $500 for the room (which is now $600), $75 for an extra 30 minutes, and $30 for hanging some items. They ordered the food for us and the pizza box had a receipt charge of $137.24, but she charged me $185 for the food. It felt very nickel and dime. I didn't leave feeling that good considering the party went well, because of this and how she acted that day. I paid $75 for an extra 30 minutes til 6:30pm, and at 6:20pm, she started yelling "5 more minutes!." It could have been better, and when my husband asked me why the food was more expensive than it should have been, I called Pam to ask and shared my feelings. She apologized and explained Kristina was having a bad day and refunded to me the tip I left of $50. The space is very good for kids, the service we got could have been a lot better. I was going to leave 3 stars, but she may have been just having a bad day. The space and zipline is awesome for a kids birthday party!

-----------------------

Reviewer: jessi
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Kristina the owner was very rude. She lacked kindness and respect. I parked at their reserved spot around 8:15 pm way after business hours and she asked me to move my car very rudely and continued to berate me as I was standing outside ready to move my car. I understood I was in the wrong I had no problem moving my car but there was no need for her to be so rude and unkind. Please treat people with kindness and respect.
Edit to owners response:
I completely understand and if I would have seen the place was operating I would have absolutely not parked there. The place was clearly closed and all lights were off. The problem is the way Kristina handled the situation and how disrespectful she was.
Edit to Liza’s response:
I never said I wasn’t in the wrong. I already stated I had no problem moving my car because I understood Kristina completely. My first impression of Kristina was straight unkindness and rudeness. I’m sure she has a wonderful side to her but she did not approach me or talk to me with kindness. I left 1 review about her actions towards me and now I have to respond to 2 reviews within a couple hours. Kristina can have her morals while being kind and respectful. I don’t have to continue explaining myself, Kristina knows how she treated me and that there was no need for her to react that way towards me. I hope nothing but the best for Kristina, just remember to treat people the way you would like to be treated.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jennifer Corroon

Reviewer: Katie J

Review: We love We Rock the Spectrum! The staff are so kind, supportive, and affirming, and the gym itself is great. There is also a calming sensory room.

We’ve also taken advantage of their parents’ night out and our son, who is usually slow to warm up, had a blast!

The mirrors and layout of the rooms make it easy to keep an eye on your kid without hovering, which was especially great for us as we had a 2 year old who loved the make believe play area while our 5 year old loved the zip line and trampoline.

Reviewer: Kelly Hurst
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: All the positive reviews are spot on - this is an ideal place for a birthday party! As the name suggests, it is a welcoming place for kids of all abilities and needs, which I love - but honestly we just went because it's a great place for any kid to have a party. We found it based on word of mouth from other local parents on Facebook and I can see why everyone loves it. We had my 7-year-old's party here but I will come back for my younger kid's party at some point too, maybe multiple times :)  One thing I love is how there is stuff for younger siblings too (my 3y/o loved it). The owners Pam and Kristina take care of everything so it is super low stress - we brought in cake, drinks, and goodie bags, and they handled everything (helped us bring stuff in, did set-up, handled trash, they even cut and serve the pizza and cake).  Oh and even ordering the pizza. Having seemingly little stuff like that off your plate is so nice. For $35 they put up themed decorations and that was worth it.  I had considered a couple other play places (which are great) but I knew they were just going to be too big, loud, and overwhelming for me and my toddler, whereas this was perfect and all kids and parents were happy!  Oh and it is CLEAN which is always appreciated, including two easy bathrooms right there with a big changing area for folks with littles. They were very thoughtful in creating this place.

Reviewer: Tracy Edwards, Real Estate Agent
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I saw this place on Instagram (technically another location ) but searched and found the location in Gaithersburg open on the day we wanted to go.  This place is a hidden gem.  This is a place for ALL kids to feel included. The gym has various equipment for sensory processing like climbing structures, various swings, trampoline, and zip line. It has a play area with toys and arts&crafts area. There is also a  rock climbing wall. My son played here for HOURS. He loved it.

What I loved as a parent is that it wasn’t packed crowded like so many other kids play places. Unlike some kids gyms, you don’t have to pay a monthly membership and can come to open gym. Monthly memberships and play packages are available if you want. It’s also very clean!  We were there in a Sunday afternoon and were mostly just my son and 1-2 other kids the whole time. Started to get busy as we left.

The only downside is they have a toy store. I understand they have to have additional revenue streams but it’s hard as a parent to deal with a small child whining about wanting a toy. Just be prepared!

Be sure to check their Facebook page for open gym hours as they do close for private birthday parties.

When you walk in, it'll look like there aren't many toys but for kids on the spectrum, it's like sensory heaven. From multiple swings to either activate or calm the mind to a giant trampoline that encourages kids to interact when jumping together and then there's a sensory slide alongside a regular slide.

They also have a calming room and a study room. For some kids on the spectrum, the ability to go on a swing or jump on a giant trampoline between study breaks can make the biggest difference in how they learn.

The owners clearly thought everything through the I highly recommend going out and supporting this small business.

Reviewer: Nyx Yadon
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: TL;DR: They REALLY need to invest in a staff member to just supervise the play area to ensure kids are following the rules.

We have been coming there for about a year, but I don’t think we will be back unless things change. While the place is always clean, there are tons of play structures and toys, the front staff is always nice, and everything is padded, there are some significant concerns that will keep us from returning. Unfortunately, every time we have been there (we have gone 7+ times and have a membership) we have had to leave because of older children behaving unsafely and not following the rules. In general, parents largely don’t supervise their children here, and seem not to care if they follow the rules or behave safely. This isn’t an isolated incident but a trend. Parents/guardians sit in the sitting area on phones and laptops neglecting to supervise their kids, I suppose they figure it’s all padded and closed in so why bother? Since the playground is open birth-age 7, this creates a really unsafe environment for the younger kids. When my son was 18 months old, he was pushed down the flight of stairs here (luckily it’s padded) which resulted in an emergency visit later that night. Today the older kids were throwing the sit-on balls at each other and playing a game that involved swinging them around and whacking each other at full force and full speed. It’s something like this every single time we’ve come. Imagine recess but with no recess monitor. I understand that the model here is like that of an outdoor playground without paid supervision, but the way that it is enclosed seems to motivate parents to pay less attention to their kids since they can’t really wonder off. I’m not suggesting full provided care, just someone on staff to make sure people actually follow the rules inside.

I’m disappointed that we won’t be able to come back, because my son loves it, but it really isn’t safe for the little ones with older kids able to do anything they want regardless of rules or safety.

-----------------------

I drove 50 min away to come to this location pikesville is 10 min closer but by the pictures with the plane it was what he wanted and glad I did was told this location was the biggest and the newest. Wish they would come start on closer to the Baltimore county side by white marsh or Dundalk or somewhere closer to these areas so I wouldn’t be that long of a drive. But I can promise you we will do the drive again cuz he loved it probably would have been better if he had kids to play with besides mommy but we had fun.

I will tell the location is ducked off you will not find it without gps and you won’t find it typing the name into maps you have to put the address. But no matter where you come from it won’t be a waste of a drive, it was very clean, the staff was friendly and with COVID it probably hurt there business people should help them out so they don’t close with such a lovely business. I will try to get the word around for this beautiful toddler place. Oh lastly the pricing it is 13 for 1 kid, 11 per kid for 2 siblings, 10 per kid for 3 siblings, and if you have a group of 10 kids a minimum don’t remember the price just know it was reasonable, they also have memberships that never expire and can use it any location.

JUST GO HAVE A BLAST AND IT WILL BE WELL WORTH YOUR TIME WITH YOUR LITTLE ONES}

{Reviewer: Mindy Spitz
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: BeeZee Sensory Gym is a game-changer for children of all abilities, especially those with autism. The facility is thoughtfully designed with a variety of sensory-rich equipment—swings, climbing walls, crash pads, and tactile boards—that cater to diverse sensory needs. The staff are compassionate, well-trained, and attentive, creating a safe and welcoming environment where kids feel free to explore and engage.

The space is clean, brightly lit, and organized, with clear zones for high-energy play and calming activities.

Overall, this sensory gym is a haven for children to grow, play, and develop at their own pace. It’s a must-visit for families seeking an enjoyable, and supportive environment. We will be recommending this place for our kiddos!

-Mindy Spitz
Divine Steps Therapy

Review: Me and my son came here on Friday 5/31 a round 4:30 ish and had a great time the employee is very sweet and shes very polite and a great conversationalist the place was nice I also appreciate her for finding my son’s tablet as we left it after having so much fun the membership we used is also very great you save 6$ a visit will be back I will say the equipment could use a update

Reviewer: J S
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I recently took my daughter to the Pikesville Bubala Indoor Playground location at 3:50 p.m. The sign on the door said 10-5 p.m. It appeared to be closed as the lights were partially off, however, the door was open. We went inside only to find the employee hidden in one of the play areas with her tablet and it appeared she had been napping. When she saw us she got up and said they were closing because there were no customers. I stated that the hours listed said until 5 p.m. but the employee insisted that she was closing. I asked he if my daughter could play for the remaining of the time left and the employee said no. My daughter was visibly upset, and at that point, it wasn’t worth the argument, the employee had clearly decided to close, regardless of the fact that we were paying customers. It’s disappointing to see this location not being cared for, especially since it’s the closest indoor playground in the Pikesville area geared toward younger children.

I truly hope the owner takes the time to reevaluate the customer service standards and considers hiring staff who are genuinely committed to creating a positive experience for families, rather than simply showing up for a paycheck. Perhaps the owner would consider selling to someone who lives in the community and has a genuine passion for revitalizing this Bubala location, bringing it back to what it once was, or even making it better. This place has so much potential, and it would be a shame to see it close down permanently.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Geoffrey Clapp
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We hosted our daughters 3rd birthday party here and although the children had fun in the play area, we won’t be returning for two important reasons:

1) The chairs provided for the children are hazardous because of their design, causing them to collapse under the toddlers weight and usually leading the kids to bang their faces or chins on the table in front of them. This happened to at least 7 children in our party and parents had to constantly catch their kids to prevent more of them from falling and crashing into the table when just trying to sit on the chairs. It sounds trivial but it’s a major safety issue that really worsened our party experience.

2) The equipment and interior is pretty run down and worn out. There’s just no way to not notice how worn and dirty everything is. Because you’re paying the same amount as having your party at a nicer and newer facility, I would not recommend hosting a kids party here since you really don’t get the value for what you’re paying for.

Reviewer: Ena A Waskiewicz
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I shared all of this including pictures in an email to the owner. But I wanted to be sure I share the experience here as well. I threw a party for my 4 yo son today at Bubala in Reisterstown.

The party room itself was extremely run down. The paint is peeling and the furniture is torn apart - I’ve attached photos. I understand this is a children’s play center but as someone who paid over $20 per child attending this party; my expectation was that the party room would look presentable and I wouldn’t need to figure out how to hide the things which were falling apart.

The chairs in the party room are a hazard for small children. We had at least 5 kids fall down while sitting and the chairs collapse in on them. The bottoms are plastic instead of rubber; this combined with the vinyl flooring made them a liability and very easy for kids to hurt themselves.

Lastly, the person working today…I was told I’d have a host to help me decorate. Thank goodness I had my parents meet me because I received no help. The person working was lackluster, at best. They didn’t inform me when the pizzas arrived. Multiple guests shared how unpleasant the person working was at check in. The most conversation I got was when they told me we needed to leave in 10 mins for another party coming in and when they were ready to take my payment.

The saving grace was that my son and the kids had fun in the play space. I wouldn't recommend paying for a party here unless the above it ratified.

The dedication to maintaining a clean and hygienic environment at Bubala's is truly commendable. The indoor playground itself continues to be a fantastic space for children to explore and play. Reviewer: Shanley Pearl

Review: Honest review! Read the reviews before you book a party, because I read the 1 star reviews, I avoided issues and had a wonderful time! My son had his 1st birthday there, perfect venue. We had soooo much fun.

I see people saying the staff is young & there’s no management on site, true! But I’m young too so I had a lot of fun with the staff lol. They legit just follow the rules to a T, if that bothers you idk what to tell you.

PAY THE EXTRA $100 TO BRING YOUR OWN FOOD! The pizza provided sucks lol. I don’t know *why* it costs more to bring food but it does.

The projector doesnt work. It’s there, but it’s not usable so don’t plan to use it.

You will get 30 mins to set up, so create all your decorations and organize them at home. Do your best! This is a children’s party not a wedding, the room is cute even without decor! I know we all love our kids but how much decorations does a kiddie party need?

WE HAD SO MUCH FUN! My son had fun, all the kids had fun & we made amazing memories. It is not a grandiose venue, but it’s affordable and fun. I still give it 5 stars & I might have his 2nd birthday party there too 🎉🥳

When the pizza arrived it the establishment policy that we should feed 25 kids from one large pizza that is cut into tiny slices. I paid to have an extra hour on my party to be told that I would only have until 6:30 because it policy that the facility is clean and closed at 7pm. Although the staff is friendly they are merely children running a business. They blame everything on management, but there’s no management representation on site! Reviewer: Janette Ho
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: Never and I say never ever go to kidz city in odenton. I booked a two hour play time. We rented out the entire building. Booking was not easy and lacking communication. This should have been a red flag! I was finally able to talk to a lady over the phone who sent me a link to pay. I was able to complete the booking online through the link.
About 30 minutes into our playtime it all started going down hill.
I was yelled at and completely disrespected by someone who claims to own the establishment. For what? I moved one of the seating sections to sit down and watch my kids play after a long day with my friends. There one was chair out on the floor and I had given that to my pregnant friend. I went over to grab some seating to bring it closer so I could chat with my friends and we could all still watch our kids play! When I started moving the seating he starts yelling at me from the front really aggressively. I had to walk over to him to even understand what he was yelling about. He started coming at my how it was against the rules to move it. I read everything, EVERYTHING, I sign. I read the rules. No where did I say I couldn’t move seating or I wouldn’t have done it. It was rude, disrespectful, and utterly embarrassing. Unfortunately I came back at him and got defensive and could have responded better myself. Not to make excuses but I had a really rough morning with work and was trying to just relax and enjoy watching my kids play in a indoor playground for the first time in a year and a half.

He continued to push it and was completely unprofessional. Full out screaming at me. He kept saying he had other chairs he could get me but instead of just getting the chair kept yelling at me until I raised my voice and told him to just get me the chair to sit instead of continuing to yell at me. It was gross. He got a chair and spent the rest of the time in the back office. we cleaned up and cleared out well before our time was over. I was buckling my kids in their car seat outside in my car when he then comes out and approaches me. He then starts asking for more money! I had paid online already. It was so shady feeling, he started taking pictures of me, my car, and my license plate and it was super weird. I informed him I paid through the link and obviously he saw that or we wouldn't have been let in to play in the first place. Weird and so shady. I will never ever come back. Beware. I posted in my moms group and apparently I'm not the only one who has been treated poorly. He wouldn't give his name but he stated he owned the place.

-----------------------

Review: I have not been to this place; however, I feel the need to share my experience on the phone with them with everyone. After checking their website for pricing, I called to ask if outside food was allowed to be brought into the facility. The lady on the phone advised outside food is allowed. I then confirmed the price on Mondays is $11 per child, as per their website. The lady on the phone continued to explain "Mondays are half off days, so the price per child on Mondays is $8".... Excuse me, what?? How is half off of $11 $8??? Last time I checked half off of 11 was $5.50. The lady on the phone then became slightly irritated and rude. Needless to say, I will not be going to this facility if they are going to try to rip off their customers. What they really need to do is change their website to reflect Monday pricing as $16 and half off of 16 is indeed $8 but the website does not say that and I will post a picture to prove same.

Review: I just had my son’s 2nd Birthday Party at Kidz City in Odenton Maryland and have never felt an urgent/strong need to write a review like this.  The best decision ever made.  I initially planned on having it in my community’s clubhouse as I only planned to have just a reception of food and not carry the burden of party planning.  But I somehow visited Kidz City and just knew that I wouldn’t have to worry about entertaining kids if I had it there.  Every child I saw leaving the location was crying to their parent to go back.  All I had to bring was some food, cake, and balloons.  THEY HANDLED EVERYTHING FOR ME! They even got Pizza for the kids.  As soon as my guests arrived, they immediately were playing around with their kids.  No burden of entertainment for me.  It’s like every parent of a toddler or big kid’s dream.   ALL THE KIDS AT THE PARTY (ages 7 months - 10yrs old) HAD A BLAST.   The staff assisted with pumping balloons, setting up my picture backdrop/balloon garland, and the set up for the cake table. {Reviewer: Jill Janaitis
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Playground itself is 4 stars but it is designed for young children and it is almost always overcrowded with older kids running and roughhousing with no (active) parental supervision and no monitoring by the mall itself. I understand if they are older sibling of toddlers/preschoolers but they should be told to look out for little kids and let them enjoy the climbers first. On more than one occasion I’ve had a child tell me their parent was shopping and they were there alone. We try to go at off hours but lord help you if it’s raining.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Montserrat Schoenborn
Rating: 4/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Spacious, clean and age-appropriate. It has various themes and it seems fun. HOWEVER, these things turn pointless when there are children WAY OLDER jumping and stomping around. This play area clearly seemed to be designed for the younger little ones and the older - pre teens taking over the whole area makes it unsafe and a hazard. Wish parents (glued on their phones) and security staff were more conscious about this.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Allison Taylor
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I am really upset with our visit. This playground is clearly for ages 1-4 judging by the set up and equipment, and we went specifically for my 1 year old to crawl around. There were about 6 children, all around 6-8, rough housing, throwing each other around,  playing tag and being maniacs in this baby play area. I put my baby on the ground to crawl around and he was loving it, but almost got trampled 3-4 times because the other large children were not even paying attention, and no parent was telling them to be aware of other children. So we had to leave, my baby was screaming because he loved it so much and we couldn't stay because these other large children were playing in a baby playground. The rules say you must be under 42" to play so there was no reason for them to be there. Columbia mall, you need to do better. These kids have other areas to rough house in the mall.

Reviewer: Amanda Lee

Review: Imaginarium has been such a foundational part of our homeschool story. In the early days when I wasn’t sure I could do this, the support I found here reminded me that I wasn’t alone.

It’s more than a program—it’s a safe space. You know your kids are truly seen here. The staff care deeply, everything is clean and thoughtful, and most of all, they get to know you. Your family becomes part of the community, not just another name on a list.

From the workshops and enrichment classes to the unforgettable events like LEGO Night, the Living History Museum, and that emotional moment watching our oldest graduate from kindergarten, Imaginarium has helped us shape a learning journey full of joy, confidence, and connection.

Reviewer: Se'rah Foster
Rating: 5/5

Review: I’d you desire a safe place for your children to explore, play and be creative.. this is it! Even better is the area for parents. I come here regularly and work while my children play. It’s such a friendly, clean and inviting environment.

I liked the place so much that I now teach there in their homeschool program too! The owner provides ample opportunities for the children of our community from play, tutoring, birthday parties, and a complete homeschool enrichment program.

I have been present for clean up time between open play and homeschool classes and I have been present for after hours clean up. The team does a great job and cares about your children’s time there to be in a clean environment. The team worked together to get a good sanitize down before the next group of kids came in and end of day clean up is always a good deep clean.

Last thing to point out is the pirates cove! My kids love the art supplies provided, the crafts available and all the items in the shop up front.

Overall cannot say enough about the Imaginarium! The place has become a staple in my children’s (and my own!) lives 💗

The bathrooms have CLEAN changing tables, and the snack area has complimentary tea and coffee! Love it!!
Did I mention the staff is very attentive and helpful? They will assure everyone is safe.
They have a few different play structures with different surprises inside each one, kitchen, dinos, trains, and more. There is even air hockey, building blocks, and crafts for the older kiddos to do if they tag along. I just can’t wait to watch Imaginarium grow and see what other cool stuff they have to offer in the future. This place is awesome!!! 10/10 Recommend!

Reviewer: Cassondra West

Review: We love Imaginarium for many reasons, the first being the space is big enough for kids to run around and make friends, but not too large where I feel the need to know exactly where they are at all times while playing. They do sometimes have music playing, but families don't have to shout over it to be heard.

The staff are friendly folk, it's affordable, you can bring food in and sit in the seating area (sans peanut products), its not overstimulating, and it's just a gem of a place to have local to us in SOMD.

Reviewer: Angie Ponce de Leon
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I took my 20 month old daughter to Imaginarium today, and I was really disappointed. First, it was FILTHY. The toys were NOT clean at all, the wall decor and houses were covered in thick dust like they hadn't been cleaned since they opened, the equipment was covered in months worth of dirty handprints. At one point, my daughter was playing in the blue foam blocks and picked up a huge ball of hair. Disgusting. I get that children aren't always the cleanest little people, but for that reason they should have a daily cleaning crew. Clearly they do NOT. Secondly,  the rules state socks must be worn... but kids were barefoot. I get it's summer but kids are climbing all over the place... where sweaty feet are. Finally, there needs to be an age/height limit. There were huge kids like 6-7 yos running around, rough-housing, putting the littles at risk of getting run over and hurt. I thought this place was exclusively for younger children ( < 5) but I guess not. I really wanted to like this place because it has great potential.  It is a great idea and has a lil lounge and store... but I cannot get fast how gross it was. I should have taken more pictures but I was too busy making sure my daughter wouldn't get run over by the big kids. :/ Sadly, I won't be taking my kiddo back.

Reviewer: Sara Seifert
Rating: 3/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: I really wanted to love this place, but it was underwhelming. IMO the price is a little too steep for what you get.

The play structures are super cool. I loved the art section and the reading nook, but there’s so much unrealized potential.

There are little toys scattered throughout like legos, train sets, magna tiles, and play food, but it’s such a mess. We couldn’t play with some of them because they were missing pieces, or didn’t seem to actually go together. I get it, tons of kids come every day, but there are so many organizational options that could be used to actually encourage play and imagination, like the name says.

The art section was super cute, but again, underwhelming. The only things available were construction paper, a few random crayons and colored pencils, dried out markers with mixed tops, scissors, and chalk. There are so many ways to make this more exciting and organized. Especially since we paid to play here.

The reading nook is a great concept, but it’s right next to the giant castle/ship structure, so it doesn’t really lend itself to reading. There was a cool, giant bear, but that got put away because someone used it as a landing pad for the slide. The books seemed pretty random and old. Everything in this place could be so much more!

I was also disappointed in kid behavior. I know there’s not much employees may be able to do, but it’s dangerous. Kids throwing things and roughhousing on top of two-story structures shouldn’t be acceptable when people are paying money to play here.

In all honesty, I feel like I just took my kids to an indoor playground and paid $22 for it. I don’t think it’s worth it. It could be in the future, but it’s not right now.

Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: This place is the best for toddlers.  I’ve brought both my kids, under age 5 ,and they always have a blast. Everything they have is age appropriate for young kids and enough to get them excited and tired. The bathrooms are spacious, clean, and stocked. My only critiques, and I write this in the hopes it helps,  is that they kept up with what’s supposed to be engaging. They have a small balloon area in a trampoline but the balloons were old and deflated. Seems like that’s something the front desk could easily keep up with.  The screen where the ball pit is, is designed for kids to throw balls at it but it was off the whole time we were there. The music is only on for a few minutes and no one cares to turn it back on. The toys for the stations are not enough and  missing completely. For example the doctor station doesn’t have any actual doctor toys like a stethoscope, tongs, pretend bandages.  The cafe station has nothing. The grocery store has toys but also a lot the things in there are broken.  I think if the stations had the adequate toys kids would actually pretend play.

Review: My granddaughter loves coming to Junior Playland, which she calls “Ball House.” Meryem at the front desk always greets my granddaughter by name and knows her favorite song is “Baby Shark” so will play the song for my granddaughter.
Junior’s Playland is clean and safe, the bathrooms are well maintained (as the grandmother to a newly potty-trained toddler, we visit the bathrooms often!).
We have the unlimited visit package which is extremely reasonably priced. My granddaughter and I enjoy our time at Junior’s!

Review: I took my two toddlers here today and they had a great time! The concerning (and completely unsafe!) issue was a “balloon pit”. I told a staff member that balloons are a choking hazard, and she took out some of the popped balloons in the space. Truly a deadly item and children continued popping balloons/ playing in the area. This play space clearly markets itself to toddlers but I won’t be returning while the space is set up in an unsafe way.

Reviewer: Bouchra E
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: I had an absolutely wonderful experience with Maryam while organizing my kids’ birthday celebration.

From the very beginning, she was incredibly responsive, patient, and detail-oriented, making the planning process so much easier for us.

Maryam truly went above and beyond to ensure that every detail was perfectly executed, which made the day both seamless and special for us.

Her positive energy and genuine enthusiasm created a warm and inviting atmosphere for both the kids and parents. She was proactive in addressing any last-minute needs and always had a thoughtful solution ready.

The level of care and attention she put into making sure my children and their guests were happy was truly impressive. I can’t thank her enough for her dedication—she turned what could have been a stressful event into a joyful, memorable experience.

I highly recommend working with Maryam for anyone looking to plan a special birthday.

Reviewer: Gaby Pham

Review: I’m a bit late reviewing as we hosted my toddler’s birthday here late summer. It was perfect for our group of 20 kids + up to 2 adults per kid. There might have been 4-6 other kids not part of the party there, so if we had invited more, I feel it would’ve been a private party. It’s not huge, but we liked the space and being able to see all the kids without feeling like we had to run around searching for them. The party room was a comfortably fit everyone. Meryem and her staff set up with the table, decor, and donuts, drinks and goodie bags we brought (they allow outside vendors!) She kept in touch with me beforehand to keep track of headcount and confirm pizza order. Everything from setup to cleanup was smooth, our friends even ended booking their kids birthday party here!

We highly recommend Junior Playland to other parents. It's a fantastic environment for little ones to play and explore!

Reviewer: Esin Ozdag
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Had my daughter's 4th birthday party here. We chose this venue because it's my daughter's favorite indoor playground in the area. Kids from age 2-7 were there and they all had a blast! The private back room was large with plenty of tables and chairs for kids and adults. Bathrooms are also large, individual, and have good diaper changing stations. Juniors provided themed decoration, tablecloths, plates, cutlery, juice, pizza, and balloon stands. We chose to use our own decoration to match the unicorn theme. Meryem helped set up and was super helpful and always available for whatever we needed.

As for the play area, there is a great variety of things, including ball pit, merry-go-round, climbing area, pretend play, trampoline, slide, and more. 100% recommend for birthdays or anytime!

Time: Edited 10 months ago
Review: Updating my review to 3 stars. My experience with having a birthday party there was great and very hassle free. Maryam was very accommodating. The front entrance remains to not be gated.

This place has gone a bit downhill since it opened. It's not the safest because there is no door barrier at the entrance so your kid can run out at any time, and they open a door in the back as well.

The website says the max age limit is 10 years of age. When it first opened, they would tell customers at the entrance that the limit is 8-9 years. Today they told me that the age limit is 12 years old. A lot of older kids (prob older than 12) were playing there and they were playing ROUGH. NOT safe for small kids. I don't understand what business kids older than 8ish have in this playground. It is def. geared toward little ones but nobody is controlling that. They just want your money and it's a bit on the pricey side considering how small it is.

Review: I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with both the terms of the unlimited access membership I purchased for my two children and the unprofessional conduct of your staff members, Ivy and Brianna. Furthermore, the interactions with your staff were disappointing. Both Ivy and Brianna were not only rude during our conversations, but they also found humor in our situation, which is unacceptable and does not reflect well on your establishment.

Review: I recently had my daughter 2nd birthday party here. She had a great time. I love how the party room is private for your guest. The staff was so helpful during decor set up. Review: This is our favorite place! Our sons 6 and 7 both love coming here. We have a membership (amazing military discount) and come every weekend. She helped us decorate and break down after the party.

The place is always clean, including its bathrooms. You can’t beat easy parking and tons of food options around the corner. It gets busy sometimes but never to the point where kids’ safety is compromised.

We are so grateful to have this indoor playground nearby! Wish I could give 100 stars because with two very active boys and a harsh winter, this place has been a dream.

Review: Our 2.5 year old had a blast. He couldn't wait for us to finish the registration before he took off running to the toddler area. The customer service was great at check-in. There is plenty of shoe storage. They also have a small café for you to order food and sit down. There are four bounce houses of various sizes, three step 2 roller coasters, a couple of areas to build with blocks, pretend play areas, an indoor playground with multiple slides, enclosed area for kids under 2, Lego area, and bumper cars. I’ve been to HyperKidz in Ashburn and JollyYolly in Fairfax, way better service, cleaning, friendlier/professional staff (better at HyperKidz) and even if you come last minute before closing. They let you play with everything and don’t close off anything until closing time. It’s absolutely ridiculous that BeeHive does this with dirty equipment and toys. Too many rules . We paid $35 for a 22 month old and 10 month and extra $5 for the third adult. Ridiculous pricing and no discount given. We complained to staff and they just smiled… absolutely unprofessional. This place will go out of business. Mark my word. Don’t waste your time coming here with your babies and go to HyperKidz or at least JollyYolly. Way cleaner, they ACTUALLY CLOSE AT THEIR GIVEN TIME and not start closing every single play area 30 minutes before.

Review: I had my daughter’s birthday on January 8th at 3:30. I paid spent $800 total overall and it was the worst birthday ever. There was two birthdays at the same time and they allowed a lot of public guests as well it was so crowded I could not keep an eye on my kids and our party with 2 hour limit it seemed impossible to let the kids play and eat and cut the cake. They advertise a dedicated party host but the girl helped me at the beginning and never showed up until the party was over, they ran out of cups and napkins we had to wait for them to go buy from outside and bring it. They also placed my daughters unicorn cake away from the decorations so we have the plain side on all of our pictures. The banner on the back also read Irthday  instead of birthday, they also gifted her a size 7 t shirt when she is only 2. It also mentioned thank you cards for guests we did not get this either. I called a few times to voice my concerns the employees either pretended to be the manager and ignore me or they said manager is in a meeting. I got a call from the manager who just apologized and that’s it there was no compensation for all the bad things we experienced from their service. They do not keep tabs on children either like chucky Cheese so if someone picks up your child and walks out the door with anyone they don’t care and don’t know . I gave them a chance to call me back but they haven’t so I am writing my experience for other parents here. Do not have a birthday here it’s a waste of money. They do not have the best service and packages are not as advertised.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Brenda Chavarria
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Location: Not good
Cleanliness: OK
Customer Service: Terrible
Playground: Very Good

I would like to first say that this is my first ever Google review. I am one to read reviews but not write one. Having that said, I felt strongly about sharing this experience with fellow parents looking for an indoor playground in Woodbridge. Our first impression was not great as it is located in a sketchy area of Woodbridge but once we got inside we were impressed with the size and amount of activities offered. The staff is mainly made up of young women and unfortunately our first interaction with a staff member working the front desk was terrible. The young lady was clearly irritated from the moment my son and I walked in, as if we inconvenienced her by our presence.  This comment is intended for management/ owner  to train staff members to use common courtesy with customers. Mind you, we were not walking in late or right before closing for the staff member to have such a bad attitude towards us. We were simply trying to get in..anyways, after a very rude interaction, my son enjoyed his time while we were there. He is 2 and enjoys just running around.  The staff members would walk by every few minutes to reorganize toys but they would outwardly show their discontent while picking up. Very rude attitude towards the kids and parents. They clearly do not enjoy being there and doing their job. Although, no one says anything about the staffs bad attitude, parents  and children can sense it. That is not the environment a “play”ground should have. Management- please train your staff to be courteous to parents and children using the facility and paying $14 per kid for only 1.5 hr of play time. In addition, although the closing time says 7pm,  they sometimes close as early as 6:30pm at their discretion. If you get there thinking you will get 1.5hrs of playtime, you end up getting  less because they decide to close early but you still pay for the 90 min- unfair business practice. Hours of operation are inconsistent. All in all, the place offers a good amount of space and activities for kiddos do exert energy but that is IT. Expect nothing from staff but bad looks and nasty attitudes. All that matters is seeing my son have fun and for that and only that reason I would go back. I wish there were more options in the area, but for now, this will do.

-----------------------
