Profiting off of selling the dream....while slowly cheapening the dream from his gated mansion. Never again, Badlands.

Reviewer: Kate Hannon
Rating: 5/5

Review: We love Badlands so much! We’ve been coming here regularly since the weekend they opened and it’s continued to delight and entertain my children as they’ve grown. There’s always something new and interesting for them to do (today there was a drumming circle! How fun!)
As a parent, I love being able to kick back a bit here and relax while the kids play. I’m never worried they’re going to get out the door or taken by someone- I don't even get worked up when I lose sight of the toddler. There’s “security” at the door and a lot of staff around to help- I know my kids are safe even when I cant see them. This makes it a great place to come and do a bit of work or chat w friends while the kids get out some energy!

My single greatest complaint is actually just hovering parents. Hear me out- If you’ve ever been lucky enough to come to Badlands on a low key day, when all the parents are sitting at the cafe and the kids are running free- it’s incredible. You can sit w your laptop and see your kids almost wherever they are- bc there are no groups of grownups standing in the way blocking your view. There are staff all over the place to help keep kids safe on the play equipment- it’s an absolutely perfect environment to teach your kids some independence and allow them to take some risks.
Also, I wish they were open after school for a few hours! 😉

Reviewer: Marta Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 years ago
Review: Badlands is my all time favorite place to take kids.  I have 3 kids and I've been to Many places. They have teenagers on staff to keep an eye on the kids and to keep them engaged. The set up in it's own is inventive and encourages young curiosity. They have an indoor landscape of large climbable rocks and mountains, a faux forest with a maze of trees for kids to run through. A metal dome jungle gym, just like you would see on a playground is usually surrounded by climbing/hanging kids of all ages. The floor of the entire play area is padded, rocks, mountains, all of it. They have bleachers with large flat hand drums for the kids to play. They offer various  activities every hour. A loudspeaker let's you know what is happening and where to go in the room to participate. We even met an iguana during our last visit! There are many tables of various heights surrounding the play area. They offer all kinds of food and snacks, and drinks vary from almond milk to Chardonnay.
My grandson never wants to leave and I never have to stand up.  Bless you Badlands!

Review: Scramble in Alexandria has been a wonderful part of our daughter’s early development. As a parent of an infant, finding a safe, clean, and engaging indoor play space is priceless—and Scramble delivers on all fronts. Our daughter absolutely loves coming here and lights up the moment we walk through the doors.

The toddler area is thoughtfully designed, with plenty of soft obstacles and supportive surfaces that helped her learn how to walk and safely explore her surroundings. The equipment is age-appropriate, clean, and well-maintained, which gives us peace of mind every time we visit.

They even know our daughter by name, which speaks to the personal care and attention they give every family. I want to give a special shoutout to Ms. Cora—she’s truly the best! Reviewer: Cheyenne Farris
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I am disappointed to have to leave a 2 star review for this establishment, but I feel as if I need to so other parents can have the same level of transparency I wish that I had seen before booking. I booked a large birthday party for my son’s first birthday party, which came out to be $680. To me, that’s a pretty penny so I presumed a certain standard came with that price tag. When I booked the party, I paid a deposit and was given standard information for the party such as what was allowed, what to expect, etc.

From the time I booked, to when the party was was about 3 weeks time. We tried SEVERAL times (upwards of 5-6) to reach out to this establishment and the sister establishment in falls church (it’s the exact same number) and each time we were greeted with a voice mailbox that was full so you couldn’t even receive a call back. We called on different days and different times of day in an attempt to get a call back, and to me, for $680, that’s unacceptable service.

We tried the best we could to answer our own questions and appease our guest’s questions until the party. When we got there, we were debriefed on rules and were advised that our party package only covered 15 kids and 15 adults. My fiancé asked the front desk lady why each child was only allowed 1 adult, when two parent households were fairly standard and all she could reply was “it’s only $4 extra dollars per adult”. Of course we were looking at her like she was crazy, because I hate to keep bringing up the price, but we paid a hefty sum and invited several families to this party just to be nickel and dimed about secondary parents that show up.

Of course the kids had a blast at this party. we had varying age ranges from 1-6 at this party. But one issue we noticed with the play areas is that they were separated by age. The small babies had an area in the front, and it age progressed as you went back. But there was no one managing any of the areas. Of course we had several one year old babies at my one year old’s party and there were several older kids playing in that area and it was extremely easy for your kids

to get hurt. They, of course, had the vultures walking around when it was time to leave to make sure certain colored bands were out of the play area when it was time to go, but no one to make sure kids stayed in the appropriate play areas.

My final qualm, was that the food came out around 3:20 and we were expected to be out of the room at 4 completely. If you’re a parent, you know kids eat slow especially when they need help or you have multiples. Our plan was to eat and then do the cake. The front desk lady came in around 4 and was making all this passive aggressive commentary about how 4 had passed already and we should’ve been gone. But she saw us actively shooing people out the door so we could pack everything up and leave.

Overall, I know that the kids had fun and the party was a hit. But I just feel like what I paid for, and what I got was not the same. Not having an open phone line is unacceptable, if you want people out on time, bring the food out earlier especially for small dependent children. And if you have the ability to police the band colors so people don’t play past their time, you can make sure big kids aren’t hurting little kids in their designated play area. All around, this is not a good birthday party spot for what you pay for, and I wouldn’t recommend it to my other parents.

Reviewer: Gigi E
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I visited Scramble Alexandria recently and left feeling deeply disappointed and disrespected.

When I arrived, I was surprised by the “holiday fee” — an increased admission rate I hadn’t noticed beforehand. I later went back and found the pricing on the website, but I still believe it’s poor business practice to double prices on the very days when hard-working parents, especially mothers like myself, finally have a little time to bring their kids out for fun. It feels like taking advantage of families who are doing their best to create special moments with limited time and resources.

When I expressed my concern about the fee at the front desk, the staff member, Cora, replied with, “You don’t have to let your children play here.” Her tone and response were rude, unprofessional, and completely dismissive of a valid concern.

To make matters worse, my son and goddaughter were wrongly accused of trying to throw a birthday party — simply because my goddaughter brought a small gift bag and one balloon on a stick to celebrate a pretend birthday for her stuffed animals. Instead of asking questions or treating us with respect, we were immediately confronted and made to feel like we were doing something wrong. It was embarrassing and unnecessary.

I followed up with an email to management to express my concerns and never received a response. The lack of communication and accountability speaks volumes.

Unfortunately, I won’t be returning. There are other indoor play options in the area where children can enjoy themselves and parents are treated with respect, not suspicion or indifference.

********Update: It is clear by the companies response there is no accountability. Mistreatment of customers is condoned; and a birthday hat on a stuffed animal is not allowed. PARENTS BEWARE OF THIS LOCATION. I’ve always had good experiences at Falls Church try there or one of the many other indoor playgrounds. Like Cora told me; “I don’t have to come there” and I won’t. 😊

Reviewer: Taylor Minor
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Let me first start off by saying this is the cleanest and safest environment EVER. As a bystander a few weeks ago I noticed a gentleman come into this establishment disrespecting Cora who works here. I immediately felt bad and empathized with her and the other staff disrespected. Cora held her composure and took care of it excellently, I mean very professional. If this were my employee she’d be getting promoted! However the disrespect did not stop here, this man kept it going and all over a BEER. This is a kids establishment NOT a place for continuous drinking and not for you to disrespect ANY of this staff that works here. Im honestly disgusted that they even left a bad review playing victim and making this place seem unsafe when it is not. Nothing ever got physical and I was right there to see it. What happened was a grown man that was a bystander with respect for hard workers was not going to allow a disrespectful entitled man child to disrespect these workers as if their kids or below them. Obviously the man child didn’t take too well to that and caused commotion but hey, Not every bystander will let you disrespect hard working people. Even Alexandria Police Department agreed with the generous man that intervened on behalf of Cora and the other workers disrespected. You never go into a establishment treating people like that, EVER. In front of your own child acting like that is even more sad & embarrassing. Ever since this incident and seeing how great the staff is and handled the situation I come back all the time! Cora is amazing and I will always return to this location. The food, hospitality, and customer service is top notch. Please be mindful when you come here and show the staff respect always, these people make it possible for your kids to have fun while you catch a little break.

Reviewer: Galina Goncharova
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We've visited this place multiple times over the past two years and have experienced it in various conditions. In June 2024, we saw positive improvements—the floors were replaced, equipment was repaired, and new toys were added. However, by December 2024, the facility had deteriorated significantly. The play area was filthy, with spilled Goldfish crackers and cheese stick wrappers scattered around. Equipment was covered in dust and fingerprints, the air was musty and humid, and several pieces of equipment were broken.

The bathroom conditions were particularly bad. The women's restroom needs a new soap dispenser, as excess soap drips onto the floor, creating a large puddle. Another dispenser has a sign stating it's clogged, which means both dispensers are unreliable. Additionally, the sock policy isn’t consistently enforced—some children play without socks, and kids frequently move balls from the ball pit into the building block area, creating a safety hazard since most children walk there.

To improve cleanliness and safety, I recommend that staff conduct hourly walkthroughs to pick up trash, vacuum dirty areas (including the shoe area), wipe down equipment, and organize toys. Broken balls and damaged building blocks should also be removed regularly. A deep cleaning at least once a year would help tackle dust buildup in hard-to-reach areas.

On the positive side, despite the broken equipment and cleanliness issues, we still manage to have fun here. We also appreciate the convenience of the available snacks and drinks.

In summary, this place has potential but suffers from inconsistent maintenance. When properly cleaned and maintained, it’s a great spot for kids to play. However, poor upkeep—especially in the play area and bathrooms—makes visits less enjoyable. Regular cleaning, better enforcement of policies, and occasional deep cleaning would make a huge difference. Some families have mentioned catching bugs after visiting, though we haven’t personally experienced that issue.

Reviewer: D C
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Quality of staff has lowered significantly; we went today at a quiet time and the girl behind the desk had to take her headphones off just to check us in where we weren’t asked for our information or to sign a waiver. The second employee was just reading a book. I wouldn’t see this as an issue, but when we told them that a child had tracked blood throughout the playground, it took a good bit of time for them to actually get up with a disinfectant wipe and wipe the immediately obvious spots without doing a complete walkthrough of the entire facility. This poor cleaning standard is reflected throughout the facility as there is an easily visible thick layer of dust on just about every surface that can’t be reached without a step stool. The storage of extra materials under the equipment is understandable and a strong effort is made to keep children from these areas, but the amount of dust and random socks/trash under there could definitely be fixed.

Along with the lack of investment in time to clean, there doesn’t seem to be much investment into up keeping the equipment. I’m sure it’s expensive to repair and maintain, but some things really should be prioritized. I saw safety nets that are torn and tied together with string, many of the seams are tearing on everything, the tubes for the slides are deflated, and the one attraction that allows you to spin the inner ring has been duct taped so many times that where the tape has worn there is exposed metal.

We used to have a great time here, I’m not quite sure what happened!

Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our previous visits to Me land were enjoyable, but our most recent experience on Saturday, Jan 20th was disappointing. I'm saddened to say that the place was absolutely filthy, adults were not being supervised not that they should need but it seems that common sense is not so common for some people as they had their shoes on in the play area dragging all the melted snow and dirt from outside. Not only was the floor dirty, there were big hairballs, napkins, water bottles and all kinds of trash all over the place. I approached the employees and kindly asked if someone could pick up the trash on the play area,  there were four employees standing at the register, one of them say they will and never did, we stay an hour and not one single employees picked any of the trash or asked the people with shoes to take them off. Also, the same employees were wearing the shoes inside the area. It is a shame that such a nice place turned into a filthy area. A suggestion for improvement would be to consider getting better employees or implementing effective management to ensure a cleaner and more pleasant environment. I'll be happy to change my review once issues have been addressed.

Review: Our family had an absolute blast at Joyland kidz! My 3 yr old son and 16-month-old daughter enjoyed every moment. From the moment you walk in, Joyland gives off a fun, energetic vibe that sets the tone for an unforgettable experience. The entire space is clean, safe, and well organized. Reviewer: Christina Walker
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: I visited Joyland on 7-1 with my 3 children ages 1, 5, and 8.

Pros:
1. Great location
2. Lots of parking
3. Very clean facility and bathrooms

Cons

1. Young girl working was on her phone as she completed my transaction and answered my questions. It’s nothing more rude than when young people have their AirPods in and are holding two conversations at once. There were times when she was looking at me but talking on her phone.
2. It was 78 degrees inside on a  95 degree day. Their air was set to 64 degrees. I don’t know if it was ventilation issues or AC issues but it was hot. You are not allowed to bring food or drinks inside. They have water fountains but they are near the bathroom (I don’t drink water fountains near bathrooms iykyk) They have a water bottle refill station but you can’t bring bottles in so it doesn’t really make sense.
3. Their price per child no matter what their age, is $15.99 for 2 hours. One adult does enter free with children. There is no different price for younger ages which was shocking to me. HyperKidz and Scramble even have a different price for toddlers vs older children. They also don’t have different weekday prices vs weekend prices.  Paying $16 for a space where my one year old could not even use half of the equipment was unsettling.
4. The space is small. It is the size of the surrounding businesses. I was so happy to have a place close to home but for $16 per child I will take my kids where it is half the price and they actually have more things to do.
5. They require non slip socks. Every indoor playground I have been to requires socks but not non slip socks. The non slip socks are a money grab. They look similar to the sky zone socks but nothing in there is slippery so I really didn’t understand the non slip socks. As I looked around almost every family had them which confirmed for me it was a money grab. Their website also didn’t have the socks under their admissions tab.

I will not be coming back. I really wanted to support a new black owned business but it seems like a money grab for the size and what they have to offer.

-----------------------

Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Review: I held my daughters 3rd birthday here today. Me and my family have been here one other time, and were completely SOLD. Today just sealed the deal! Review: We hosted our son's birthday party here yesterday and LOVED it. Everything from booking to coordinating to party to clean up went smoothly. Anjali (the owner) and her family are so helpful and organized. This is a special place in NoVa and we are so happy to have found you.

Reviewer: Paulina K
Rating: 4/5
Time: Edited 5 years ago
Review: It's an awesome, clean,  family owned play place.. there are physical activities and quiet-time activities.  The physical activities include : probably 10 different swings, mini workout gear perfect for big 2 year olds (treadmill, stairmaster, stationary bike and 3 others) , zip line, net for climbing , "rock climb" type wall, monkey bars, a decent sized enclosed trampoline and last but not least, a zip line. The only thing that annoys me is that most of the battery operated toys no longer work , so my daughter wastes her time trying to play with them. I think it would be much more professional if they removed (dead) battery operated toys  as they are annoying and an eye sore.
There is also a low lit calm/quiet room for children that may need it. There is also hang out for teenagers upstairs , it has a couch and table and chairs along with board games (although "Words With Friends " was missing several pieces, a large connect four , kid safe darts and an air hockey table. They have a cute exclusive Melissa & Doug toy boutique.

-----------------------

Review: We understood that this is a place specialized in children with autism/on the spectrum to paraphrase their name. I took my son with me when I decided to enroll him in their camp. I also had his nanny available to help out. Despite the mentioned the camp was a disaster. Overcrowded. They did not know how to handle my son. They did not allow the adult accompanying my son to use the bathroom and they expected the nanny to take care of my son despite the fact that they were paid to take care of my son. Unfortunately this is a place I will NOT recommend to anyone. Unprofessional from the beginning to the end and also ran by ignorant quasi professionals.

Reviewer: C Baquiran
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 years ago
Review: We just visited this morning. If you come before noon you can get a discounted rate. My son has multiple sensory issues, but the place is fairly quiet and he was able to play! When he first walked into the room he took time to orient himself. Then he discovered the zip line and that's all he wanted to do lol.
We last 30 minutes which I consider a success.  On the way out we shopped their gift section which has a variety of Melissa and Doug items. They have dress-up costumes, puzzles, play food, coloring and paint pads. It's a good selection, if you don't want to run to a big store then this is a convenient place to grab a kids gift.
Overall our experience was a positive one. They do have an upper floor for older kids with an air hockey table, giant Connect Four and other fun games. We'll come back and explore that more on our next visit.
Oh one more thing, there is a sweets store a few doors down. I don't remember the exact name but there is chocolate and other sweet treats.

Reviewer: Michael Oberschneider
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 years ago
Review: As a child psychologist, I highly recommend Rock the Spectrum.  This is a much needed and wonderful place for children on the Autistic Spectrum, and for children with other neuro-developmental challenges -- ADHD, SPD, etc, and I'm so glad that it's right here in Loudoun County!  All children need to release energy productively, and the setting and activities at We Rock the Spectrum provides special needs children the positive and accepting space to work on sensory, emotional regulation and social skills.  This is a great place for your child to have fun, strengthen challenges and make new friends, and I've seen the successful impact first hand.

Michael Oberschneider, Psy.D., NCCE, NCPC
Founder and Director
Ashburn Psychological and Psychiatric Services
Licensed Clinical Psychologist
Nationally Certified Custody Evaluator
Nationally Certified Parenting Coordinator

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ernest Boyles
Rating: 5/5

Review: We attended We Rock the Spectrum's open house. It was GREAT! I have a 7 year old with autism, and a neuro-typical 4 year old. My friend that has a 4 year old with autism was also with us. There was plenty of stuff for both of my kiddos to do! At the open house the floors were slippery, however I talked to the owner that evening and they had already dewaxed the floors and were putting down more rugs (less than 12 hours after the open house closed, the saw a problem and fixed it immediately)! In the gym area there is a thick foam mat to keep the kiddos safe, most of the toddler area has the same thick foam mat, and the small area that doesn't have the foam mat has colorful, soft rugs.  I haven't been back since the fixed the floors, however I would recommend raking non-skid socks if you have them, just incase. For us it was worth the almost 45-minute drive! They have a Facebook page you can check out that has more reviews and lots of pictures to give you an idea of all they have to offer!}

She did this by asking how I would like to handle it and following instructions; when I didn't have an answer/was unsure she took charge and handled the situation with grace!

At the end Janeen (the manager) took my payment and even that was a pleasant experience. She was genuinely interested in my experience which ment a lot to me!

This was a dream team and I can't wait to go back with my girls!

Reviewer: Renan de Campos
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: This place was okay, I guess. For $12 for my child I can't really complain. I'm not driving out of my way and here's why.

The toys were really beat up. A lot of them were broken and gunked up. Some of these inflatables were on the flat side. I was too worried of an injury to let my son go on.

There's a almost tree house looking area with a house at the top of stairs. This is crazy dangerous. One side has steep and sharp stairs. The other side is to climb up, but if someone falls it will be a serious injury.

Also, one area in the ball pit has the beam exposed without pad. It's a very small area, but that can cause a serious injury.

To me, this place isn't putting safety and cleanliness first. There seems to be a lack of care.

While it was a decent spur of the moment place when we were in town, I would not return here.

{Reviewer: B. J.
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I didn’t come here for a party. It was just a play date, and I really wanted to like this place because the kids had an amazing time. But I can’t overlook the condition of the facility.

Everything about the place feels old, dingy, and unsanitary. Several play structures were literally held together with duct tape. The ball pit had balls with missing foam or foam completely exposed. There’s also a slide that goes straight down into a pole, which doesn’t seem like the safest design.

What really pushed me over the edge was the bathroom. The smell hit me the second I opened the door. It smelled like urine that had been sitting for days. Toilet paper was all over the floor, and not a single surface felt clean enough to touch. I couldn’t even bring myself to walk in. It was just too disgusting. 🤢

If management put some effort into repairs and basic cleaning, this could be a great spot for kids. But until that happens, I won’t be coming back. You’re better off going to Hyper Kidz or Chuck E. Cheese.

Rating: 3/5

Review: We had my niece’s birthday party at Play EC in Capitol Heights. The kids had a great time on the jungle gym and play areas, but the overall experience left a lot to be desired. The party room wasn’t available until 4 p.m. even though the party was scheduled for 2:30, which was frustrating. The space is small and felt overcrowded on a busy Saturday.

It was hot inside, especially in the back where the air doesn’t circulate well. The facility could be cleaner—dust triggered my allergies, and there were items stored under the jungle gym. Staff seemed limited—only three people on site, including the manager.

They did provide pizza, juice, and handled setup, and the decor was nice, though clearly reused. Be careful with helium balloons—if one floats to the ceiling, they’ll charge up to $150 to retrieve it or you can risk your safety and try to get it down yourself, they will provide the ladder for you.

It’s probably best to go during a weekday or rent the full space if you’re planning a party. Great for kids, but not the most comfortable for adults.

Reviewer: Mystic Kila (Kila)
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: SCAMMERS!!!
We booked a birthday party at this establishment for 5:30 PM and paid $600 in advance, as required. However, we arrived at 5:47 PM and were shocked to find that we had to wait nearly two hours for a party room to become available. Despite paying for a private room for two full hours, we were not given access to a room until 7:30 PM. To make matters worse, the manager informed us that we had to vacate by 7:45 PM—after receiving only 15 minutes of use.

The experience was completely unacceptable. The pizza provided was cold, and the drinks were old Capri Sun juice boxes. This is not what we paid for, and certainly not what was advertised.

As a Black woman supporting a Black-owned business, I expected professionalism, respect, and accountability. Unfortunately, this experience confirmed why many hesitate to support our own—because some businesses treat paying customers as if their money and time don’t matter. I feel disrespected, disappointed, and frankly scammed out of $600 for a service that was never properly delivered.

For comparison, Chuck E. Cheese charges $200 less and honors their time slots. Even if you arrive late, they simply deduct that time from your reservation—they don’t force you to wait two hours for a room you already paid for.

This business failed to meet basic expectations and left my family and guests feeling disregarded. I sincerely hope this feedback is taken seriously so that no other family has to go through what we experienced.

Reviewer: Marchelle Shorts
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I’m giving this place one star solely because my child enjoyed coming here BEFORE we booked a party. However, I can confidently say this is not a 4-star establishment—don’t be misled by Google reviews. Many of the honest 1-star reviews can be found on Yelp.
The management is unprofessional, greedy, and show no appreciation for their guests. My party décor was nothing like what I requested, and both the party host and management were rude and dismissive. After the event, I sent a polite and professional email regarding my deposit, only to receive nothing but disrespect and unprofessional back-and-forth responses, as if I were arguing with a child.
They claim they’ve made “upgrades”—absolutely not. The facility still smells like feet, the foam pit cubes are falling apart and unsanitary, and to top it off, the entire place reeked of weed as we were leaving. They don’t have enough staff to monitor guests, so anyone can come and go freely, creating a safety concern.
Despite advertising that the space is for kids 8 years and younger, there were older, rough-playing kids who posed a risk to younger children. They also claim to provide waivers and wristbands for safety, but that wasn’t enforced at all.
To make matters worse, the candy wall décor contained old, stale, and hard candy—and this was during my party!
If you're considering booking a party here, think twice. They make up their own rules, have no regard for customer satisfaction, and will take your money without delivering the promised experience. I truly regret spending my hard-earned money here and not receiving my deposit back. Beware before booking! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Review: Overall, I like the concept of this play place. There is supposed to be an age cap for the range of children allowed to use the space and get on the activity play set-ups. My grandson is two and highly enjoys going to this place.  It's Maryland's best kept secret. The only con is that when they have birthday parties, there are sometimes older children who attend. They're too big for the play area and it's already a small space. In my opinion, it takes away from the younger children being able to fully immerse themselves in the space. When they do birthday parties, maybe they should consider charging for a few hours to rent out the entire space just for the party and close it off to the public until the party is over. The last time I was there with my grandson , it was a mixture of party goers and outside kids and it was a mess. The other children who are not a part of the party are left out and see the party favors and set up and are limited to their play time but the party kids have access to it all. This causes confusion. Other than that , it's a great place to take younger kids maybe 2-6 to play.

I don't know if they have someone using that in the bad or what but we can definitely smell it. So overall this place is not worth the $15 per child. Customer service sucks, over crowded, and the place is filthy and smells. So I would pick another place to take your kids.
Last thing I want to mention I don't know if there was a change of ownership but if you look at most of the recent reviews they are all 1 star vs the review from 2 years ago. Food for thought.

Reviewer: Brandon Meredith
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Upon arrival, we were directed into the paly area for our 1 of paly time. In your disclosure your company states that you “provide a safe and stimulating environment for kids 8 and under to explore because we truly believe that growing up should be a memorable experience for every child.”. However, this was NOT the case on Sunday, there were multiple kids above the maximum age and weight limit who were filliping, spinning diving and jumping of the equipment and bumping into my one and two year old babies. The children were unsupervised and there was no staff to regulate play. I had to step in and stop rough play to keep my party’s babies safe. The condition and cleanliness of the equipment and play area was also unsanitary, unsafe, and broken. There was an event of a child vomiting (which is normal due to running around) however the facility did not have the proper cleaning supplies to aid the mess. There weren’t any trash bags, no disinfectant, no clothes, no mop nothing that could sanitize the area to continue play. My family and I had to help clean the entire surface area because of the short staffing. Even after surface cleaning, we had to continue to encourage shutting down that specific area due to lack of disinfectant treatment to that area. When directed back to our party room there was a walkway full of cake, water and just spilled the entire walkway, all my guest and children walker in socks and were subject to stepping in the filth on the ground. The “Swiffer used to clean the walkway after it was brought to staffing attention was not efficient as it did not have the proper size cleaning pad.  The rest rooms were unsanitary and had food and trash everywhere. The facility was not cleaned regularly during playtime.

During the celebration in the party room, we were not provided“ trained party host to ensure a stress-free experience” as stated in the companies. There were not enough napkins, plates, no utensils for the guest. All of which had to be retrieved upon consistent requests. The chairs and tables were filthy, torn and not in presentable condition. I cannot stress enough the lack of staffing we experienced at this facility. I was under the impression that there would be a capacity limit at which I know were not carefully monitored because the individuals in my party as well as incoming guest were not accounted for. The “memorable, safe, clean and courteous” environment promised for the amount myself and husband had to pay for our daughter wasn’t not delivered at this facility. My daughters first birthday experience as well as our guest was ultimately ruined.

NEVER AGAIN, OVERPRICED UNPROFESSIONAL AND BEYONG FILTHY.

Reviewer: Belinda
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited 6 years ago
Review: We had a LOT of fun here! We spent HOURS here eating, chatting while my nephew played in the Play Place. It's even big enough for some more nimble adults to climb up into, which we did and let me tell you, its SUPER fun up there! There are little nooks to hide in , slides on multiple levels, and the spiral one is REALLY FAST!! There are things to roll on and hang on, and things I definitely cannot do. It's like a super fun playhouse with different areas and levels to play in and on. The thing you can roll on is a little iffy because someone could roll off it a little too fast and hit their head, but that's my only concern. The door to the area is heavy which prevents kids from escaping. There are about 10 or 15 different tables to sit/eat at and there's a bathroom right in the area so you don't need to leave for potty breaks. They do kiddo birthday parties in there for a very reasonable price. I recommend this place for a rainy day or anytime really. And check out my ADORABLE  nephew with his mom and her bf! Isn't he CUTE??? I meant my nephew, lol😝

Review: Kind of disappointed with them this time . We came a few years ago and liked it . Came back this morning at opening , I was by myself with my two kids . Which both are autistic , and then 20 minutes later they accepted bus loads of students . I get it’s a public place , but I really wish I would’ve been informed that they had like a field trip or whatever coming . I would have just came back later . I paid full price and only got half an hour with my kiddos inside . I can’t keep track of two children by myself with a small room full of probably 100 some kids . I had to apologize to my kids for wasting their time , and I’m pretty upset I wasted my money . Personally I think they should’ve let me know , or just book a few hours specifically for the field trip and not accept other guests . A lot of these kids were playing in the zone meant for much smaller kids . I had kids 3 times the size of my 2 and 4 year old trampling over them to go down toddler slides . Very disappointing .

{Reviewer: B. J.
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I didn’t come here for a party. It was just a play date, and I really wanted to like this place because the kids had an amazing time. But I can’t overlook the condition of the facility.

Everything about the place feels old, dingy, and unsanitary. Several play structures were literally held together with duct tape. The ball pit had balls with missing foam or foam completely exposed. There’s also a slide that goes straight down into a pole, which doesn’t seem like the safest design.

What really pushed me over the edge was the bathroom. The smell hit me the second I opened the door. It smelled like urine that had been sitting for days. Toilet paper was all over the floor, and not a single surface felt clean enough to touch. I couldn’t even bring myself to walk in. It was just too disgusting. 🤢

If management put some effort into repairs and basic cleaning, this could be a great spot for kids. But until that happens, I won’t be coming back. You’re better off going to Hyper Kidz or Chuck E. Cheese.

Rating: 3/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We had my niece’s birthday party at Play EC in Capitol Heights. The kids had a great time on the jungle gym and play areas, but the overall experience left a lot to be desired. The party room wasn’t available until 4 p.m. even though the party was scheduled for 2:30, which was frustrating. The space is small and felt overcrowded on a busy Saturday.

It was hot inside, especially in the back where the air doesn’t circulate well. The facility could be cleaner—dust triggered my allergies, and there were items stored under the jungle gym. Staff seemed limited—only three people on site, including the manager.

They did provide pizza, juice, and handled setup, and the decor was nice, though clearly reused. Be careful with helium balloons—if one floats to the ceiling, they’ll charge up to $150 to retrieve it or you can risk your safety and try to get it down yourself, they will provide the ladder for you.

It’s probably best to go during a weekday or rent the full space if you’re planning a party. Great for kids, but not the most comfortable for adults.

Reviewer: Mystic Kila (Kila)
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: SCAMMERS!!!
We booked a birthday party at this establishment for 5:30 PM and paid $600 in advance, as required. However, we arrived at 5:47 PM and were shocked to find that we had to wait nearly two hours for a party room to become available. Despite paying for a private room for two full hours, we were not given access to a room until 7:30 PM. To make matters worse, the manager informed us that we had to vacate by 7:45 PM—after receiving only 15 minutes of use.

The experience was completely unacceptable. The pizza provided was cold, and the drinks were old Capri Sun juice boxes. This is not what we paid for, and certainly not what was advertised.

As a Black woman supporting a Black-owned business, I expected professionalism, respect, and accountability. Unfortunately, this experience confirmed why many hesitate to support our own—because some businesses treat paying customers as if their money and time don’t matter. I feel disrespected, disappointed, and frankly scammed out of $600 for a service that was never properly delivered.

For comparison, Chuck E. Cheese charges $200 less and honors their time slots. Even if you arrive late, they simply deduct that time from your reservation—they don’t force you to wait two hours for a room you already paid for.

This business failed to meet basic expectations and left my family and guests feeling disregarded. I sincerely hope this feedback is taken seriously so that no other family has to go through what we experienced.

Reviewer: Marchelle Shorts
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I’m giving this place one star solely because my child enjoyed coming here BEFORE we booked a party. However, I can confidently say this is not a 4-star establishment—don’t be misled by Google reviews. Many of the honest 1-star reviews can be found on Yelp.
The management is unprofessional, greedy, and show no appreciation for their guests. My party décor was nothing like what I requested, and both the party host and management were rude and dismissive. After the event, I sent a polite and professional email regarding my deposit, only to receive nothing but disrespect and unprofessional back-and-forth responses, as if I were arguing with a child.
They claim they’ve made “upgrades”—absolutely not. The facility still smells like feet, the foam pit cubes are falling apart and unsanitary, and to top it off, the entire place reeked of weed as we were leaving. They don’t have enough staff to monitor guests, so anyone can come and go freely, creating a safety concern.
Despite advertising that the space is for kids 8 years and younger, there were older, rough-playing kids who posed a risk to younger children. They also claim to provide waivers and wristbands for safety, but that wasn’t enforced at all.
To make matters worse, the candy wall décor contained old, stale, and hard candy—and this was during my party!
If you're considering booking a party here, think twice. They make up their own rules, have no regard for customer satisfaction, and will take your money without delivering the promised experience. I truly regret spending my hard-earned money here and not receiving my deposit back. Beware before booking! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Brooklyn Brown

Review: Overall, I like the concept of this play place. There is supposed to be an age cap for the range of children allowed to use the space and get on the activity play set-ups. My grandson is two and highly enjoys going to this place.  It's Maryland's best kept secret. The only con is that when they have birthday parties, there are sometimes older children who attend. They're too big for the play area and it's already a small space. In my opinion, it takes away from the younger children being able to fully immerse themselves in the space. When they do birthday parties, maybe they should consider charging for a few hours to rent out the entire space just for the party and close it off to the public until the party is over. The last time I was there with my grandson , it was a mixture of party goers and outside kids and it was a mess. The other children who are not a part of the party are left out and see the party favors and set up and are limited to their play time but the party kids have access to it all. This causes confusion. Other than that , it's a great place to take younger kids maybe 2-6 to play.

Last thing I want to mention I don't know if there was a change of ownership but if you look at most of the recent reviews they are all 1 star vs the review from 2 years ago. Food for thought.

Reviewer: Brandon Meredith
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Upon arrival, we were directed into the paly area for our 1 of paly time. In your disclosure your company states that you “provide a safe and stimulating environment for kids 8 and under to explore because we truly believe that growing up should be a memorable experience for every child.”. However, this was NOT the case on Sunday, there were multiple kids above the maximum age and weight limit who were filliping, spinning diving and jumping of the equipment and bumping into my one and two year old babies. The children were unsupervised and there was no staff to regulate play. I had to step in and stop rough play to keep my party’s babies safe. The condition and cleanliness of the equipment and play area was also unsanitary, unsafe, and broken. There was an event of a child vomiting (which is normal due to running around) however the facility did not have the proper cleaning supplies to aid the mess. There weren’t any trash bags, no disinfectant, no clothes, no mop nothing that could sanitize the area to continue play. My family and I had to help clean the entire surface area because of the short staffing. Even after surface cleaning, we had to continue to encourage shutting down that specific area due to lack of disinfectant treatment to that area. When directed back to our party room there was a walkway full of cake, water and just spilled the entire walkway, all my guest and children walker in socks and were subject to stepping in the filth on the ground. The “Swiffer used to clean the walkway after it was brought to staffing attention was not efficient as it did not have the proper size cleaning pad.  The rest rooms were unsanitary and had food and trash everywhere. The facility was not cleaned regularly during playtime.

During the celebration in the party room, we were not provided“ trained party host to ensure a stress-free experience” as stated in the companies. There were not enough napkins, plates, no utensils for the guest. All of which had to be retrieved upon consistent requests. The chairs and tables were filthy, torn and not in presentable condition. I cannot stress enough the lack of staffing we experienced at this facility. I was under the impression that there would be a capacity limit at which I know were not carefully monitored because the individuals in my party as well as incoming guest were not accounted for. The “memorable, safe, clean and courteous” environment promised for the amount myself and husband had to pay for our daughter wasn’t not delivered at this facility. My daughters first birthday experience as well as our guest was ultimately ruined.

NEVER AGAIN, OVERPRICED UNPROFESSIONAL AND BEYONG FILTHY.

{Reviewer: B. J.
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I didn’t come here for a party. It was just a play date, and I really wanted to like this place because the kids had an amazing time. But I can’t overlook the condition of the facility.

Everything about the place feels old, dingy, and unsanitary. Several play structures were literally held together with duct tape. The ball pit had balls with missing foam or foam completely exposed. There’s also a slide that goes straight down into a pole, which doesn’t seem like the safest design.

What really pushed me over the edge was the bathroom. The smell hit me the second I opened the door. It smelled like urine that had been sitting for days. Toilet paper was all over the floor, and not a single surface felt clean enough to touch. I couldn’t even bring myself to walk in. It was just too disgusting. 🤢

If management put some effort into repairs and basic cleaning, this could be a great spot for kids. But until that happens, I won’t be coming back. You’re better off going to Hyper Kidz or Chuck E. Cheese.

Reviewer: Ernecia White
Rating: 3/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We had my niece’s birthday party at Play EC in Capitol Heights. The kids had a great time on the jungle gym and play areas, but the overall experience left a lot to be desired. The party room wasn’t available until 4 p.m. even though the party was scheduled for 2:30, which was frustrating. The space is small and felt overcrowded on a busy Saturday.

It was hot inside, especially in the back where the air doesn’t circulate well. The facility could be cleaner—dust triggered my allergies, and there were items stored under the jungle gym. Staff seemed limited—only three people on site, including the manager.

They did provide pizza, juice, and handled setup, and the decor was nice, though clearly reused. Be careful with helium balloons—if one floats to the ceiling, they’ll charge up to $150 to retrieve it or you can risk your safety and try to get it down yourself, they will provide the ladder for you.

It’s probably best to go during a weekday or rent the full space if you’re planning a party. Great for kids, but not the most comfortable for adults.

Reviewer: Mystic Kila (Kila)
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: SCAMMERS!!!
We booked a birthday party at this establishment for 5:30 PM and paid $600 in advance, as required. However, we arrived at 5:47 PM and were shocked to find that we had to wait nearly two hours for a party room to become available. Despite paying for a private room for two full hours, we were not given access to a room until 7:30 PM. To make matters worse, the manager informed us that we had to vacate by 7:45 PM—after receiving only 15 minutes of use.

The experience was completely unacceptable. The pizza provided was cold, and the drinks were old Capri Sun juice boxes. This is not what we paid for, and certainly not what was advertised.

As a Black woman supporting a Black-owned business, I expected professionalism, respect, and accountability. Unfortunately, this experience confirmed why many hesitate to support our own—because some businesses treat paying customers as if their money and time don’t matter. I feel disrespected, disappointed, and frankly scammed out of $600 for a service that was never properly delivered.

For comparison, Chuck E. Cheese charges $200 less and honors their time slots. Even if you arrive late, they simply deduct that time from your reservation—they don’t force you to wait two hours for a room you already paid for.

This business failed to meet basic expectations and left my family and guests feeling disregarded. I sincerely hope this feedback is taken seriously so that no other family has to go through what we experienced.

Reviewer: Marchelle Shorts
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I’m giving this place one star solely because my child enjoyed coming here BEFORE we booked a party. However, I can confidently say this is not a 4-star establishment—don’t be misled by Google reviews. Many of the honest 1-star reviews can be found on Yelp.
The management is unprofessional, greedy, and show no appreciation for their guests. My party décor was nothing like what I requested, and both the party host and management were rude and dismissive. After the event, I sent a polite and professional email regarding my deposit, only to receive nothing but disrespect and unprofessional back-and-forth responses, as if I were arguing with a child.
They claim they’ve made “upgrades”—absolutely not. The facility still smells like feet, the foam pit cubes are falling apart and unsanitary, and to top it off, the entire place reeked of weed as we were leaving. They don’t have enough staff to monitor guests, so anyone can come and go freely, creating a safety concern.
Despite advertising that the space is for kids 8 years and younger, there were older, rough-playing kids who posed a risk to younger children. They also claim to provide waivers and wristbands for safety, but that wasn’t enforced at all.
To make matters worse, the candy wall décor contained old, stale, and hard candy—and this was during my party!
If you're considering booking a party here, think twice. They make up their own rules, have no regard for customer satisfaction, and will take your money without delivering the promised experience. I truly regret spending my hard-earned money here and not receiving my deposit back. Beware before booking! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviewer: Brandon Meredith
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Upon arrival, we were directed into the paly area for our 1 of paly time. In your disclosure your company states that you “provide a safe and stimulating environment for kids 8 and under to explore because we truly believe that growing up should be a memorable experience for every child.”. However, this was NOT the case on Sunday, there were multiple kids above the maximum age and weight limit who were filliping, spinning diving and jumping of the equipment and bumping into my one and two year old babies. The children were unsupervised and there was no staff to regulate play. I had to step in and stop rough play to keep my party’s babies safe. The condition and cleanliness of the equipment and play area was also unsanitary, unsafe, and broken. There was an event of a child vomiting (which is normal due to running around) however the facility did not have the proper cleaning supplies to aid the mess. There weren’t any trash bags, no disinfectant, no clothes, no mop nothing that could sanitize the area to continue play. My family and I had to help clean the entire surface area because of the short staffing. Even after surface cleaning, we had to continue to encourage shutting down that specific area due to lack of disinfectant treatment to that area. When directed back to our party room there was a walkway full of cake, water and just spilled the entire walkway, all my guest and children walker in socks and were subject to stepping in the filth on the ground. The “Swiffer used to clean the walkway after it was brought to staffing attention was not efficient as it did not have the proper size cleaning pad.  The rest rooms were unsanitary and had food and trash everywhere. The facility was not cleaned regularly during playtime.

During the celebration in the party room, we were not provided“ trained party host to ensure a stress-free experience” as stated in the companies. There were not enough napkins, plates, no utensils for the guest. All of which had to be retrieved upon consistent requests. The chairs and tables were filthy, torn and not in presentable condition. I cannot stress enough the lack of staffing we experienced at this facility. I was under the impression that there would be a capacity limit at which I know were not carefully monitored because the individuals in my party as well as incoming guest were not accounted for. The “memorable, safe, clean and courteous” environment promised for the amount myself and husband had to pay for our daughter wasn’t not delivered at this facility. My daughters first birthday experience as well as our guest was ultimately ruined.

NEVER AGAIN, OVERPRICED UNPROFESSIONAL AND BEYONG FILTHY.

Review: Our family had an absolute blast at Joyland kidz! My 3 yr old son and 16-month-old daughter enjoyed every moment. Reviewer: Christina Walker
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: I visited Joyland on 7-1 with my 3 children ages 1, 5, and 8.

Pros:
1. Great location
2. Lots of parking
3. Very clean facility and bathrooms

Cons

1. Young girl working was on her phone as she completed my transaction and answered my questions. It’s nothing more rude than when young people have their AirPods in and are holding two conversations at once. There were times when she was looking at me but talking on her phone.
2. It was 78 degrees inside on a  95 degree day. Their air was set to 64 degrees. I don’t know if it was ventilation issues or AC issues but it was hot. You are not allowed to bring food or drinks inside. They have water fountains but they are near the bathroom (I don’t drink water fountains near bathrooms iykyk) They have a water bottle refill station but you can’t bring bottles in so it doesn’t really make sense.
3. Their price per child no matter what their age, is $15.99 for 2 hours. One adult does enter free with children. There is no different price for younger ages which was shocking to me. HyperKidz and Scramble even have a different price for toddlers vs older children. They also don’t have different weekday prices vs weekend prices.  Paying $16 for a space where my one year old could not even use half of the equipment was unsettling.
4. The space is small. It is the size of the surrounding businesses. I was so happy to have a place close to home but for $16 per child I will take my kids where it is half the price and they actually have more things to do.
5. They require non slip socks. Every indoor playground I have been to requires socks but not non slip socks. The non slip socks are a money grab. They look similar to the sky zone socks but nothing in there is slippery so I really didn’t understand the non slip socks. As I looked around almost every family had them which confirmed for me it was a money grab. Their website also didn’t have the socks under their admissions tab.

I will not be coming back. I really wanted to support a new black owned business but it seems like a money grab for the size and what they have to offer.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jenna Trump
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Always an absolute blast! This play place is mostly geared toward the younger set. Probably under age 10 but it depends on how much your kid enjoys imaginary play. My four and six year olds absolutely adore it. The play areas change around periodically but there’s usually a vet center, play kitchen/grocery store, a magic spell booth, puppet show, and a few small games (skee ball, fooseball, basketball) in the back plus a foam pit, small ball pit, trampoline, and a variety of ninja foam blocks to jump and a roller slide and mountain to climb. Also the front area has one of those interactive coloring areas that animates your drawing on a big projector screen. Plus some tables full of building toys. There are plenty of places to sit and chat with other parents while staying within range of your kids. I’m always impressed with how clean they’re able to keep it and how chill the vibe usually is. At our last visit they added a new room full of airtoobz machines which kept my four year old busy for most of the play session. They also added a “snowball fight” area where you could pelt each other with tiny fluffy balls. I ended up in there with both my kids and nephew having the best time. It’s a really great place to go let your kids have a fun without being overstimulated and blasted in the face with screens and lights and ending the day in a meltdown. It gives wholesome playdate vibes and I just adore it. It’s really what the children’s museum in Portsmouth wishes it could be. If you’re a family with a quiet calm child it’s amazing. If you’re a family with a wild animal child climbing the walls and trying to parkour off every surface in your home it’s amazing. Bring em both. They’re gonna love it.

The Ninja Warrior class is for ages 6-10, which our kids can’t attend yet but look forward to signing them up for it. The private rentals are great for daycares, summer camps & school with a reasonable price. The one year anniversary party is coming up next week & my kids are excited to try out the new inflatable balloon bubble house. There is even a black Friday sale of punch cards giving 50% off open play admission, which we will be taking advantage of. Overall, this is a great place to take kids of all ages to have fun & run out some energy. Give it a try, you won’t regret it! :)

VERY cool. :) The girls had a blast and were NOT happy when it was time to leave. :) While we were there we scheduled our birthday party for May! But we’ll be back before then!

Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

{Reviewer: Natalia Rhoe
Rating: 4/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: We visited for the first time after purchasing a Groupon. I thought it would be nice to visit an indoor playground on a hot day. My kids enjoyed themselves and made some new friends. My only suggestion would be to clean the place a little more. We arrived around 10:45am and the play area looked like it hadn't been swept or vacuumed for several days. Clumps of hair in some places. The trash in the bathroom was filled up with paper towels, which suggested the trash hadn't been emptied the night before.  I would recommend having one of the young ladies sitting at the counter walk around with a hand held vacuum when it wasn't crowded and wipe down surfaces and toys throughout the day. Overall, we had a good experience but it could have been cleaner.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Erika Poulter
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We took our son for  the pre k program and it was his favorite place to go every week for the entirety of the program!!! We LOVE the ladies there and we are so ready to take him back!!!!!

Review: Great first visit for open play. We are not from the area but would go back if I bring my nephew back to the area.

Reviewer: Abigail Wilson
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We visited a few weeks ago on a rainy Sunday. I think the concept behind this place is a good idea- but honestly a lot of the toys and equipment seemed to be in rough shape. The staff was really nice, however our biggest issue was the larger children coming to take over the marked “infant/toddler area”. There is a sign that a specific area is designated for smaller children. Unfortunately a lot of parents didn’t seem to see this sign, and their bigger kids were coming over and taking toys, running everyone over trying to use the rocking horse ramps on the far right wall, etc. I would recommend that you either have staff inform parents that there is an infant/toddler area and to please abide by that for safety reasons, or maybe gate the area off? It was really disappointing and unless that changes I probably wouldn’t go back. It’s a good attempt at having a sensory friendly place for kids, just needs a little TLC and boundaries.

Reviewer: Shatima Burgess
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I would have rated this place five stars had it not been for the time restraints. This past Saturday we had a children party and everyone had a great time. I was sent the contract a week before my party and there were a few things that were unclear. I had visited and called a month before hand. I asked multiple questions to gain clarity and I wasn’t told clear directions. I was told that everyone would have access to everything during the duration of the party. I was disappointed to learn that it was only one hour for play and one hour to eat. The owner allowed an additional 15 minutes of play for the children however, transitioning the children was extremely difficult. Being that it was a party for neurodivergent children it took all of 10-15 mins for the children to eat. Most of the children were upset that they could not go back and play especially being able to see the play equipment. The amount of money that was paid should have allowed the children to play the entire time. If it’s a private party it shouldn’t have been cut short. It seemed like I was paying for employees to clean during the time slot I paid for. Had I known this when I had booked I would have requested a bigger time slot.

However, when I came back, I was informed that the items had been taken—presumably stolen—despite your staff’s assurance that they would be kept secure!
This situation is extremely upsetting and has caused me both inconvenience. I trusted your staff to act responsibly, especially after being given a direct assurance that my belongings would be protected. It is unacceptable that this promise was not honored, and that no adequate measures were taken to prevent this from happening. I am requesting an explanation of how this occurred, what steps you are taking to investigate the matter, and what actions you will take to prevent similar incidents in the future. Furthermore, I expect appropriate compensation or support in resolving this loss, including a review of any available security footage and staff accounts.

Reviewer: Rebecca Kane
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I arrived on a Friday, just before 4 pm, with my 7 year old daughter and my 7 month old son in a stroller, which was holding all of our belongings as you can imagine. We entered the building and we spoke with a young lady at the desk, who was being guided by this man, presumably the manager. She explained that we needed to purchase socks in addition to the entry ticket, so we purchased the one pair of socks for my daughter to play. Precisely upon completing the purchase, the man informed me that I would not be able to bring my stroller into the play area. Total deal breaker. I’m sure they’re aware that once they inform a guest that they can’t bring the stroller with them, most patrons would turn away. So they’re waiting until the purchase is complete to inform you that the stroller can’t come with you. Either change the policy or tell people before they purchase. So the play area itself had a few parts that either weren’t working, or none of the kids could figure out how to make it work. None of the workers stepped in to show a demonstration or explain. My daughter did enjoy herself, but I did not enjoy needing to carry all of my belongings around with us on top of my 22 pound baby in a car seat.

Reviewer: Keeana Stancil
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Back in February we brought our daughter to check this place out. We decided to book her birthday party for April. Fast forward 3 days before the party I call to confirm the party. The teenager working tells me they don’t have record of the party. I ask to speak with a manager. She puts me on hold then another teenager proceeds to get on the phone and is NO help, telling me there is no manager and I’ll have to call back tomorrow. Five minutes later I get a call from them with the phone number for the party manager. I call this number twice, no answer. I texted it and finally got a reply. After some back and forth the person informs me that whoever booked the party never confirmed it and they don’t have any spots available for Saturday. I booked this party 2 MONTHS in advance and I never heard from them at all after booking. I was so disappointed because we had to scramble to find something else to do from my daughter’s birthday. I am very lucky I called because we would have been extremely screwed if we showed up there on the day of the party. Honestly, they need to do better and have more adults who can assist rather than leaving it all up to teenagers.

Reviewer: Jonathan Drouin
Rating: 1/5

Review: You look at the website and it sells a very pretty picture. Massive playground including ball area with air cannons and all kinds of little air pressure operated tubes to send the balls through. None of them work. They show a really cool looking ropes course all included in the price. Except apparently there is one employee who can open the course and she’s not coming in today so it’s closed. I’m sorry, what? The arcade is about 50% the little crane machines we all know are rigged and the low payout ticket games. They sell the cards showing you such a great discount! Except they don’t tell you that the games are insanely priced so your money doesn’t stretch far enough to make it worth it. The play area is dirty and a lot of the foam tiles leave gaps or are popping up. The levels of straps that you see in the pictures is broken and they have just cardboard over the entrances to a potential fall hazard. If a baby gate isn’t stopping a toddler (never stopped mine at least) what is cardboard doing especially with a 5-6 year old? Because you can’t go up with them or even really see some of the back parts grownups stay on the floor. I’m not rating the food because I’m not paying for what I see other people eating. The pizza looks worse than chuck-e cheese. Overall if you want to pay $30 +the price for socks + arcade cards + over priced frozen pizza, at least do it where they care more about hygiene and safety. This is literally my first review I’ve ever posted anywhere for a bit of scope on how appalled I was.
