Reviewer: lewwni
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Two things to know:
1. My husband travels for work and my daughter and i often travel with him. Our favorite thing to do is explore indoor playgrounds when in a new area. All this to say, I’ve been to A LOT of indoor playgrounds.
2. I only leave reviews publicly when a place is extraordinary or extraordinarily bad. I’m writing this one publicly in hopes of saving another family money and time.

Hands down, the worst indoor playground I’ve ever experienced.

Firstly, the front desk employee was sitting in a corner on her phone when we walked in. She looked up and saw us and carried on with what she was doing. After about two minutes of this she begrudgingly walked over and the greeting we were given was: “you do know we close at 8 right?” not even a hello. To which I replied, “yes.” It was 6pm so I understood the attempt to make sure I was informed, but that wasn’t the intent as she followed with: “we WILL close at 8pm, the lights will be cut off at 8:20 and you still have to pay full price.” Trying to stay positive I said “i understand, it’s no problem.” She made it very clear that she did not want to be there and that she did not want us there. I’ve never had a more miserable encounter. She talked so fast and low that I could barley understand anything she said and when I asked her to repeat, she made no adjustment, rather pointed to something that explained what she said or repeated it the same.

It cost just my daughter and I $40 to play. We’ve been to some incredibly nice indoor playgrounds, some in expensive locations, but this is the most I have ever paid, by far. My daughter is three and very chill, so she’s right on the cusp of wanting to be in the toddler area and wanting to explore the “big kid” area. So, you can pay $15 for your kid to play in the toddler zone, which is a tiny area more targeted for babies or $25 for everything. “Everything” being the toddler area and “big kid” play area; not the arcade, ropes course or the slides. Which the ropes course area and fun slides weren’t even opened. I know all of this because I asked and instead of talking me through it she pointed to a sign I could read. So it was $25 for my toddler, $2 for me to be with her and $10 for both of us a pair of socks. We brought our own grip socks, as we do this a lot, but it was “mandatory” that we each have $5 funville socks. I have NEVER been required to buy socks if I brought our own. After I paid this, I was reminded again of the closing time and sent on my way with no further instruction. I had to ask “is that everything” because she was so vague and unbothered.

I didn’t see anything being cleaned until 7pm, when they started closing. Yes, closing down so heavily that I had to find another employee (the only other employee I saw) to make sure they closed at 8pm (even though I had been told this several times.) There is ball section in the big kid area that allows kids to press buttons that cut on air and do fun things. It was very neat and my daughter LOVED this part, however only TWO out of the 8-10 machines they had actually worked. They also have air guns that you can shoot the balls out of, probably 15, none of them worked. At 7pm with NO warning, they shut all the air off. In the middle of my daughter and I playing the air suddenly cuts off and the employee that “greeted” us came in with a bag and started rounding them up. It took me a second to figure out what was going on it was so abrupt. They were pretty much pushing us out of the door at 7pm. We left at 7:38pm (not the last to leave, still several kids playing) and it felt like we were about to get the lights cut out on us. They actually made an announcement stating that lights cut off at 8:20.

All in all, it just felt like a huge scam. Half of the attractions were shut down, others closed an hour early, being required to wear funville socks, shutting down at 7, it was all too much. A few of those things I can handle, but all of that and for $40?! I would not recommend this place to anyone. Please do not waste your money here.

Reviewer: Carrie J
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: This place is so fun!  It is located by the old Chesapeake mall.  There is a burger restaurant in the same parking lot.  They do serve food though.  I saw people eating pizza fries and soda.  There is a QR code on each table you can order from.  This is a great indoor play area. Many levels of fun for kids of all ages. The colors were bright and vibrant and fun at the same time. The play area for toddlers was large and well thought out with many safe things to keep kids busy. It was for kids under 3 foot tall.  My son loved it. A multi level play area for kids older than toddlers maybe up to pre teens.  More than enough physical activities to keep your kids busy for a few hours.  You need a power card type thing to play at the arcade though but modern and fun.  Staff was polite from the time we entered until we left.  The front desk clerk was understanding of my son’s disability and allowed me to wear an entrance band on my wrist instead of him.  The lady that was in the play area with the kids was very attentive to the entire play area.  There was also a lady in charge of the large slides and she was kind to my son who ran over several times but was then scared to do the slide.  We drove 50 minutes to check it out and were glad we did. My son loves it here. I’m sure we’ll be back soon.  This is a good place for a rainy day afternoon.  The only thing I didn’t like was the price.  We paid $40 for my son and husband to each get a pair of socks and to have free play for 2 hours.

Reviewer: Rachel Martin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially a mom that needs to get out and socialize. Food is delicious!

Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

{Reviewer: Courtney Clark-Rasheed
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 days ago
Review: When booking the Nestling party package for my daughter’s 1st birthday party, I didn’t see a Gracie’s Corner theme but Kama went above and beyond to make it happen! She communicated with me throughout the entire process. I’m at a loss for words at how she pulled all of the decor together and how beautiful everything looked. She understood the assignment! She was so accommodating and her service skills are excellent too! They took care of everything which was a huge weight off of me. The only negative was that their Bluetooth speaker wasn’t connecting to my device to play my playlist. Amirah, who was an excellent host, worked it out though and played my playlist from her phone. She was on point and on top of things! I was also able to play a slideshow for the adults who hung out in the cafe area. My family, friends and their children all had a great time. We will definitely be back for playtime and future events. Thank you Natural Nest Play Cafe!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Stefanie Novak
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

We had the absolute best experience hosting my daughter’s 4th birthday party at The Nest! From start to finish, everything was seamless, stress-free, and so thoughtfully done. My daughter and her 14 little friends had an amazing time — she hasn’t stopped talking about it since!

What I loved most as a parent was that we had the entire space to ourselves, which made it feel private, safe, and comfortable for all the kids and their families. The play area is clean, spacious, and filled with fun, age-appropriate toys and activities that kept the kids happily entertained for the entire party. No one was bored for even a second!

The party room was beautifully decorated with our chosen theme — princesses! There were colorful balloons, themed table settings, and cute little touches everywhere that made the space feel magical. The Nest team truly went above and beyond with the setup. They even took care of the goodie bags and organizing the food, which was such a huge help. I literally just had to show up with the cake!

The staff was incredibly friendly, organized, and attentive throughout the event. They made sure everything ran smoothly and that both the kids and adults were having a great time. It was honestly one of the easiest and most enjoyable birthday parties we’ve ever hosted.

If you’re looking for a fun, safe, and stress-free party venue for young children, I highly recommend The Nest. We’ll definitely be coming back for future celebrations!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Rose Ross
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Very nice place to bring your small children. The only thing I would like to see more colors.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ali S
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We recently hosted our son’s 3rd birthday party at The Nest Play Café, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience from start to finish! The space was perfect for little ones—clean, safe, and full of engaging activities that kept the kids entertained the entire time. The play area is thoughtfully designed, allowing kids to explore freely while parents can relax and enjoy the celebration.

The staff was incredibly accommodating and attentive, making sure everything ran smoothly. They helped with setup, checked in throughout the party, and made sure we had everything we needed. It was so nice to be able to enjoy the moment without stressing over the little details! Overall, we couldn’t have asked for a better experience! Our son had the best time, and all of our guests raved about how fun and stress-free the party was. We highly recommend The Nest Play Café for any toddler or preschooler’s birthday celebration! We’ll definitely be back.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Samantha Motz
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Cute place. .. but lacks the total package. One would think if you see “cafe” that it would have coffee or something of the sorts for the moms while the kids play. But there’s just keurig and water cooler for hot water for tea. They could do way better.
The other issue is the lack of music…. We went and my kids were the only ones, along with the workers child playing. We could hear the daycare next door with screaming children and it was odd with no music.
It’s a cute setup, but my 4 year old was bored before the 2 hrs were even up. I think they do more to make it entertaining.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lindsey Miller
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Great place to bring little kids to play with a clean safe environment. Very relaxing and great staff.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Sarah -
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: We visited the play cafe for the first time recently & had an amazing time! the staff members were all so warm & welcoming. the play room was very clean & all toys were high quality. my daughter loved it there, we’ll definitely be visiting again soon

-----------------------

Reviewer: Anne Park
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: We really enjoy the variety of activities. Always clean and everyone is very friendly. Highly recommend

-----------------------

Reviewer: Carl Richards
Rating: 3/5
Time: 6 months ago

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mandy Garcia
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Great little place. I highly recommend it. It is clean and very fun. Each of my kids have found fun things to play with in their various age stages from infant, toddler and up. The staff are wonderful and so very kind and responsive. We also did a class that was perfect for my child and well planned. We will keep coming back.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lauren Holmes
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: Clean. Friendly staff. Child had fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: B Lankford
Rating: 4/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: This place is absolutely adorable! There is a little cafe with tables right when you walk in; a little half wall separates the play area from the Cafe area. Parents can work or just relax while watching their children play. I visited this morning with my 3yo & 1yo. They played non stop for almost 2 full hours. I liked the openess of the play area and that I didn't have to search for my child every two seconds. The toys and play equipment were super engaging and top tier quality. It made my preschool teacher heart happy lol.  I will absolutely be back with my littles!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tori Russ
Rating: 2/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: I hate to write a negative review, but I have tried to reach the owner twice by leaving voicemails & have not received a call back. I took my son there for the first time recently where he was hurt. We were the ONLY people in there & my son started screaming crying, I was consoling him as best I could & not once did the young woman who was working turn around to see if everything was okay. My son IMMEDIATELY ended up with a huge knot on his head so I asked the woman if she had ice for me (to help the swelling) & I asked for a paper towel (to wipe his nose & tears) & she moved as slow as molasses. I had to politely ask her if she could please hurry with the paper towels & she then asked “yeah, oh did something happen to him?” -__- & I told her yes… I’m not sure how she did not catch on to that, again as we are the ONLY people in there, it’s a small and quiet place. After moving very slowly with no sense of urgency, she finallt gave me some ice wrapped in a paper towel (guess they didn’t have ice packs?) & some paper towels. I finally got my son to settle down & decided to leave to care for him further. As we are leaving, I said goodbye to her & she just says goodbye have a good day…no “is he okay, how did it happen, do you need anything else?” NOTHING… I am very disappointed, especially as a children’s establishment that they had such lack of care & concern. We will not be coming back here.

-----------------------

Reviewer: A. Teresa Jasharaj
Rating: 5/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: We celebrated our little one’s first birthday here! We had the peacock party package and it was absolutely worth it. The theme was on point and handled with care, down to the last detail. It was absolutely a wonderful and fun time for all! I would highly recommended this place for your next party! We also love coming for “public play.” The premise of this play place is so perfect, there really aren’t that many places for getting out of the house with your little one. We love the Nest!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Saymith Buterbaugh
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: I went today for the first time. It was very clean. The young lady (Janiyah) working was very friendly. My son is 4 and he really enjoyed it. Will come again!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Christina Roach
Rating: 5/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: This place was awesome! My child had a blast! Awesome indoor Playground for toddlers I would say! Especially with these hot summer days! $22 for a 2 hour session with 2 adults and 1 child. I'm sorry, but that's cheap for a nice cool day in the summer with a child! I'm so happy I found this place on Google Maps and will be a happy return customer! Great first experience no issues.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Miya Brown
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This space is terrible do not take your children here. The employees was very rude they was extremely late decorating. It was leftover trash and food from the people before us very unsanitary. The owner was very rude when I spoke to her about all this. Don’t waste your money or time even going to this place. I wish I could’ve gave this place zero ⭐️

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kristina O'Brien
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I’ve now had two birthday parties here-and I probably will continue to have all future birthday parties here! I drive all the way from Dover since this location is bigger (although I haven’t seen the new upgrade!), and it is well worth it.

The space is wonderful, extremely clean and everything is sanitized, and staff have been wonderful. You can’t beat the Sunday Birthday party price and I hope it never changes, so affordable!

The second birthday party I held for my 2 year old-back in April, I arrived and staff were still cleaning up from a previous event. I was stressed and panicking since we only have 30 minutes to set up-but the staff members were so kind and apologetic. One of the younger girls even asked if there was anything she could do to help, unforeseen circumstances happen and they handled it perfect.

I do wish the child limit for the parties was a tad bigger, but that’s only because I always invite too many kids 😂. Hey,  more kids and families that attend, that’s essentially more free advertising through experience 🤷🏼‍♀️😂.

I applaud this business. The owner is so kind that she was even able to sponsor a local family in the community who is struggling. Can’t wait to visit again and have more great experiences here!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jené Freeman
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We had an amazing experience here with our family! We are new to the area and it was nice to find a clean and safe space for the kids! We 100% recommend!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Dionne McCrae
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I attended my newphews birthday here 6/2024 this past weekend. The staff was very unprofessional. They were still decorating  room as guests arrived  it was extremely unacceptable And had their children assisting them who were not dressed appropriately! Another staff member had a crying baby in the play area upon our arrival.

It was evident that this party was not important to them as it was a rushed job. The decorations started to fall down. The inflatable animals kept deflating when they could have easily went to a party store or walmart to replace it. A custom sign that was purchased was no where to be found, There was no evidence of a themed activity. The staff was incompetent in orchestrating a party game and gathering the children together. This was the worst experience we have ever had and I would not recommend this business. The owner stated that they were understaffed and if so they should have arrived 2 or more hours ahead to ensure that it was taken care of when people have paid for a party! They did not make our experience enjoyable at all and did not make an effort to make sure that this party was up to standard.
They need to take time to properly train staff, replace inflatables when they are no longer working properly, buy decorations, and make sure the rugs  and play items are clean before guest arrive. Nest is a nice place but they have to get organized and invest in the things that matter! Please think twice before booking with this business

-----------------------

Reviewer: Will Hoff
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Nest play Cafe is the perfect place to bring your little ones. Most of the toys are Montessori toys and the whole space is very safe. There was a lot for my little one to do and they were wiped out after just a 2 hour play session. We will definitely visit again!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Sydni Martin-Hernandez
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently visited Natural Nest Cafe during its advertised hours of operation on Thursdays and Fridays, from 8 AM to 4 PM. However, upon arriving at 1:45 PM, I found the store dark, doors locked, and no visible activity inside. Despite attempting to call several times, there was no answer.

Having managed businesses for family members, I understand that unforeseen circumstances can lead to closures or early closure for various reasons. However, upon checking their social media pages for any communication about an early closure, I found none.

In an attempt to gather more information, I called their Dover location, where the person who answered provided minimal information. They mentioned that if there were no reservations past 2 PM, they may close early, despite my arrival at 1:45 PM.

This experience highlights a lack of respect for both the company's stated hours of operation and its customers. Their website clearly states: 'Reservations are encouraged but not required for our 2-hour blocks of open play.' and 'We offer Open Play, Classes and Event reservations online to ensure you have a spot to play as we have limited play capacity. Drop in is offered on an as available basis only. Please call ahead.' Their website clearly states that reservations are encouraged but not required for open play, and drop-ins are accepted based on availability.

After reading other reviews mentioning other inconsistencies, and considering the significant distance I traveled (nearly 30 minutes) to visit their party space, I'm disappointed and unwilling to invest further time in visiting this establishment. It's worth noting that I solely intended to see the party space before blindly booking online and had no interest of play time during this visit. I could only imagine the further disappointment if I had children eager to play with me.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Regina Becker
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Such a cute place for littles to play and explore! This was our first time here and my children, ages 2, 7, and 9 loved it! It was the perfect rainy morning activity. The older two just came to play with their little brother but they still had a good time. The reservation process was seamless and easy and the environment is laid back. It looks like they took someone’s suggestion and added some music for the background ambience so that was a nice touch. We will definitely be back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jacob Rice
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Thank you for your 5-star rating, Jacob! We appreciate your support and look forward to welcoming you back to Natural Nest Play Cafe soon!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mary Draper
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Terrible business practices.  My granddaughters 2 year old birthday party was double booked.  We have emails stating the time.  Instead of having us share space they made us leave.  We had to reroute 15 adults and 6 two year olds to another place.  So disappointing and very emotional to say the least.  We paid $200 and they would not reimburse our funds.  Party planners move on!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tony -
Rating: 5/5

Review: Great place to take your little ones for a party or just to play! Great staff. Very accommodating.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mary Gober
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Asia June
Rating: 4/5

Review: Took my 4 year old today, and she had so much fun. Had lots of little activities for kids to do. I must add this is a very quiet environment, which is good for my daughter as she thrives in these types of environments where not too much commotion is going on. Just a suggestion, having soft meditation/ nature/ or kid music playing in the background can make the experience even better.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kara Mancinelli
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We had the opportunity to go to this location a few weeks ago and it was simply incredible!
I loved how safe the space was and that they had a separate “zone” for infants and early walkers.
You can tell the owners have spared no expense to offer amazing Montessori inspired toys.
There are so many features about this facility that I loved…the air cannon, the build your own fort, the indoor playground, the magnetic wall, the healthy food choices and co-working option.
But my favorite part, is that it’s not an overly stimulating environment.
I highly recommend this facility to anyone looking for a fun and reasonably priced place to take your infant or child.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Marie Emmons
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Great place to let your kiddos burn some steam.  It's clean and cozy. Don't expect to get a lot of work done if it's just you and your kids but if there are other children around,  then they might play together and you get a break.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Emily Miglin
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: While the experience at this location was pretty good, the overall company does not abide by their promises. I do not support this company.

We got to check out The Nest Play Cafe during soft launch today and it was an absolute blast. You can reserve a play time online or do a drop in play, however, to guarantee your spot, I recommend booking a slot online. Each slot is a 2 hour period. There is tons for kids of multiple ages to explore and play with and since it’s in soft launch, the arrangement of the room will most likely change. There is plenty of seating around the room for caregivers and well as a whole cafe to parents of independent kids to work on their laptop or grab a coffee. There are shoe cubbies for shoes and socks are required in the play area. If you forget socks, they do sell them at the front desk. There is a whole book area for older kids to sit and read while the younger kids play. There is a family bathroom for use and there is a changing table as well as a small portable potty for kids. They even had spare diapers and pads! We can’t wait to visit again and are looking into their membership option.

The only recommendations I would have would be a locked area for people to put purses and/diaper bags and having the play period include 2 adults and 1 child instead of charging for additional adults, to mirror similar local play places.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Megan Hann
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: While the place was fun for my two kids it was absolutely freezing. I wanted to find somewhere inside for them to play so we wouldn't be cold and instead my toes were quite cold the whole time. My children's hands were also cold even though they were moving all around.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kelly Davidson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I hosted my daughter's 3 year old birthday party at the Natural Nest Play Cafe - Middletown. It was such a fun space! We had 9 kids ages 5 and under who loved every minute of play time. The princess themed decorations were gorgeous. Everything was well organized and Ashley did a great job of communicating up to the event. It was a huge relief for this momma to have some support planning a birthday bash around the holidays. 10/10 would book a party again and we plan to schedule another play date there soon!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ashley Lopez
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My almost 2 year old had the greatest time meeting Bluey at The Nest Play Cafe! He tried out a lot of new and different toys for the very first time!

We will absolutely be back, especially on rainy days!
Thank you to this staff! You guys rock!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jessica Bowie
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I absolutely love this space for my little ones! The space is exceptionally clean. The toys and activities are age appropriate and modern! The staff is friendly and attentive! Perfect for an afternoon outing to get us out of the house! Keep up the great work!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Luce Reister
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This place was amazing! It was clean, the girl at the front was so kind and helpful, and there was a great selection of play toys. We will be back next time we drive through the area!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Cassandra Wilson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Love the natural feel and snacks!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Donna Bell
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Great place for younger children.
I like that the children area was separated from where the parents can sit and keep an eye on them or take off their shoes to participate with the children. Very friendly staff and the facility was clean.

Reviewer: Emily Hayes
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We had a birthday party here over the weekend and it was great! The kids enjoyed themselves and two hours was plenty of time to play and open presents/cake . The two young girls who were working could have been a little more welcoming, however, they did look pretty young so maybe just shy? I’m not sure, but either way, we had a great time!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Airiel Peoples
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Absolutely amazing and beautiful space! I love the natural wood play area and organic healthy snack options for my kiddo. Thank you for hosting out event. and We’ll be back soon!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Courtney Clarke
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: 😍 …

-----------------------

Reviewer: LaTynia Young
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: I was one of the moms that attended the Bluey event Dec 3rd.  This was my first time at this establishment and it is mainly for children up to 3 years of age even though an 6 year old would just adapt to the environment. This was a Christmas event and I must say there was nothing that I saw that stood out to be Christmas at all. My daughter was the only child wearing a Christmas hat for the Christmas theme.  I thought that Bluey would have had on a Christmas hat like shown on the website. Where was the Christmas tree? Why weren’t the owners dressed in Christmas gear as the organizers of the event because I certainly was dressed for the cause as an adult.  The activities were vague and some of the children and parents didn’t even know some activities were happening because it was unannounced and unorganized.  For the price, I thought the activities were going to be more structured according to the events that were listed.  We didn’t know that our children could make gingerbread houses until we were leaving because there was no announcement of this activity. We saw little children in the corner which prompted our children to join in which made us stay an extra 15-20 min to do this activity. There is nowhere on the website that you need grip socks to play.  It just said socks! Most people sign waivers when they get to an establishment so this should have been clear online when you check out. The children who needed socks were charged $5 for non-grip socks.  Why don’t they sell the socks that are required?  We asked for a refund only when we learned that some of our children didn’t have the proper socks to play and they were going to be denied play time with Bluey. I have been to hundreds of events and have paid high and low for my child to experience fun, however, this was not what I expected. This review is not to deter you from visiting this small business but for this business to gracefully understand and respect the review and experience of their customers in hopes to do better. The idea was there, it was just poorly executed.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tiffany & Jemal Jones
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Nest Cafe is a breath of fresh air. Service is great. The establishment is well organized, clean, and very kid friendly.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Theresa
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Thank you for the review!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jemika Dufrene
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I'm just hoping they expand to New Castle county. Great concept, well maintained and most importantly my baby had fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lauren Childs
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My 10 month old LOVES The Nest! She’s been playing here since she was 6 months and it’s amazing to see her enjoy more of the play area as she grows. It’s a favorite spot for us to visit when we drive to NJ to visit family. We can’t wait to visit the Dover location soon.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Robyn Harding
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This vendor is nothing but a scam. I ordered a Gathre block set item listed as "in stock," only to have it removed from their website right after I paid. When I asked about availability, they made me wait days for a response from their distributor. It was clear they were stalling.

Realizing the item was sold out everywhere, I requested a cancellation. They not only charged me 10% for this, they also cancelled the order and charged the fee, despite my willingness to keep the order.

This vendor tried to make $38 off me, knowing the item wasn't in stock. I've involved my bank to get my money back. Don't make the same mistake. Buy from the official Gathre site. If it's "out of stock," it truly is.

In short, this vendor's deceitful actions show they're a complete scam. Don't fall for it.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Amanda Unitas
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Amazing concept and fantastic play cafe. Everything was clean and safe. All the kiddos had fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Emily Pulliam
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: First time visiting today and we’ll definitely be back! Muted colors, wooden toys, soft instrumental music. Organic snacks and juices. Plenty of comfy spots to sit in and out of the play area, lots of charging stations. Two hour play time was perfect

-----------------------

Reviewer: Te Ka
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: What a great concept! Our children (1 and 5 years old) loved this alternative indoor playground. Staff was super friendly and welcoming. A little more explanation would be good (f.e. „Help yourself to the coffee over there“). The concept is very close to Maria Montessori’s theory’s of learning. Everything is made of wood or organic material, non-toxic and in sober colors. It was equally attracting our baby and our 5 year old. We loved the relaxing music! Everything was extremely clean. Some suggested improvements: a step stool for toddlers would be great in the restroom. And a little further training in coffee making skills. 😊

-----------------------

Reviewer: Cynthia Glace
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Highly recommend! I took my 18MO here for a reserved open play 2-hour session and we had such a great time. It’s bright and clean and there’s plenty of things for your little ones to get into. I drove over an hour specifically to come here and I was not disappointed. I even met the owner Ashley who was the sweetest (and so are her kids). I hope to make it back again soon with my 3YO as well.

-----------------------

Reviewer: meg.c
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Really recommend this place! It's so perfect for little ones, especially age 0-5. My 3 year old had a blast and cried when we left because he wanted to stay. They have plenty of spots for parents to sit and watch their little ones play. It was really nice and a great addition! They have snacks for Littles and adults, plus free coffee and water! Great and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend. I wish they let parents come for free or did a deal like buy one parent ticket get the other free because I would love to bring my husband next time. Overall amazing experience!! Deff try it out on a hot or rainy day when you need your kids to burn off energy!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kim Mazewski
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Wow wow wow it exceeded my hopes as a beautiful, creative, open ended play for my toddler that was NOT loud, overstimulating, or chaotic. I mean I literally felt so calm and relaxed, as I sipped coffee and enjoyed watching my little one explore the many options for gross and fine motor play, sensory play, music and games. We will 100% be signing him up for the science and music classes. Ashley was a responsive and generous host to the group of littles.

Music for grownups without lyrics and a classical version playing; very comfortable seating options for us, where you can easily keep an eye on your kid, they prioritize safety and cleanliness. The toys and activities for kids are top of the line, amazing quality, and spark joy and creativity ❤️

Thanks for a great first visit, we will be back soon with more friends!}

-2 adults included in child price
-you have to leave to eat outside food (you can bring water bottles and buy food there)
-You can come back after leaving if it's the same day, just keep your receipt

Reviewer: Andy Hu

Review: I went with my daughter on a Friday morning and the place was not busy at all. Checking in was easy and at first I was really happy to see my daughter having fun in the toddler area. The ball pit area was large and there was a screen with games and a pipe system that I have not seen at other places. There was different slides and an obstacle course that was fun for my child.
The reason for the two star was the lack of staff and lack of attention paid to the play area. First, if there was food, I couldn’t tell because there wasn’t a menu or display to see prices. I did see a refrigerator full of drinks but i didn’t ask for the price. Second, I didn’t see any staff in the play area the entire time I was there, and that was a problem because I saw two Dads yelling at each other over something and it was getting heated but no one to say anything. Then, the most basic rule of wearing socks in the play area wasn’t enforced and it was pretty gross to see parents and one kid running around in bare feet. There was also broken equipment and the play area where there was supposed to be toys was mostly empty with a little play kitchen. I really wanted to like it but based on what I read, it’s probably to come on weekends when the management care to have staff there.

Reviewer: Ashley Shah
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I had my daughter’s birthday here recently and it was a really great experience overall. Our party host, Emma, did an amazing job setting up all our decorations and taking care of our very large party (over 20 kids). We had never been to Me Land before and we were kind of worried due to a lot of negative reviews we saw about a month after booking. For our experience on a Saturday afternoon the facility was clean. The lobby was clean when we entered and it was easy to sign in. The play area was also pretty clean in my opinion. The floors were not sticky, there was no trash, etc. I did not use the restrooms so I cannot provide a review on that. The staff was very helpful and friendly, everyone had such a great attitude despite how busy it was. Overall we had a blast, and I think this is an excellent place to have a party. My only feedback to management would be I would like the gate to be more closely monitored. There were a few times I went back and forth from the play area to the lobby and there was not a staff member at the gate. Even though the front desk was staffed, there really needs to be an attendant at the gate at all times especially as there’s a lot of younger children (under 5) who could have easily slipped out.

Reviewer: Stamford Bridge
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: The overall concept is great and has a lot of potential, but there are some important areas that could be improved—particularly around sanitation and safety.

Currently, sanitation measures appear to be lacking. For example, while shoes are removed in the common area outside the play zone, not all guests are provided with socks. This increases the risk of germs and dirt being transferred into the play area. Additionally, there is no clear signage reminding guests to wear disposable shoe covers before entering the restrooms. As a result, the vast majority of children and adults are walking in and out of the restroom without shoe covers, which further compromises the cleanliness of the play surface.

It would be beneficial to install clear, visible signage near the restroom entrance reminding everyone to use the provided shoe covers. Staff should also be empowered and encouraged to gently remind guests to follow hygiene protocols if they observe unsanitary behavior.

Lastly, around 7 p.m., there was no staff member monitoring the main entrance/exit. This poses a potential safety concern, as it leaves room for children to exit unaccompanied or with someone they may not know. Prioritizing both sanitation and safety with a few small but impactful adjustments can greatly improve the overall experience for everyone.

Anyways, I would definitely go back if it was cleaner but that’s keeping us from coming back until we hear otherwise unfortunately.

Reviewer: Joyce Kang
Rating: 2/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I will say, first off, that my kids enjoyed this place. There are so many fun slides and play areas that we didn’t even get to check out the facility because it was VERY busy when we went (weekend). However, they need to work on managing and monitoring their play areas because there were numerous times when the older kids/preteens would be running around this place with foam blocks in their hands ready to throw it at anyone. They were also taking advantage of the slides and there was one slide, in particular, that they were hogging-this is one where you needed these blow-up tubes to sit in to go down the slide. A group of older kids were running up and down the slide constantly with the tubes, essentially, preventing other kids from going on it. My toddler and my friends’ child wanted to go down it, so once we got a tube the group of kids had no clue we were trying to go down. I had to ask them to move and to go up the stairs if they wanted to go down the slide again. They reluctantly listened, but I had to yell at them about two more times because, again, they kept running up and down the slide instead of using the stairs. This was so frustrating as a parent that there were no workers nearby to monitor/mitigate the situation. I feel like this is ridiculous that they do not feel the need to monitor certain high-traffic areas, such as the slides and the ball pit, where a lot of kids misbehave and take advantage. I am disappointed and hope that they make changes because I certainly would not want anyone else’s kids to get hurt or not have the chance to enjoy all of the play areas, just because there is no one there to monitor any misbehaving kids.

At one point the ceiling started leaking water and when this was brought to attention I did not see any safety measures being taken.

You may be fooled by the reasonable price option this facility is advertising but if you want quality would not recommend this place.

Review: We first visited MeLand in August 2024 when they first opened. We would have rated them a 5 at that time because the place was clean and so fun! It is now January 2025 and we are giving them a 2 star rating for various reasons. The first being the cleanliness. The photos attached are from our visit on a not so busy Wednesday morning. The amount of dust from the bathroom vents to all over the play area floor was pretty gross. This makes me think they do not clean the toys. The bathroom (women) was not clean (toilets all had something in or on them) with the trash cans overflowing. A lot of the toy blocks were bitten into and the upstairs of the toddler area where when we first came to visit was a play hospital, kitchen, etc. there was nothing. The ball pit air tube had a giant broccoli stick in it and was not working properly. Doors and steaming wheels missing off of the play cars. We did inform the staff about this but they didn’t really care too much. The lights do not work on some of the areas and one even had old pizza smeared across it. This is how I could tell the play space has not been cleaned. We asked the employees for a slice of pizza and quickly learned that they don’t even sell food during the weekdays aside from small bags of chips and soda. This is not on their website or posted anywhere in the establishment. I still gave the place a two star rating because they do have some fun attributes but overall they get a solid two.

Reviewer: Shaun

Time: 5 months ago
Review: Parents beware... This is a great place for your kids to have fun, but it can be crowded. I took my children here to meet up with a friend who was celebrating her daughter's birthday and it was on a Saturday afternoon. The place was extremely crowded. There were pretty much no cubbies to put our belongings in so we had to get bags out of our vehicles put our items in the bags and place them on top of the cubbies. Everyone is required to take their shoes off if you are going in the play area so keep that in mind and be sure that you bring socks. Children are supposed to bring socks that have a non-slip bottom such as the socks they receive at other play places, they do not give these socks with admission but you can purchase them. I didn't see anyone doing a lot of sanitation with the number of kids that were in the play place so I would consider that if you have children that might be sick or are easy to get sick. You may want to go at a time where they are not as busy. The bathrooms and the floors definitely needed some attention and I didn't see anyone making moves to do any cleaning of the bathrooms or the floors considering that there was a lot of wet feet coming into the building from the weather. It was fun and the kids had a great time but I would definitely choose a time when they are not as busy if you like for your kids to be able to enjoy without having to wait due to the number of children in the location. I'm not certain that I would take my kids back often but they did have a good time.

Review: Me Land is a spacious indoor playground with some fun features. The equipment is new and clean, which is a definite plus. However, the lack of a designated area for crawlers is a major drawback.
The biggest issue we encountered was the overcrowding. It often feels like there are more adults standing around than kids playing, making it difficult for children to navigate and enjoy the space.
Furthermore, the staff seemed indifferent and even rude at times, which was disappointing.
Overall: Me Land has potential, but the lack of a crawler area and the frequent overcrowding significantly impact the experience. We'll likely continue to visit occasionally because our child enjoys it, but we hope they address these concerns in the future.

Reviewer: Erica Rossum
Rating: 2/5
Time: Edited 5 months ago
Review: I am so disappointed in this place its unbelievable. I saw this place on IG and thought it would be a great place for a birthday playdate for the kid (age 6 with a 2 YO bro). Read some reviews on cleanliness and decided to still take a chance.

FIRST there are NO ADULT managers onsite (like the oldest employee was maybe 18). The kids running the place had to call the manager for guidance or questions they were unable to answer.

SECOND I had to ask the kids working to take out the trash (bc it was overfilled to capacity), wipe the table down in the common area, and sweep. There was also a pile of trash on the floor on the other side of the common area the entire time I was there (530-8p). They never came and swept said trash that was on the floor.

THIRD the menu for food was not available during our visit and I was told they do not serve food on Fridays and but would provide pizza when reserving a party room.

FOURTH the bathrooms are in the play area where its socks only... So you're walking into the bathroom with your play socks and returning back to the play area with the same socks ... WHAT!

My kid had the time of his life and the playground itself would be 5 stars because of the various courses, games, and overall structure. What they have is nothing I've seen before at an indoor playground BUT THE CLEANLINESS... DISGUSTING... and for that I will not be going back and give this establishment 2 star.

At 10 years old, they’re growing out of some of the other indoor playgrounds in the area but Me Land had larger play structures and more to keep them engaged. I was very disappointed in the staff and cleanliness of Me Land though. The staff seemed unbothered and were on their phones throughout our time there. They also don’t wear uniforms so it’s difficult to know who is a staff member and who isn’t. They did not enforce the nonslip socks, in fact, they didn’t seem to be monitoring for socks period. There were some people playing barefoot. In the sitting area, the floor was filthy at opening. It looked like it hadn’t been swept or mopped in several days. The tables for snacking were covered in spills and crumbs. I think they have a great space but staff needs better training and the playground needs better upkeep.

Review: My kids and I had a wonderful time! Absolutely no complaints on the facility or the staff; except who I’m assuming is the manager, old white lady with glasses. She was very rude to me and my family when we came in and spoke over me when checking in. She seems to make her employees do all the dirty work and not take initiative her self, if you are representing the company as the manager you should be nicer and take the initiative yourself instead of leaving it to your younger employees. I also saw her sitting down on her phone while the other employees were running around tending to other guests, which I believe is heavily unprofessional. The rest of the staff were very friendly and welcoming and would kindly inform parents and children of the rules, but every time she would come out she was rude with the children and some of the adults, I understand having policies and rules to follow but there is no need to be rude especially when talking to children. I also think if there is a problem to come to the parent if possible because most children can’t comprehend what they’re being told. Other than that, my experience was good and my family and I will definitely be coming back and I highly recommend this place!! Just fix the management she is not a good face for your company.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Nagendra Singh
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: Wonderful Experience at Kidz Jungle Land – Thanks to Ms. Stacy!

We’ve been coming to Kidz Jungle Land at White Marsh almost every day, and I can’t say enough great things about Ms. Stacy, the manager. She has been absolutely amazing!

Ms. Stacy is extremely attentive to the safety of every child. She’s always alert, making sure no child is ever left unattended or near the exit unsupervised. Her dedication to keeping the play area clean and organized is impressive, even during busy weekends. It's clear she takes pride in ensuring the space is both fun and safe for all families.

She’s also very pleasant and interactive with the kids. My 4-year-old son absolutely adores her and is always excited to see her. She has a special way of making children feel welcome and cared for.

A few months ago, we hosted our son’s birthday party at Kidz Jungle Land. Ms. Stacy and Ash went above and beyond to help us decorate and manage the event. They made the whole experience smooth and stress-free for us. Hosting a party in a large, active space is no small task, but they handled everything like true professionals.

Running such a big facility smoothly—especially during weekends—isn’t easy, but Ms. Stacy and her team consistently do an outstanding job. They not only maintain the space beautifully but also treat every guest with kindness, professionalism, and a strong focus on safety.

Big thanks to Ms. Stacy and everyone at Kidz Jungle Land! We truly appreciate all you do.

Reviewer: Jess Posluszny
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We hosted a private “Dino-FOUR” themed birthday party at Kids Jungleland, and I cannot say enough amazing things about Stacy, the manager. From the very beginning, Stacy went above and beyond — her communication was clear, friendly, and super helpful. She guided us through planning and decision-making, explained all of our options in detail, and made the process completely stress-free.

What really stood out was her dedication. Stacy normally has Mondays off, but she made sure she was there specifically for our party — and she didn’t miss a beat. She helped carry in decorations, set up the party room, and constantly checked in to offer help or handle little things behind the scenes that made a big difference. You could tell she genuinely cared about making sure everything went smoothly!

The two party attendants working with her were also fantastic — helping with cleanup, making sure the pizza and drinks were out on time, and just keeping everything on track without ever being in the way.

The kids had an absolute blast, and honestly, I think the adults had just as much fun. I’m beyond grateful for all the help and care we received. We would absolutely consider hosting another party here again. Thank you, Stacy and the whole Kids Jungleland team, for making sure our little dude had a blast!

The room was great, the playground was a hit with all of the kids (and some adults, too! 😜) and the staff went above and beyond. Our party host was Stacy and she was amazing. She jumped right in to help us set up, decorated the room with us and offered her expertise on what worked best in what area, and we loved all of the suggestions. She set our table instead of just stacking the plates by the food (which is what I planned to do) She checked in on us frequently and was never too far if we had any questions. The kids loved getting to run and play and the adults loved having access to the party room for a break and to have a home base for all of our guests. Every party guest said how much fun they had and how great the room and party were. We will be visiting frequently, especially as winter approaches, and will probably end up returning for his birthday next year

Reviewer: Sarah Kaufmann
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We had a great time visiting the Natural Nest in Newark. The facility is well kept and there are plenty of activities to range different ages. AHK has only ever played at one other in-door play park, and this one was unmatched. There are so many toys for her age, and height- she's TINY! Calming music streams through the speakers as you enjoy your play session. I loved that they offered food and beverages in the case you need one. There's an ample amount of room to store your belongings. They even have high chairs if you need to feed your little ones, and shared clogs so you don't have to enter the bathroom in just your socks!

The only negative I have to say about this particular location is the lack of steps on the play gym. There is ramp with grip, but it's pretty steep and tough to climb while guiding a small toddler. The only other option is a climbing wall, which again, not super easy to navigate to the top with your child.

We don't live in DE, but I would definitely recommend Natural Nest to others in the future!

Review: The employees at this location are consistently unaware of their surroundings. They allow their own children to run amuck in the facility, they do not treat visitors with kindness, and they seem to ignore any needs that arise. The bathroom had no paper towels or toilet paper, a big kid was playing on the slide and the entire structure swayed with their weight, the employees child was running around without a shirt…
Just consistently disappointing. I would not recommend either of the locations to anyone.

Reviewer: Navene Johnson
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: I wanted to love this facility, but unfortunately, my experience left a lot to be desired.

We booked a last-minute DIY party, and while I appreciated their flexibility with scheduling, the turnaround time on the details was understandably short. I was asked to provide an estimated number of children, and I was told it didn’t need to be exact—just so they could ensure enough seating.

However, on the day of the party, I was told I had to pay for the number I initially estimated.
I explained that I planned to pay at the end, once I had a final headcount. When the party ended, I again explained that fewer children attended than expected. Despite this, I was told the owner insisted I still pay for the original number, which felt unfair and inflexible.

We also paid extra for the bubble machine, which turned out to be a complete nightmare.
Within 3–4 minutes, the first child slipped and fell due to the slippery puddles the bubbles created. I asked if the charge could be removed, as it created a safety hazard. The staff member attempted to clean it with a paper towel, which only made the mess worse. She said she would ask about the charge, but I was ultimately told I still had to pay. I then asked if we could at least move the machine to a safer location, since I was being charged for it.

When I asked about resolving the billing issue, I was told to message someone, which I did.
Unfortunately, the person who responded directed me back to the same individual at the facility who had already said she couldn’t help me. It felt like I was being passed around without any resolution.

To add to the frustration, our trash can was full, and I had to ask for another bag. While the young lady helping us was friendly and clearly doing her best, I feel that her supervisor failed both her and me.

I really wanted this to be a great experience, but it ended up being more stressful than joyful.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kim Martinez
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I was genuinely excited for Play Nest Café in Newark to open, as it’s much closer to me than the Middletown location. However, after today’s experience, I’d rather make the drive to Middletown, where the new licensed owner provides exceptional customer service. She’s attentive, passionate about her role, and goes above and beyond to ensure all families feel welcomed. Her love for what she does is clear—every child is treated fairly, and every parent feels included. That kind of atmosphere is what makes a business thrive.

Unfortunately, Newark’s location has consistently fallen short of those standards for me. Today marked the third chance I gave this location to change my perspective, but it was yet another disappointing experience. I understand that we all have off days, especially as moms, but the consistent lack of effort to create a welcoming environment here speaks volumes.

When my son and I arrived, the atmosphere was uninviting from the start. My son, full of excitement, was quickly met with situations that felt dismissive and unfair. Another child began snatching toys from him, and while her mother was distracted, the person in charge saw it all unfold yet chose to intervene only in favor of the other child. At one point, when my son happily tried to engage with the person in charge’s child, she physically pulled her child away from him, leaving my son visibly saddened. The lack of acknowledgment or effort to include us left me feeling incredibly uncomfortable.

In contrast, my experience at Middletown’s Play Nest Café has always been positive, thanks to the owner’s genuine care for families and her inclusive approach. Today’s experience reinforced the importance of hiring staff who align with a business’s values and understand how to make families feel valued. Sadly, this hasn’t been my experience at Newark.

As much as I love supporting small businesses, I cannot continue to spend my money at a location where I feel unwelcome and discriminated against, nor will I subject my son to such treatment. While the space is aesthetically pleasing, the experience simply doesn’t reflect the environment it should. If you value fairness, inclusion, and genuine customer service, I cannot recommend the Newark location.

I got there at 12:00 pm exact and i left within 20 minutes due to how uncomfortable, depressing etc is was .

-----------------------

Reviewer: Isaias Polanco
Rating: 1/5

Review: I don’t typically write reviews, but I felt compelled to share my experience. Today, my wife took our son to this location, and unfortunately, the staff member in charge made them feel unwelcome and uncomfortable throughout their visit. This individual repeatedly gave them unpleasant looks and displayed discriminatory behavior.

Additionally, there were children being rude to my son, taking all the toys from him, yet the staff member failed to address the situation or remind the children that the toys are for everyone to share.

We usually visit the Middletown location, where the service is exceptional, and the atmosphere is always welcoming. Unfortunately, this is the second time we’ve had a negative experience at this particular location, which is why I’m writing this review. I do not recommend bringing your children here due to the poor service.

Reviewer: Kaitlyn M
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We love visiting this indoor playground—it's truly a gem for families with young kids! Every time we walk through the doors, it feels like a fresh experience. Emily and Rebecca are always so kind and welcoming, and you can tell how much time and passion Emily pours into making the space special.

The variety of toys and activities keeps my child engaged every time we come. I love that the furniture and play areas are frequently rearranged—it keeps things exciting and new, even for regular visitors like us. They also host fun, events throughout the year. We recently attended an Easter egg hunt, and I really appreciated how thoughtfully it was set up so little ones weren’t overwhelmed. It was my daughter’s first time meeting the Easter Bunny and I am thrilled she had a positive experience.

Sometimes there’s even a themed sensory bin or fun surprise—like the day we came in and there were balloons on the wall, which my child noticed right away. There’s a cozy, clean area for nursing mothers, complimentary coffee for parents, and a snack area with child-sized tables and chairs—such a thoughtful touch. I also love the no-shoes policy, which helps keep the space clean and comfy for the kids.

It’s such a welcoming environment, and we always look forward to our visits. I recommend this place to any family looking for a safe, engaging, and thoughtfully designed indoor play space!

Review: Hey Everyone!

(Yes it says I’m from NJ - I was visiting family and this was their party)

As soon as you walk in, it’s very bright atmosphere, smells great and VERY CLEAN!  Everyone took their shoes off prior to entering the play area where they have multiple interaction sections for each creative child and all their desires.  Also the fact that there were 10 toddlers in the same room and the volume was at a 4 out of 10 I was highly impressed that something like that was even possible lol. They were so extremely engaged that everyone played so nice and quiet at each stations. Also if any of the toys are some how soiled (ie, child places fake veggie in the mouth) there is a dirty bin where you place all toys to be sanitized!! Trust me , Emily did not miss a single detail! These are things I highly value as a parent.

There was an area in the back with flooring as an area to eat and have snacks off the carpet play area.

In the back hall there was a lovely breastfeeding room with a cozy chair and privacy curtains and fully loaded diaper changing station!!

This place was a dream come true for a mom (or any guardian for that matter)
And even to this day my toddler keeps asking to go back!

I had to stop in and support our local businesses that build such beautiful space  that keeps our community connected!!

Reviewer: Laura B
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a week ago
Review: We have been to Kids Empire more than a handful of times at this point and also had my son’s birthday party there yesterday. It is always clean, everything is well maintained, and everyone always has a blast. I love how the adults are encouraged to participate with their kids and there’s lots of fun things to do without having a ton of extra money-sucking arcade games. They few they have let you play till you win.

As for the birthday party, the whole experience was amazing. We chose the meal package and literally everything was taken care of for us. All we had to do was send invitations and show up. Least stressful birthday party ever.  Our party host, Rashid, was friendly, attentive, and anticipated our every need or want. He really made sure everything went off without a hitch and made sure we were satisfied with everything throughout the whole event.

I highly recommend Kids Empire for a day of fun or for a birthday party.

Review: Kind of disappointed with them this time . We came a few years ago and liked it . Came back this morning at opening , I was by myself with my two kids . I get it’s a public place , but I really wish I would’ve been informed that they had like a field trip or whatever coming . I would have just came back later . I paid full price and only got half an hour with my kiddos inside . I can’t keep track of two children by myself with a small room full of probably 100 some kids . I had to apologize to my kids for wasting their time , and I’m pretty upset I wasted my money . Personally I think they should’ve let me know , or just book a few hours specifically for the field trip and not accept other guests . A lot of these kids were playing in the zone meant for much smaller kids . I had kids 3 times the size of my 2 and 4 year old trampling over them to go down toddler slides . Very disappointing .

Reviewer: The Real Review
Rating: 4/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: Junior Playland!
Located In Newton Square PA.
About 25 Minutes From Claymont DE.
A Space Themed Indoor Play Area!
My 6 year old loves space, so
We Decided To Give It A Shot …
Here is the REAL review!
This play area is THE BEST toddler play area we have been to recently.
TODDLER play area being the key word.
The have plenty of things to do for your little ones!
My 2.5 year old and my 6 year old LOVED it.
My 12 year old was not impressed at all.
They should make the age limit 10 honestly.
Because it’s not much for 12 year olds to do here.
They have a small trampoline area.
Trampoline area has 2 basketball hoops.
The soft play area is very interactive and fun.
They have multiple rock climbing walls!
The arcade is very lack luster.
Clearly that wasn’t the focus for this play area.
Birthday rooms on the second floor to accommodate birthday parties.
Overall Very fairly priced!
Very clean.
Staff was walking around wiping things down while we were in the building.
Staff were friendly.
Some of them looked miserable but who wouldn’t be getting paid next to nothing to listen to kids scream all day lol.
They do 2 hour time slots so it doesn’t get overcrowded.
This was the pricing for the weekend,
$16.99 ages 1-2
$21.99 ages 3-12
$9.99 6 -11 months
but free with a paying sibling
1 adult is  free per family.
$6.99 for each additional  adult. no in and out
2 hour open play Time slot are :  9am/11am/1pm/3pm/5pm
They do offer cheaper pricing on week days and all day passes on Fridays.
The bathrooms were clean!
They offered crocs to slip on at the bathroom and I thought that was very convenient.
They even had a toddler potty to help the little ones!
They do have refreshments.
They offer pizza and wings but do not have a kitchen they bring it in from a local business.
We had 3 slices of pizza, 3 juices, 2 star buck coffees in the glass bottle, and one can soda for $25. Very fair.
In total for tickets, food, drinks, and a few games we spent $100!
All in all it was fun and my younger kids had a blast!
We will definitely bring them back!
If you’re in the area or looking to try something new, give Junior play land a chance!

Reviewer: Margie Beerhalter
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: WOW! What a fabulous place. By chance, I saw the sign and stopped in to check it out. Couldn't fill out the waiver fast enough to my grandson's (4 yrs.) liking. We were not disappointed. So many things to do, extremely clean, friendly staff. Music playlist was well chosen and at perfect volume---enough to hear, if listening, but not intrusive if occupied in play. No shoes for all (including adults), and slip ons available at the bathroom entrances were impressive. We happened to stop by on a Friday. ALL-day play till 8:00 at a great price. We stayed 3. If not happy with the menu, you can leave and come back. Broad hours of operation (9-8:00-except Sunday till 6:00) make it convenient for most families.

I've only written 2 reviews online (including this one). If I could have given both higher stars, I would have. I went to their website when I returned home and was surprised to see the overall rating, UNTIL I read the reviews. Look people, Junior Playland just opened in November. They're still working out the kinks---to be expected. Refreshing to see management respond to some reviews. If you are going (by choice or necessity) on a Saturday (especially) or Sunday, of course, the place is going to be more crowded. Also, my opinion--be fair---1 bad/good review per group, then just don't go back, if not happy. Otherwise, it doesn't give an accurate overall rating. Let's face it---stuff happens. Management seemed fair in how they handled those situations. One last thing---it's the adult's responsibility to monitor their child's play. Remove them from a situation, if you don't feel comfortable. Needless to say, we'll be back often in spite of the hour ride to get there.

Reviewer: Tyler Schmalhofer
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: EDIT IN RESPONSE TO OWNER REPLY:

We tried to address it but you have been unresponsive to my email outreach and no phone call has been returned. You seem to only respond on Google reviews vs. actual outreaches. On the day of the party there was not a staff member on hand above high school age to assist or address our concerns. And the following day when I stopped by to discuss, you were again not available.

I don’t know who Ann is, but I’m sorry to hear she had a similar poor experience.

Having your friends post fake reviews to counter actual reviews from people who had poor experiences to try and stay above a 4 star rating is a questionable business practice.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

Don’t recommend them for birthdays. They jam as much possible business into 1 hour room windows which robs people of set up time for their parties and also has new parties going into unsanitized rooms. The whole process is very chaotic and disorganized and if you aren’t actively policing the time yourself, they will not be helping you. There doesn’t appear to be an actual process they follow to support birthday parties.

They also do not have any process for crowd control. They sell two hour windows for play/parties, but they do not enforce a policy to actually ensure people leave after their window ends. This makes it unreasonably overcrowded, especially as the day goes on. Most places close for a period of time to ensure integrity of the play windows and allow parties the ability to get set up and not worry about encroaching on or being encroached on by other parties.

Other play places in the area are better positioned for these parties, and I would recommend choosing them for your sanity and to not waste $700 on a free for all setup.

Reviewer: Jane Liu
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 4 months ago
Review: Absolutely terrible experience having my toddler’s birthday party here.

First thing we walked in and it was absolutely packed and way over capacity. People were not even getting checked in nor were time slots being verified. It was absolute chaos all over the play areas

When it was time for our party room there was zero coordination. I had to find our room myself and get all our guests into the room (they told me the wrong room number) AND THEY LOST ALL OUR FOOD AND CAKE. An employee literally walked me from party room to party room looking to see if other parties were being served and eating our food! Finally they took me down to the area behind the desk where they all proceeded to just stand there yelling at each other with no one knowing where our stuff was. Eventually I walked past the arguing employees and went to look for it myself and found it was tucked in the back of the storage area.

Even though we were within our guest count for the package we purchased there was not enough room in our room, we had guests sitting on the floor eating pizza with their kids. Additionally, our package included juice and utensils, which we never got and had to ask for forks for our cake ourselves.

When we asked to talk to a manager a teenager came over and said “it’s not our fault”

Upon returning back home, we realized that an employee had collected some of the gifts from our guests when they entered but we never received them. So our daughter is now missing some of her birthday gifts.

I was so embarrassed by this entire party and I spent the night apologizing to our guests and sending up follow up apology messages to our attendees. For how much we spent on this I cannot believe this is what we got…

EDIT IN RESPONSE TO OWNER’S RESPONSE:
I disagree with this rebuttal, the owner was not present so I am relaying my experience. I personally was taken from room to room to look for our food while other people were having their parties (as I mentioned earlier). It was not located in five minutes and I was the one who found the food myself and had my husband personally go down to carry the cake up himself in fear of another mishap.

I did not mention the power outage as I understand this was not in anyone’s control and all the concerns I’ve outlined occurred prior to the power outage. However, if the gifts were meant to be delivered to the room as part of set up and the power outage happened after we were in our room, then how did the power outage affect visibility of the gifts in storage? It feels like the power outage is now being used as an excuse for bad services rendered throughout the evening.

For having spent almost $700, this was not the service i was expecting
