Reviewer: Sony
Rating: 3/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: The place was nice, but it's unfortunately pretty hidden and not easily accessible. I live close by and had no idea this place even excited!

PROS: The space is clean, and not too busy if you go during the week due to its low location-visibility. It's great for older kids between 7 and up, and even for adults who want to get some exercise on an obstacle course.

CONS: While the space is nice and the staff were friendly, the layout of the rooms and equipment was a bit disjointed and doesn't flow well. There is one block of cubbies in the main area, which is fine if not crowded, but nowhere near enough for a busy day. There are only a couple benches in the main area, with the only tables being in the back corner of the small kids area which aren't immediately visible. Everything felt very closed off and compartmentalized rather than open and accessible like at the other locations. Equipment is pretty limited for older kids and very little to do for toddlers. The one section they do have for younger kids is basically a three -part section of magnetic building blocks that won't hold a toddler's attention for longer than maybe 20 minutes. The obstacle course is pretty basic, and when not busy, it can be fun but on a crowded day, I don't see how kids can fully enjoy it due to the layout.

The cafe and the play area are completely separate, with the cafe being on the top floor when you come in. So, if you want food or a drink you can't easily pause and go over to a table, you'll have to walk up a flight of stairs and completely exit the play area, which I super wasn't fond of.

I also wasn't fond of the flooring. The mats used were just slightly thicker puzzle pieces rather than the thick foam padding that's seen in other play places. Because of that, I worried the floor would still be a bit too hard if falling from a higher height, definitely for my toddler (who still wanted to play in the bigger area), but even for a slightly bigger kid.

Additionally, there is zero cell phone reception in the building, so I couldn't even pull up the waiver when the staff asked me to use the QR code. You need to connect to the WiFi if you want to have any access to your phone--also a strike for me.

All in all, this is a great place for older kids and I love the proximity to where we live, however, I was a little disappointed there wasn't as much age-appropriate things for my 2 year old to do because of the type of equipment available. While I'd still recommend this place if you have older kids, you might fare better at the other locations for the younger kiddos.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Deanna Owens
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: Very impressed with the vibe of this place. AMAZING murals and art pieces throughout. 10/10

Customer service: Joselyn was incredibly professional and helpful and made our time at Parkour an absolute breeze. She was so welcoming and made we 10/10

Cafe: Delicious 😋 the chef was attentive and she made our pizzas and fruit tray with perfection. I look forward to coming back and enjoying more the menu options. 10/10

The Parkour Park: Our family loves Scramble and have celebrated many birthdays at each of their playgrounds. This one is different, but in such a good way. It’s a place for the kids who really enjoy the jumping and swinging part of indoor play. The magnetic blocks are a nice touch for a break from obstacle courses. Best part….no loud music! Just the sounds of happy kids playing and having fun. 10/10

We will definitely be back! Thanks for another awesome day of play Scramble, Parkour was so much fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Asha Gray
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We have enjoyed every scramble experience we've had. Recently due to a original email, we found out they had a parkour location, Shirlington. Which is wild because I'm in this area a lot and had no idea because it's around the corner from most of the main strip. But we were already coming down to see a movie and decided to check it out. When we arrived we asked how long it had been open and they said since December. We came down and there were only two other kids in the space. The space is beautiful, large, and looks like a ton of fun for kids. Even some fun for adults that are adventurous. Another parent was here and we asked if is it usually this empty. As we were here on a Saturday just after noon. He said this was his third time and it was always this empty. More people need to come to this location to make sure that it stays open. It is really a great space!

I went upstairs to the cafe to grab us some coffees. They have a hole barista setup in addition to actual food and snacks that you can get in the cafe. All reasonably priced.

Not shown is a smaller kid building area of soft magnetic blocks. That is quite large and mostly fenced in.

Pricing is typical to other scrambles. I look forward to coming again.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Shailesh Beesam
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Thank you so much for your review!  We are happy to hear you had a great visit with us!

-----------------------

Reviewer: John Smith III
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Decided to host our son 8th Birthday party celebration at Scramble Parkour, shirlington.   Best decision, EVER!  We were greeted by several staff members who gave well wishes to our son.  After getting checked in, my son was given a very cool yellow drawstring back pack that he could keep his shoes inside of while he played. This particular location only has tables for hosting parties, and other locations have individual rooms.  Our party hostess was “Jocelyn.”  She was amazing, any questions or concerns were answered and our entire party experience was top shelf from beginning to end.  Our kids played (and played) before the party, and there is a HUGE play area located downstairs with the most interesting wall artworks that I’ve ever seen before in one place.  The facilities were clean, and both tables and chairs were being wiped down and common areas were free of trash and debris as well.  Would rate the entire experience a 10/10 for the amazing staff, amazing decor and store location.  If you’re looking for a convenient location to host a kids party or somewhere to take the kiddos to get that restlessness out before bed, check out Scramble Parkour, Shirlington, VA you will not regret it.

-----------------------

Reviewer: kalen george
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: We threw our five year olds party here with 17 kids and 17 adults. We had such an amazing experience and the staff was the reason for that. Big shout out to Jocelyn for all your help with coordination and making sure we had everything we needed. And thank you to Yolanda, Jordan, and Claudia!
Y'all made my kids day so fun and memorable!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Alexis Yost
Rating: 3/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I think it’s a cool place that needs some improvements. It’s aimed at older kids 8 and up but there are things for younger ones to do. Overall it works but is too expensive for how bare bones it is. Maybe come on a weekday to check it out so the price will match what you get better. Could use some background music, nothing crazy but even just soft music is better than nothing. The staff were very friendly and informative. Artwork is amazing

-----------------------

Reviewer: Javier Rivera
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My 9 year old daughter had a great time.  Great location.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Auristela Cespedes
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: I came here with my grandchildren, they had a lot of fun. They could use a few more games for the kids and seating for adults but I know they just opened this place so Ill give them some grace for that. Overall a fun experience for the kids, I will definitely be back. Also amazing location!

-----------------------

Reviewer: andrea reed
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: So happy that we finally have an indoor park here in shirlington! My kids were entertained here 2 weekends in a row. It is bit pricey but for winter days it is so much better to bring them here than to let them have screen time. The junior staff with the yellow shirts made sure that the kids had safe fun and the kids wanna come back just to play with them again! Thank you scramble staff!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mimi Rosa Argote
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My daughter, 9yo and her friend, had a blast for 3 hours on a cold winter Saturday, the junior workers were very engaged and welcoming with the kids. Location is perfect for south Arlingtonians!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tonya Holtzclaw
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Chicken Taco Salad...is a 10 out of 10. Will definitely buy it again

-----------------------

Reviewer: John Sommers
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My wife and I took our four kids here for the holiday and we had a great time. Having four kids aged 7-13 it can be difficult to find a place to go that keeps everyone happy but parkour was just right. All four had a blast, playing happily for almost four hours. We will definitely be back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Yasmin Hussein
Rating: 2/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: The concept is nice and my kids had a great time but a few things miss the mark. First off, the prices are extremely high. For two kids, two parents and grippysocks, we paid $70 and I paid another $23 at the restaurant. This is a lot of money for 90 mins for two kids under 5. The cafe/restaurant is on the upper level and the play is on the lower level. There is limited seating benches in the play area and with younger kids, you have to be helicoptering over them at all times due to safety on the play structures. The biggest disappointment was the food prices, quality and quantity. 5 Dino nuggets for $5.50, the entire 5lb bag from Costco is less than $15. Over a $1 a nugget is insane. A generic brand Mac and cheese for $4. I thought them having a restaurant in-house meant better quality food than your average indoor play space. Overall, I am not sure I would visit again soon due to the price.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Shireen Hamaideh
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Thank you so much for the five star review!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Elise Ketch
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: N/A

-----------------------

Reviewer: Matthew Evans
Rating: 2/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: This is not scramble as we know it, and that would be okay accept for a few reasons.

I have a 4/6 yr old and this setup is extremely limited for under 5 yr olds in my opinion. The inflatable obstacle course isn't safe for under 10s, as the supportive padding is extremely poor and won't soften your child's fall. I got asked 4/5 times
" Do you want some ice ? " The area downstairs is awkward for parents with no "REAL" place to sit or watch your child play. Unfortunately at Scramble Parkour you're better off watching your child the entire time due to concerns about falling & safety etc.

We've been to scramble a ridiculous amount of times in Fairfax and enjoy the experience. I think this facility missed the mark unfortunately, and for that reason we won't be headed back anytime
soon.

I hope this location can listen to some of its customers and make changes where necessary.

Good luck

-----------------------

Reviewer: Sarah M
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My 20 month old loved this place. We arrived right at 9:30 pretty much had the place to ourselves for the first hour. She liked the blocks, but mainly ran around for two hours. The cafe upstairs gave her a nice break. Everything was clean and the staff were friendly. We will be back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Deirdre Buckingham
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Thank you so much for your five star review!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Will Buckingham
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: We appreciate your feedback!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jonathan Darwin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Attended scramble parkour with my 2 year old and had an incredible time playing for most of an afternoon. He loved the magnetic building blocks and enjoyed having a go at some of the basic parkour equipment. The staff were very friendly and everything was very clean.

This is a very different setup from other scramble locations and I can see why it has drawn some criticism from parents for not having adequate seating for accompanying adults. It seems like given the nature of the venue and the age range accepted they don’t really have a choice but to force parents to follow their kids around which wasn’t a problem for us but I can see this being off-putting for parents looking for a break or quiet time to get work done.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Alyson Jordan Tomaszewski
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I've visited this new Scramble location 3 times in the week that it opened because it's a terrific asset for parents of young children in the Shirlington area. While it is a smaller space, it offers enough activities that kept my 1-year-old engaged for an afternoon (which is a rarity!). The cafe is very kid-friendly, which was excellent for getting quality food in a lower stress environment. I'm very happy that Scramble Parkour is in the neighborhood!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Erica Ewing
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I absolutely love this place for my 18 month old.  It is one of the few toddler play areas that is just as much fun for the parents as the kids!  My toddler and I both love building with the blocks, running around, climbing, bouncing, rolling and just generally having a good time.  Art work is all local and stunning, too.  The place has a cool and slightly edgy feel to it, not like most kid places.  Staff and owner are super nice, too.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Peter Troost
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: They advertise & charge for teenagers (up to 18yrs) yet there are kids as young as 3yr olds on the VERY limited choice of equipment. The safety padding everywhere is too thin and cost us a trip to the hospital.
Due to the swinging/suspended style equipment, when kids lose their balance, they fall uncontrolled onto yoga mats instead of 2ft deep foam blocks as seen in places like the trampoline/rock climbing parks.
Over priced, under equipped, unsafe, give it a miss! Rather go to a normal scramble, not this parkour knockoff!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Esther Kim
Rating: 2/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Very, very underwhelming. Brought my 7 and 9 year old boys and there were only two obstacle courses, one of which was pretty boring. I’m also required to stay with my kids because under 8’s need to be monitored at all times, but the play room is downstairs and the cafe and chairs are upstairs. So I’m just sitting on the floor observing my kids play with soft blocks. Regular Scramble has much more for the kids to do and is much more conducive to parents having a coffee and working on their laptops while being able to monitor their kids. I was planning on this being 2 hours of playtime for them while working but doubt we will be able to stretch it to more than an hour and I will be sitting on the floor watching my kids who are perfectly capable of playing with soft blocks on their own…

-----------------------

Reviewer: Anya Marwaha
Rating: 2/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: it was an okay experience. I was at the scramble in shirlington and they had no places for the adults to sit. they had no restroom signs and it took me awhile to find them. They also made me watch my kids even though they are 11 years old and know how to handle themselves. They  kept telling the kids they couldn't play with the younger kids in their area but the younger kids couldn't play with the older kids. The staff looked bored and uninterested the whole time and kept following your kids around even though they were being watched by me.  Overall it was okay but they had too many rules and it wasn't fun for the parents or kids.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Shonna Waters
Rating: 3/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: It was not crowded, which was nice, but best for ages 6-10. Outside of that, there isn’t too much there despite it being a pretty large facility. The magnetic blocks were fun but you’re not allowed to throw them. I don’t think we’ll be back given the value for the price point.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Marian Bills
Rating: 3/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Very small, especially for the price. Had about 20-30 kids, so it didn’t feel claustrophobic. But double the number of kids and it would be crazy!
8yo son had most fun being timed by staff member on a “course” climbing on/over/through obstacles (next to the magnetic block section).
No place for parents to sit. Cafe upstairs looks nice, but not practical since they expect parents of even 8yo to be within arms reach in certain (not blocked off) sections.
$26 (weekend) plus $6 for socks (unclear if you can use non-scramble grippy socks).

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jessica Hughes
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: We like the Scramble Alexandria location a lot, but my kids are aging out of it, so we tried this new location aimed at older kids. It’s very aesthetically nice and new, etc, but it’s missing the most crucial aspect of the other scrambles: nowhere for parents to sit. Literally not one chair. Staff informed me when I paid the stiff entrance fee that I needed to stay “arms’ length” from my “little ones” (my kids are not little) at all times. One of the staff even started questioning one of my kids about where I was, because I was in line of sight but not immediately with him. So they’re basically saying you can’t have more than one kid per adult, or the kids have to be right next to each other the whole time.  I assume saying this is an insurance thing, which they’ve attempted to enforce by leaving nowhere for adults to sit.

The owners should recognize that it’s not enough for kids to like it. Adults also need to be comfortable in it. There’s a good reason this place is so empty. I hope the owners reconsider their business model here and focus on the things that made their other locations popular.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tia Reynolds
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Thank you so much for your five star review!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Patty Robert
Rating: 3/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: There are some fun areas to play for kids of different ages. However, there are no chairs or benches in the whole play area. Parents have to stand the whole time or sit on the hard floor.

The staff were also constantly telling kids rules, like no running, no big kids in the small kids areas, no small kids climbing the walls for big kids, no throwing the soft blocks, no outside food or drinks allowed upstairs at the dining tables, etc. There were no signs labeling where kids of different ages were allowed to play.

You have to wear grip socks, and if you don't have them then they charge you three dollars per pair. It would be nice if they mentioned this on the pricing on the website.

My friend went a different day, and the staff closed the place an hour early because there weren't too many kids there, but they did not tell my friend this when she paid to enter, and they offered no refund.

My kids, ages 8 and 5, have had a lot more fun at the other scramble locations, and I was more comfortable with somewhere to sit. We probably will not return to this one.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Corey V
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: While the options for kids 3 and younger are a bit limited, there is plenty of space and it is a great option for families with a range of ages. Allen and Dontae on staff are both exceptionally friendly and professional. Bathrooms are spotless and family bathrooms have changing tables with shelves, making life much easier on parents with kids in diapers. The artwork on the walls adds a really fun vibe too!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Brian Wendroff
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: We met with the manager Boomie She let us know about all the different type of Parkour type items they have for our young kids. We have ages between 6 and 12 and all of them can play at this venue. We were also able to eat upstairs in the Union station cafe. This is very convenient for kids to play downstairs and the adults can go upstairs to the cafe and eat and work if needed.

-----------------------

Reviewer: John Chandler
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I was extremely disappointed with the lack of care and safety precautions at the Scramble Parkour location in Shirlington. There is a 7-foot-tall, heavy box in the children's play area that can easily tip over. When I alerted a staff member, they moved it against a pillar, but it still isn't secured and could easily fall and seriously injure or crush a child. This is completely reckless and unacceptable for a facility marketed to families.

In addition, the inflatable objects suspended from the ceiling swing into the sprinkler system and lights, posing a clear risk of damage to critical safety systems. The design also allows kids to easily reach the sprinkler system pipes and hanging lights. This is not only dangerous but also suggests poor planning and disregard for proper safety measures. I also noticed broken electrical conduit.

I’ve visited other Scramble locations and have never seen issues like this. It’s baffling how this facility passed inspection with such obvious and dangerous oversights.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Diana Nakarmi
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Beautiful, clean, and amazing space for older kids. We will be here often!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Rami Bannourah
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: All Scramble locations are excellent. However, there’s an all-new Scramble, Scramble Parkour where children and teenagers can run, climb, and vault their way through challenging-yet-safe obstacle courses.

Have you heard of Scramble Parkour?
August 6, 2024

There’s an all-new Scramble coming soon – and we think you’re going to be thrilled when you see it. Scramble Parkour will be where children and teenagers can run, climb, and vault their way through challenging-yet-safe obstacle courses. Scramble Parkour is an activity gym where adrenaline meets adventure. It offers thrilling obstacle courses for children aged 4 to 18 to tackle. To give you an idea of what’s in store, the obstacle courses are like those on TV shows you may have seen such as Wipeout or American Ninja Warrior. Each course is graded for difficulty, allowing kids to test their limits and level up as their skills advance. Some courses serve as individual tests; others are great for side-by-side races or team relays.

There are also free-play zones for infants and toddlers. The whole family can have fun at Scramble Parkour! In fact, since it has areas geared specifically at teenagers, we think our new offering will be perfect for families with older kids who thought they had “aged out” of an afternoon at Scramble.
This location is in the Village of Shirlington.}

Reviewer: Yama Saine
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: Our family had an absolute blast at Joyland kidz! My 3 yr old son and 16-month-old daughter enjoyed every moment. From the moment you walk in, Joyland gives off a fun, energetic vibe that sets the tone for an unforgettable experience. The entire space is clean, safe, and well organized. The kids were entertained the whole time from the exciting slides and bouncing rooms to the interactive play areas. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made sure everyone felt welcomed. Customer service was top-notch, and it’s clear the team truly cares about creating a positive environment for families. I highly recommend Joyland kidz for a fun-filled day the whole family will love! We will definitely come back!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Christina Walker
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 days ago
Review: I visited Joyland on 7-1 with my 3 children ages 1, 5, and 8.

Pros:
1. Great location
2. Lots of parking
3. Very clean facility and bathrooms

Cons

1. Young girl working was on her phone as she completed my transaction and answered my questions. It’s nothing more rude than when young people have their AirPods in and are holding two conversations at once. There were times when she was looking at me but talking on her phone.
2. It was 78 degrees inside on a  95 degree day. Their air was set to 64 degrees. I don’t know if it was ventilation issues or AC issues but it was hot. You are not allowed to bring food or drinks inside. They have water fountains but they are near the bathroom (I don’t drink water fountains near bathrooms iykyk) They have a water bottle refill station but you can’t bring bottles in so it doesn’t really make sense.
3. Their price per child no matter what their age, is $15.99 for 2 hours. One adult does enter free with children. There is no different price for younger ages which was shocking to me. HyperKidz and Scramble even have a different price for toddlers vs older children. They also don’t have different weekday prices vs weekend prices.  Paying $16 for a space where my one year old could not even use half of the equipment was unsettling.
4. The space is small. It is the size of the surrounding businesses. I was so happy to have a place close to home but for $16 per child I will take my kids where it is half the price and they actually have more things to do.
5. They require non slip socks. Every indoor playground I have been to requires socks but not non slip socks. The non slip socks are a money grab. They look similar to the sky zone socks but nothing in there is slippery so I really didn’t understand the non slip socks. As I looked around almost every family had them which confirmed for me it was a money grab. Their website also didn’t have the socks under their admissions tab.

I will not be coming back. I really wanted to support a new black owned business but it seems like a money grab for the size and what they have to offer.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Awofuwa Peluola
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 days ago
Review: I absolutely love Joyland! A friend had her kid’s birthday party there and I went with my nieces, they had the best time. They didn’t want to leave! The party space and indoor playground - such a great idea for kids events.
Had to take my nieces back to the playground cause they couldn’t get enough.

Reviewer: A O

Reviewer: Olivia Frazer
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Katey Hector
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: So fun! I took my son here on Friday, and he had a blast! It’s the perfect size for a parent to watch their child (I find some play centers too large). The staff were kind and friendly. The equipment looks very well maintained. The space is also very well lit with lots of bright lights which I enjoyed.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Katrina M
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: N/A

Reviewer: Andre V
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: Really happy there are more places in the area for my 4y/o to hang out besides CEC on those cooler or rainy days. Reviewer: Ahkeem Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: Smaller size but very clean and fun! I found this through a random search of indoor playgrounds near Waldorf, and I'm glad I chose to come here. My 7-year-old son enjoyed himself, and I'm sure my 4-year-old daughter will when we come back in the near future.

Reviewer: Megan Ellis
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: My little had such a good time! It's a great price. The space is not too large to lose sight of your kids but has so many things for kids to do it feels endless!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Katie H
Rating: 5/5

Review: Very clean, the employee was extremely friendly, my daughter had a great time!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Briana Simons
Rating: 5/5

Review: I had my son’s 1st birthday party here as a private event and it was absolutely amazing. Our hostess Sky was beyond incredible. She was attentive, answered all questions, always asking to help me with settling up, serving food, putting goody bags together last minute. She was a DREAM. We will definitely be back to have our little one play. Thank you Sky and Joy!!!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Bakarr
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Joyland kids is an amazing indoor playground located in Brandywine, Maryland. I live in Virginia but take my kids there on the weekends! Lovely owners and very vibrant location and community close to shops, restaurants and a movie theater! I’m looking forward to my next visit this weekend. My kids absolutely love the music slides, ball bin and interactive games and indoor race track. I’ve been looking forward to something like this for a while.

Reviewer: Katie Cusic
Rating: 5/5

Review: Joyland is super clean and the owner is wonderful and friendly and open to feedback. My kids have a blast when we go and are always asking to go back! We are excited to have a local small business to support that the kids enjoy!

Reviewer: Randy Abraham
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Very clean and kids had fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Trisha Washington
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: The BEST Play place for ages 7 and under I would say! Very clean, friendly staff, and a lot for the kids to do and adults! I had a ball myself.I will be coming back!

Reviewer: Patricia Brantley
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Very clean and fun for the kiddos.

Reviewer: Toyin Falana
Rating: 5/5

Review: If you are in the area, this place is where you want to take your kids. It fun for the kids and very clean. Reviewer: Megan Holmes
Rating: 5/5

Review: N/A

Reviewer: Christina Brooks

Reviewer: Random Californian
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: T GG
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: We had an amazing time celebrating my son’s 3rd birthday at Joyland! The staff was welcoming and very attentive, and the entire space was safe, clean and full of so many fun activities.
The party room setup was super adorable—colorful balloons, kid-friendly tables and chairs, light refreshments, and everything was arranged so neatly. The kids had a blast!
I highly recommend Joyland for anyone looking to host a fun and memorable kids birthday party.

Reviewer: Candace Bethea
Rating: 5/5

My toddler loved it so much we booked her birthday party there!  They have a small, medium & large party rooms perfect spot to host a fun filled party for your kid!

Reviewer: Ay Ayo
Rating: 5/5

Review: Today was our first visit to Scramble FC and while it was busy, that’s expected on a Saturday afternoon and it didn’t really impact our experience since our baby is only 9.5mo so we stayed in the infant area closest to the entrance. Our baby really enjoyed the sensory room and socializing with the other babies (he’s a really social little guy!). We were also impressed with the selection of books in the little bookshop and ended up purchasing a few for our little guy, and kept some in mind for the future!

The staff were all very friendly, but I wanted to give an extra shout out to one of the cleaning workers, Ana. There wasn’t a moment in the 1.5-2hrs we were there that I saw her and she wasn’t on the move - wiping tables, vacuuming, and I was pleasantly surprised when she even offered to take my dirty food tray from me when I got up from our table, fully planning on having to take care of it myself. We live in Lake Ridge/Woodbridge but my parents live a block and a half away so we will absolutely be coming back!

Reviewer: Monika Rhodes
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Review of Scramble party:

I have usually avoided scramble on the weekend unless we were attending a birthday party, however, when my son‘s birthday party at another location canceled less than 40 hours before due to an icy walkway, Scramble went above and beyond to help set up a replacement Saturday morning party at the exact same day/time, with only ONE day notice.

Scramble saved the day! They were so kind to offer us the one available room, which happened to be larger and actually accommodated our larger sized group quite well. They were flexible and accommodating with our food needs, and went above and beyond to make sure we had what we needed during the party time. Madelyn coordinated setting everything up with me while my son played the day before, (his actual birthday- when school and his school celebration had also been canceled due to a water main break). Madelyn and her colleagues were very attentive during the event, despite having more than one party to attend to simultaneously - Not to mention what an absolute sweetheart Madelyn is!!! Since the party was booked with such short notice, she was so kind to give me her personal phone number so I could update her with my evolving guest list later that evening and ask any questions I still had after closing on the night before.

I’m grateful for this fantastic play space so close to home and the kind people that work there!

FYI with parties they have a strict policy that after the pizza and cake at the end, no guests are allowed to go back into the climbing apparatus for more play time without incurring a large penalty fee. The party ends after the food. We didn’t have any issues with this because I bluntly announced it to our group after thanking them for coming, and would recommend clearly expressing this rule to avoid major fees.

The food is really good for what you would expect at a kid-place like this. For lunch (we also went to play the day before the party when we set it up) I had a generously portioned salad with Korean bbq chicken, pears, pickled onions and olives and it was really good!

Beware little kids sitting on the three-leg stools. We had three kids fall off of them at the party, resulting in some tears.

Also, I know you don’t want to go in the maze with your kid, but I was glad I did at least go through with him once- I was really impressed how well everything was set up inside and what a nice variety of things to explore and little spots to hide out! There was one spot where I barely fit through and had to roll between two vertical padded rollers, bottom-first to keep going! It was hilarious and I highly recommend you try going through the scramble mazes, and have this fun experience with your kiddo(s)!

-----------------------

Review: DISABLED PERSONS NIGHTMARE. If you have a disability…beware! First time I went I was angrily confronted by a staff member for bringing in my own food when I have dietary needs. Went again thinking maybe it was just a one time problem, but today I was singled out and harassed for having a SMALL mobility cane that turns into a chair as I cannot stand for more than 10 minutes at a time due to my disability. The same staff member from the previous incident came over and asked me to move out the way because I was blocking the path. Except, I was far to the side, there were more people standing in the “path”, and not to mention they do not have any space for people to sit because they allow so many people in there at a time. I told the employee there were other people standing blocking the way, and that they should also be told to move if i was, but i did not hear her tell a single person. Not to mention if someone was in a wheelchair there would be no room. My daughter had fun last time but it’s so crowded, we prefer to go to luv2play in Fair Oaks. They are kind and have many open spaces for people with disabilities, and they aren't food police. They sell their own food at luv2play too but they allow people to bring their own which is nice because kids get hungry and need snacks. Also people aren't made out of money and typically buy snacks in bulk to make it cheaper. Please do better for the disabled community and if someone doesn't look disabled don't just assume they are trying to get out of spending money. Also maybe try setting a capacity, that many people would not be able to get out in an emergency. This place is just pure chaos. Some staff are really nice and caring but unfortunately there are many that are rude and and will literally verbally attack and bully people. This is just not acceptable.

Review: First time and will not be returning. The staff are fine, definitely an understaffed facility with very little safeties in place. When I got there there must have been over 2-3 birthday parties ongoing with the regular Sunday crowd there. There are no wristbands, no one checking kids coming or going. Honestly anyone could come in and grab your kid if you weren't paying close attention. If there was any kind of emergency it would be a complete and utter disaster. I had my child in the infant/crawlers area and big kids were just running around nearly falling over her and I had to police them myself which I didn't want to have to do but it was not a safe place for babies.

Part of the appeal of these places is letting kids run free which I have no issue with, but there were no safeguards in place for kids that were not being watched by their own parents and there just simply isn't enough staff to make sure safe play is being observed. And, frankly it is not really staff's responsibility, it's the parents'. I have been to many an indoor playground/gym before. This is by far the most expensive and the worst one I have been to. There needs to be an actual limit on the number of children in this building at any given time. I know better, do not recommend to other parents, and will not be coming back.

Reviewer: Hunter Bailey
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: From the moment you step inside Launch Pad Trampoline Park, it’s immediately clear that this isn’t just a place to jump—it’s an experience designed to thrill, engage, and bring people together. My recent visit with friends and family was nothing short of phenomenal, and I left not only physically energized but mentally refreshed. This review will explore the many facets of Launch Pad that make it deserving of a solid five-star rating, from its outstanding facilities and safety measures to its exceptional customer service and atmosphere.

First Impressions and Atmosphere

The first thing that struck me about Launch Pad was how clean, spacious, and well-organized the facility was. Many trampoline parks can feel cramped or chaotic, but Launch Pad has managed to strike the perfect balance between excitement and order. The staff greeted us warmly at the entrance, walking us through check-in and safety procedures with enthusiasm and professionalism. The layout of the park is thoughtfully designed, with designated areas for different activities, which helps manage the crowd flow and ensures everyone has space to enjoy themselves safely.

The vibrant colors, upbeat music, and high-energy vibe made it easy to forget about everyday stress. It’s the kind of environment that appeals to all age groups—kids, teens, and adults alike—making it a perfect destination for families, birthday parties, and group outings.

Activities and Attractions

Launch Pad goes far beyond just a few basic trampolines. Their variety of attractions is what truly sets them apart. Of course, the main trampoline area is expansive and filled with interconnected trampolines that allow for continuous, high-flying fun. But the real magic lies in the extra features that elevate the experience.

There’s a dodgeball arena that brings out everyone’s competitive side in the best way, with soft, safe balls and bouncy floors that make every game feel like a real-life video game. The basketball dunk zones were a huge hit, allowing both kids and adults to soar through the air and experience what it’s like to slam dunk like a pro. The foam pit provided a safe and fun way to practice flips and tricks without the fear of getting hurt, and the obstacle courses were both challenging and hilarious, encouraging friendly competition.

What I appreciated most was that each attraction was designed to engage the body and the mind. Whether you’re trying to conquer the ninja course, balance on a slack line, or time your jumps for a perfect flip, you’re building coordination, strength, and confidence without even realizing it.

Safety and Cleanliness

As a parent and a cautious adult, safety is always a top priority when choosing a recreational activity. Launch Pad takes safety seriously. Every participant is required to watch a safety video, and there are trained staff members stationed throughout the park, keeping an eye on jumpers and ensuring rules are followed without being intrusive.

In terms of cleanliness, I was genuinely impressed. The park appeared well-maintained, with staff frequently walking through to tidy up, sanitize surfaces, and make sure everything was in top shape. The foam pits were cleaned regularly, the bathrooms were spotless, and even the trampoline mats looked well cared for. You can tell that the management team takes pride in maintaining a safe and sanitary environment for all visitors.

Customer Service and Staff

Every single employee we interacted with was kind, helpful, and clearly enjoyed working there. Whether it was the front desk staff explaining how to sign the waiver, the team members supervising each activity area, or the snack bar attendants, everyone went out of their way to make the experience enjoyable. One staff member even offered to take a group photo for us, which was such a small but thoughtful gesture.

destination.

Without a doubt, I give Launch Pad Trampoline Park a well-earned five stars. I can’t wait to go back, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an unforgettable, action-packed day of fun.

⸻

Review: Update: You do have control over it because you change the rules everyday. I guess the signs don't mean anything if they don't go by the rules on the signs.
I already left a review on their page but figured it wouldn't be up. I am very disappointed I have taken my son here three times during regular jumping hours when he was under 3. He had also been here a fourth time during little jumpers hours when he was younger. Nobody, out of the three times mentioned him having to be over 3 to jump during regular hours. I told him all morning we were coming here and the lady (young lady) said he has to be 3 because there are too many kids there now. BEFORE she said this I said there are two of us he will be 3 in a week. We have been here 3 different times recently, and it wasn't an issue. So now my child starts crying and I can't even get him into the car seat because he already hears kids laughing and playing. He also kept saying in the car "I'm too small" while he cried which made me feel horrible I said no your not too small they're just closed today so now he thinks he was turned down because he is too small. The lady wasn't all that nice. I don't see what the big deal is and for being a place to make kids happy it sure did the opposite. Maybe if the workers were a little older and had their own children they would know how traumatizing and disappointing this can be for a 3 year old... almost 3. I left two photos below this was months ago during regular jumping time when he was under 3. My child is big for his age and I always jump with him it shouldn't have been an issue. Review: We've been here a few times for Little Launchers and the kids always have fun (2yo+4yo). It's a great place to let the kiddos burn off energy in the morning. I was disappointed, he was disappointed, it was a tough day leading up to that point. I wrote a letter to management about the situation and received a very heartfelt and sincere apology from Mike, the DoO. This is the kind of service I love to see from a local place - Mike really took the time to write a personal email back to me and make things feel better, along with an incentive to return. The only reason I'm rating a 4 instead of a 5 is because there are sometimes open seams between the Velcro pads that cause a hazard. Otherwise, we love it here and appreciate their customer service!

Reviewer: Sabrina North
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This trampoline park is not recommended if you have been to a good trampoline park before. We have several in the area we are from plus have been to parks in other states while on vacation and this is by far the worst I've ever seen. There were many conditions that were hazardous. Employees were trying to manage all the unsupervised but there is only so much they could do when the children wouldn't listen. In the hour we were there we witnessed multiple children getting injured due to unsafe jumping conditions, each child was offered a slushy after injury 🤦🏻. They are clearly admitting people over what the proper capacity is of the location. Additionally, there was an extremely strong smell of urine though the park. In the women's restroom only two of the three toilets would flush, the flushing handles would just spin all the way around. This place is really small too, smallest we've seen. I guess for a town that has nothing like this available it's good, but if you've ever been to a park you won't like this one. If we had been able to see inside before we purchased tickets, we would've left.

It was ...ok. Nice structure but small, brand new bounce house, but small, and the slides were a hit, but also only one attraction. The whole thing looks sad and dirty. I found a bloody bandaid in the ball pit, which honestly is to be expected, but just pointed out other hygienic deficiencies. Then, they do not allow outside food, and the only food options are the Green Cafe. The Lamb Gyro WAS AMAZING, but my kids aren't going to eat that. There were no options that were kid centric and no options for any sort of snacks, healthy or otherwise, outside of ice cream. Unless major change comes we will just opt to head to Hagerstown or literally anywhere else.

Reviewer: Andrew Lealofi
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Absolutely amazing experience at this children’s indoor playground! From the moment we walked in, we were impressed by how incredibly clean and well-maintained. One worker JADE never stopped cleaning the entire facility. Star is the manager on duty. You can tell she and the staff takes pride in keeping everything spotless—there are team members constantly rotating through sections to clean and sanitize, including the bathrooms, which were consistently fresh and stocked.

One of the best parts is the come-and-go policy—you can stay for the whole day and leave for breaks without losing access, which is perfect for families who want to take lunch or snack breaks outside.

We brought a little one and a few teens were there to my surprise, the teens had just as much fun climbing, crawling, and sliding through the playground! It’s safe, there is a section for toddlers and infants as well. Extremely child-proof, and built to handle active play for all ages.

Highly recommend this place for families looking for a clean, fun, and safe indoor escape. We did to get out of the rain. We’ll definitely be back!

Reviewer: Alex Bailey
Rating: 4/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: We had my son’s second birthday party here. We were greeted by Haven, who was very energetic and nice. A lot of the guests for our party arrived late and the employees were mindful of this and allowed us to have our pizza/cake time after our designated time. We appreciated them extending that kindness. Our room was decorated nicely and I appreciated not having to add much to their standard decor. The overall play space is decent, albeit, it’s definitely on the smaller side. Our party room was meant for 10 children and 10 adults, but it was very tight and several of the adults didn’t feel comfortable coming in as it felt too cramped. For the price they charge, they should definitely allow kids to continue to play after the 2 hour party slot. They expect another $22 per child after  your $500 2-hr party… on top of that, the area remains open to the public and it gets way too crowded, especially when you have little ones. It costs about 2k to reserve the entire space. We were fortunate that it wasn’t too busy at the time we had our party but I wouldn’t bank on that being  typical experience for this place. All in all, the staff was friendly and helpful, the space was fun for small children, but definitely way too small and priced high.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Melissa Fanelle
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I had my son’s fifth birthday party here and from the get go I was impressed by this place. They have a pamphlet with all the party options. With the party they decorate the room- and the basic decorations they supply are absolutely stunning. I got the basic birthday package and the ballon’s and decor were amazing. They even gave us invitations with a QR code to the waiver. The park itself is a blast, very clean, and meticulously maintained. The customer service was out of this world. Anything we needed they were there at a moments notice. When they saw my son’s cake was Mario themed they surprised us with Mario coming to the party. The kids were so excited. This was a party my son will never forget and I won’t either because the customer service and entire experience was out of this world. 10/10 cannot recommend enough.

One thing I was impressed with was the cleanliness. The floor was spotless. The staff were courteous, there was even a coffee machine, not that we used it. They also had an area where they can climb a wall, build blocks, etc. It was crowded but not so much that he couldn’t enjoy himself and I didn’t lose track of him. They also had a bubble machine which was kind of cool to see go off every once in a while. I think we would definitely go back to this place.

Reviewer: Jennifer Blalock
Rating: 5/5

Review: We LOVE visiting the Little Valley Play Cafe!    It’s a great place to cultivate your little one’s imagination and for them to socialize with their peers! You can definitely tell a lot of thought was put into every detail from the layout of the play area to the small extra touches in the bathroom! The cafe itself is also a wonderful expression of comfort. We highly recommend you have lunch sometime and try the mac and cheese! Peak times definitely seem to be in the mornings so if you would prefer a smaller crowd check them out after 12 on Tuesdays and Wednesday for extended hours till 5:30. Knoxville has waited a long time for something like this and we are excited to see this place grow!

Reviewer: Lori Beth Leach

Reviewer: A
Rating: 3/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Little Valley Play Cafe has a lot of potential, I feel the space they're in very much limits that potential. I took my little one here to try it out. The front desk area is tiny making it difficult for everyone to both check-in + grab your shoes (they make you put your shoes in a small cubby at the front upon arrival) as you're trying to leave. I do love that it's gated at the entry so no kid can escape. I did not feel the staff I encountered was very friendly. I had trouble opening the gate and she didn't help but another patron did. I do not like that they don't allow you to bring in your own food. I already pay for coming there, I don't want to buy the snacks you have. I don't eat lots of the ingredients in these foods and snacks and I don't want a dessert coffee every time I go. I like the idea of the cafe, I do understand it needs to be profitable, but my family doesn't eat what they serve. Makes it hard when other indoor playgrounds we can bring food in and eat at their designated tables. I don't like that so much of the space is taken by tables and chairs for parents. A lot of parents were sitting at the stools by the wall watching their kids. And then they leave their left drinks on that wall which leaves the drinks open for little kids to come and drink from them before their parent can stop them. I also didn't like that in order to go use the restroom you have to wear your socks. I'd like to be wearing shoes when I go in a bathroom... That's gross. And then any germs from the bathroom are now on socks that are walked around in the play area. I will say that bathrooms were pretty clean when I visited which is very necessary and appreciated. The themed play stations were great, my little one loved them. I love how creative they were designing that. I did not love that a good chunk of space was taken up for a party area. I just don't see how this space was a good choice for an indoor playground. I think this place could be amazing with some improvements. Customer service is very important and employee/owner attitudes I feel set the tone overall. I look forward to watching this place improve and hopefully grow.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Elisabeth Fouts
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: First the helpful things to know, then I’ll give you the reason for my 5-start review :)
1. Check the hours and get there early. They often have a line outside to get in and they reach capacity often.
2. Be sure that the kids and guardians wear or bring grippy socks. If you don’t have any or forget, they do sell them there for a very reasonable price.
OK, now onto the reason for my review.
I can’t say enough great things about the Little Valley Play Cafe and the staff! I went to a birthday party here and everything was magical! The staff arranged for all the decor and the food and of course provided a very clean, safe space to play. I enjoyed playing with the kids in the play areas at first. Then sat by and watched as they continued, while I sipped a delicious latte from their coffee bar. It’s so much easier to keep an eye on the kids with their open floor plan and safety gate. If you have or care for kids under 6, this place is a must. Great for birthday parties, rainy or cold days, or any day really. Whenever you go, you and the kids will be in for a real treat!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jessica Winspear
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Just Go!! I visited this week to check it out for the first time with my 2 kids since opening with a friend and her 2 kids. It was an absolute blast! We ended up going a second time because it was so much fun -- and not to mention the coffee was fantastic!

There was an incident that happened while we were there of no ones fault, but I watched the owner take amazing care of this sweet boy. After he was all taken care of, they offered him a Good 2 Grow Juice and he got to pick his top. He was back playing in no time. It's always great to see how much an owner cares about their patrons.

Love this place and look forward to it becoming a regular stop for us. I will say it can get busy in the late mornings/afternoons, but I love to see the success of a new business in town. If you want to visit when it's a little quieter, I recommend going in the earlier morning hours.

The owners did amazing job of thinking through things. There is so many fun sections for the kids and the quality of the cafe is top notch. A great new spot in town!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Sam
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: This place is fantastic. The drink and food options for adults and kids are 10/10. You can tell the owners put a lot of thought and effort into everything. The little dips coming out of each playhouse could use some grippers or something since kids easily slide with their socks. Also it would be so appreciated if the person checking people in can politely say something along the lines of, “and we just want to confirm that no one entering has a runny nose, cough, or fever today?” We can’t avoid asymptomatic people… however, the last time we went, I saw a mom cover her kids mouth when they were coughing and then the same mom took a toy out of their kids mouth, wiped it on her shirt and then tossed it back on the floor. I just wish the whole “please don’t bring your kids if they’re sick” thing was enforced somehow. I still refuse to give this place anything less than 5 stars and still very much recommend it!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Haley Johnson
Rating: 5/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Yes, I'm posting a picture of the shelf in the bathroom. Why?

Because today, when I took my toddler to play and stepped into the restroom, what I saw captured everything I'd felt since we came through the door.

At Little Valley, I truly felt that my son and I were so welcome exactly as we are. It is CLEAR that this place is run by fellow mamas; every little detail has been considered! The layout is designed so caregivers can watch their little ones while they sip delicious drinks--and by the way, those drinks are hand-delivered to you, so you don't have to take eyes off your child.

But back to the bathroom shelf. Here you see tampons, baby wipes, breath mints, dental flossers, doggy bags (iykyk), and more. They've stocked everything a mama might need to take care of herself AND her baby in there, and they've done it in a way that is more beautiful than it has to be.

I knew I was taking my baby for a treat today. I just didn't know I was giving myself one too. We can't wait to return.

Reviewer: Brianna Haun
Rating: 5/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Kid Zone is a hidden gem in Powell, offering a fun and safe indoor playground perfect for young children. As soon as you walk in, you’re greeted with a clean, vibrant space filled with a variety of activities for kids to enjoy. There are climbing structures, slides, and even a soft play area for toddlers, ensuring that children of all ages have something to do.

One of the best aspects of Kid Zone is how well-organized and well-maintained the facility is. You can tell that cleanliness is a priority, which gives parents peace of mind as their children explore and play. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure everyone has a good experience while keeping the environment safe.

There are seating areas for parents, and they offer beverages to purchase, so you can relax while your kids burn off some energy.

Overall, Kid Zone is a fantastic place for kids to run, and play in a controlled and fun environment. It’s a great option for birthday parties or just to get out of the house on a rainy day. Definitely worth checking out if you’re in the Powell area!

-----------------------

-----------------------

Reviewer: Rachel Martin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially a mom that needs to get out and socialize. Food is delicious!

-----------------------

Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Review: N/A

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Reviewer: Aurora Webster
Rating: 5/5

Review: I held my daughters 3rd birthday here today. Me and my family have been here one other time, and were completely SOLD. Today just sealed the deal! Everyone was so sweet and considerate from the very beginning! They made sure they went above and beyond to make sure everything was clean and prepared! They had the complete itinerary planned, but always confirmed with me prior to calling the announcements. Everything has gone absolutely smooth as a whistle this entire experience, from the first visit until now. The pizza was delicious and my party loved it. I have never had a smoother child's birthday party!  We all really liked it especially since  the parents got to stay and play too! We got card credits for the arcade so the bigger kids (and husbands) got to have fun more their age! They even had an alcohol menu which was great for the parents! They even had their version of a build-a-bear, that wasn't there the last time we went, so it was a super great surprise!! And the kids loved it! Everyone that got the bear got a discount too! It's so clean and they seriously were so accommodating it wasn't even funny!! We will definitely be back!!! 10/10 RECOMMEND!!!! 💛💛💛💛

Reviewer: Vidi Horwich
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: We visited Kidz Jungle World on Christmas Eve, and it was an absolute delight! Despite being a busy holiday, the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. The play equipment was impressively clean, showing the care and effort put into maintaining the facility.

One of the standout features for us was the high weight limit on the equipment, allowing parents to join in the fun without worry. It’s also fantastic that parents enter for free – a thoughtful touch that sets this soft play centre apart from others.

The entrance fee being a whole-day pass is excellent value, and we appreciated the flexibility it gave us. Our two-year-old absolutely loved exploring all the different areas, and we would have stayed even longer if we didn’t have other commitments.

Overall, we had a wonderful time and would highly recommend Kidz Jungle World to anyone looking for a fun, family-friendly outing. It’s a perfect spot for kids to play, laugh, and burn off energy while parents can relax or join in. A solid 5/5 experience!

Review: I've been coming to Jungle Kids world since it opened. The customer service has been consistently kind, helpful, and quick (at reception). And the tube that sucks up balls also doesn't work and so that means the area where the balls collect cannot be used to make all the balls fall down. The tree swing was gone and the metal Zipline that my son lives was also broken. The floors felt sticky. I feel like this place is on the decline. I hope they get it together. So one star for customer service and one for the kids having a good time.

Review: Highly recommend. My almost 3 year old had a fantastic time and after 1.5 hour’s he is worn out and satisfied. They had so many obstacles and my son didn’t want to leave. Take your child here if you want to tire him/her out.

We came near closing time and not once did we feel rushed to leave. The entire time she kept busy mopping and cleaning (which by the way as soon as you walk in you can smell the cleanliness of the place). When she wasn’t cleaning she was happily engaging with the children making sure they were safe. It’s rare that I meet someone with such a gentle and sunny disposition. Arnetia is the kind of employee you want representing your company. I hope someone in corporate reads this. Keep hiring employees like her and you’ll stay in business for years to come.

The woman working was phenomenal in making sure the environment was clean and safe and went above and beyond in showing me a easy way to the slide for me and the littlest one to slide down together without having to climb through the whole structure. Additionally, she went out of her way to show the kids how to fill the foam ball blower so that the balls cascaded everywhere to the delight of the children. The largest play structure has a variety of passages, but all of the entrances and exits are condensed toward the front for easy viewing from the two smaller play areas where parents would accompany younger children allowing them to also keep and eye on their older ones. We can't wait to go again in the future!

Review: We really enjoyed this place. I have an almost 2 year old who loves to climb and let loose. I liked this place because it’s built for kids under 8 only. Its climbing areas are only 1 story tall so it’s easy to spot your child from the ground. They have great slides, ball pits, a giant sandbox and some really cool tubes. One thing I was impressed with was the cleanliness. The floor was spotless. The staff were courteous, there was even a coffee machine, not that we used it. They also had an area where they can climb a wall, build blocks, etc. It was crowded but not so much that he couldn’t enjoy himself and I didn’t lose track of him. They also had a bubble machine which was kind of cool to see go off every once in a while. I think we would definitely go back to this place.

data.reviews:
{Reviewer: Elspeth Hetrick
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: It has been 5 years since I visited this business. I still feel uncomfortable driving past it.

When my rule-oriented, 47 pound, 8 year old Autistic child, pointed out that they were over legal capacity, they had a strong reaction.

I get it. The economy was cruddy and pandemic drama was stressful.

That did not justify an employee (who was also part owner) getting down in my child's face to say something like, 'How's it gonna feel to be the kid whose Mommy got kicked out of the Playground because you were harassing us??!!"

My elementary age child was not harassing anyone. He said, "Excuse me, you might want to know that there are too many people in the climber and nobody is wearing their masks."

Considering that they had laws about capacity and masking posted in the entryway, his comment was logical.

Small businesses really took a hit in 2020. The pressure was intense. That still doesn't justify the amount of unbridled rage that was directed at my family...particularly at young kids.

If there had been an apology or even a truce in the last few years, I wouldn't be writing this.

But instead, when I left a review on FB (back when it actually happened) I got messaged with more anger and accusation, saying I must want their business to fail.

That wasn't my goal. I'm not spiteful.

My goal was to raise awareness about their customer service so they could improve.

Maybe they did. I wouldn't know, because they scared my kids so badly that they have never wanted to go back.

We are looking forward to Midland Mall opening it's Playland. My youngest will still be young enough to enjoy it.

Because I Googled it, Google suggested I leave a review about this place. So.... I am sharing my experience.

It's not current and it may have nothing to do, with how they run things now. But I believe that we should be accountable for our choices, and I would still like to hear an apology for yelling in my child's face. Because that's just not good customer service.. and kids deserve to feel SAFE, in spaces that advertise themselves as child oriented.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mike Or Mac
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My wife and I went here with our two kids (5 y/o and 21 months) and found it to be OK. On a cold and rainy day, it provides a place to take the kids to burn off some energy.

The issues we had with it relate to staffing and cleanliness. On the cleanliness perspective, the is NO area for mouthed toys so they can be properly cleaned and sanitized. Kids were placing the plastic toy balls from what would be a ball pit in their mouths and dropping them, and moving on. There MUST be a place that these items can be placed so they can be cleaned to limit the transmission of Hand, Foot, and Mouth disease and other common childhood illnesses.

Staffing: On the day we went, the wide majority of the staff were only a few years older than some of the kids actually playing on the playground. Since, in Michigan, minors can be 14 and work, my suspicion is that most were around that age and they mostly tended to the snack bar. The Playground has two separate areas where kids under 18 months and under 3 years could play (bravo- excellent idea), except those areas often had children outside of those age brackets and the "staff" would be best utilized by supervising these areas to any degree for safety purposes. I stopped this when I saw it, but not all parents show the same courtesy, so this would be a great use of the staff.

For two children, we paid $16 on a weekday and were there for about 60-75 minutes. There is a snack bar with a variety of items you'd find in a Meijer (Frito-Lay brand potato chips, Kraft cheese sticks, pizza, juice boxes) and a selection of coffee drinks.

With some changes to their cleaning protocol and staff practices, we would consider returning. 3 out of 5 stars as the review implies: average.

If they would have reply to the message I sent or answered my phone call they could have let me know on either one of those that after a week they throw the ice cream away even though it's brand new in the package never been opened. I'll be selling my gift card I was gifted because I I'll be selling my gift card I was gifted because I refuse to waste my time or energy with this place anymore. They don't deserve the business. Review: I’ve been coming to Billy Beez regularly with my kids and fiancé, and we’ve never had any issues until today. My family and I visited, and from the start, the staff, especially the manager Elijah, were extremely rude and unprofessional.

Elijah forced my mother to pay for socks, even though her kids already had socks on. However, minutes later, another family walked in, and he let them in without paying, saying they “come here all the time  and already had Billy Beez socks even though they weren’t even wearing them. This was clearly unfair treatment, and when my mother called him out for it, he got defensive instead of addressing the real issue.

Instead of handling the situation professionally, Elijah chose to escalate things by calling the police. Thankfully, the officer was polite and didn’t make the situation worse, but it should never have come to that.

None of the employees were friendly, and instead of creating a welcoming environment, they seemed irritated to even be there. While the play area itself is great for kids, the poor customer service makes it hard to enjoy the experience. I won’t be returning, and I wouldn’t recommend this location to others until they train their staff to be more professional and treat all customers fairly.

Reviewer: Karen S

Review: When my daughter was taking horseback lessons in Manassas a year ago, billy beez was a regular stop for us afterwards maybe once a month.   Many play places max out for kids at about age 8.  And then I feel like there's a gap before a child can have fun at like a dave n buster's.  I appreciate that billy beez fills that gap plus provides safe spaces for toddlers.  If you have kids who are 7 to 12 and still wanting a play place this is the spot.  I also appreciate no time limits whereas many places limit to 90 minutes or 2 hours.  Yes I have been there when the slushy machine wasnt working but like most play places it's a mad house so in my opinion it happens.  I did not experience any of my children becoming sick nor did I witness lack of cleanliness other than customers not cleaning their tables.  However,  I don't blame the establishment for that.  As a parent I also greatly appreciate the security.  Your child cannot accidentally run out.  Everyone who exits is checked for matching bands.  I can sit down and my kids can have fun.

Reviewer: 100 Go
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Last week, we hosted our daughter's birthday party at Billy Beez in Manassas. From the start, a woman who seemed to be the party manager greeted us with an unfriendly expression, which left our guests feeling uncomfortable right away.

After seeing the previous party use a cart for their belongings, I asked the party manager if we could use one as well since we had a lot of items to carry. She firmly said no. I accepted this without issue, but later asked another staff member who said it was fine to use the cart. This inconsistency made me increasingly frustrated with the party manager, but we proceeded with the party for the sake of our daughter.

After the party, our guests commented on how it seemed there was no host from Billy Beez, and that we appeared to be handling everything ourselves, which looked exhausting. We discovered that our reservation included host services, but we did not receive any of the benefits. We had to call the children, serve the birthday cake and pizza ourselves, and we were unable to take any pictures. Additionally, we initially ordered a combo that included two pizzas and two pitchers of drinks, but the drinks did not arrive and we had to pay separately for them later on.

We were very disappointed with the poor service. If Billy Beez typically does not provide a host and only sets up the room, they should remove the host support option from their plans. Although there was one somewhat friendly male manager, the overall experience was so negative that we cannot write a positive review.

For the price we paid, it would have been better to host the party at a nearby Sky Zone or Chuck E. Cheese. We initially debated between those three options, but now we regret our choice.

Reviewer: Allison Scott
Rating: 2/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Pros:
- kids had fun (4 7-year-old girls)
- they no longer charge extra for the Honeycomb Village or the trampolines
- at $17/kid and $6/adult, it’s cheaper or equivalent to taking your kids to another indoor play place, like SkyZone

Cons:
- you have to buy their socks even if you come wearing the same kind of socks you get from SkyZone/Defy/etc. I’ve never been told we have to purchase THEIR socks at a place when I came already wearing the socks with the rubber bits on the bottoms.
- the bathroom was incredibly dirty: no seat covers, no soap, toilet paper and bloody bandaids on the floor. And this was first thing in the morning! Gross.
- the front desk person didn’t call for backup to get people in faster until 11 am, so we stood in line from 10-10:30. There were about 10 people in front of us.
- the concession counter has very few options (chips, soft pretzels, and Gatorade), the menu screen doesn’t work so you can’t see prices, and the machines were broken.
- it’s easy to lose track of your kids, and for them to lose you. I saw many sad, crying, lost children.
- no employee supervision anywhere.
- first adult cost $5.95, but next one cost $6.95? Why?

Bottom line: I won’t be back for a while. There were a lot of little kids (less than 5 years old) at 10 am on a Saturday, and that’s great to know so I can maybe take my youngest child one day. I’ve been there before when there were many 13+ year old kids and that was scary to me, sending my little kids into the depths of these tunnels with such older kids running around. 😬 Kids are considered up to age 17 and adults are encouraged to climb around in the tunnels, too.
I was mostly disappointed by the argument over us having to buy THEIR socks, and how disgusting the bathroom was.

I don’t recommend hosting a party here.

Review: My 7 year one had fun- that’s the plus. But this facility looks run down. Broken floor tiles, worn padding on the playground equipment, broken netting.
