Reviewer: Steve Santer
Rating: 1/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: Many previous reviews have discussed the lack of cleanliness and professionalism at this business. So my review will speak to the safety concerns I observed while my two kids were playing at the playground.

1. Lack of netting above equipment. All major overhead areas of an indoor playground need to have fire and rip resistant netting to keep children from climbing over the sides of the equipment and suffering injury and death from a fall. Flyover park has a lack of this netting in any of their equipment that is above ten feet high. This is a direct violation of the ASTM industry standards, the group who licenses indoor playgrounds such as "Flyover Fun Park". Attached photos show the lack of netting where it needs to be.

2. Lack of staffing for a playground of this size. When we were there, I observed four staff. One was in training, and one was behind the concession stand. I would also imagine this is what is causing the lack of cleanliness in the facility. Having this few staff means that the playground can't be correctly supervised and safety issues can't/ won't be addressed. At minimum, there should be six staff with two who are focused exclusively on children's safety. When I asked to speak to a manager, I was told there wasn't one on site. This begs the question, who is in charge?

3. Lack of public water: My kids were thirsty and I asked about a water fountain. I was told they didn't have one, and to buy a bottle of water. I understand this is a business, but profiting off thirsty children who are forced to pay for water seems a horrible way to make money.

Seeing the recent negative reviews shows a lack of caring about customers, but I would have hoped Flyover would care about keeping kids safe. Clearly this is not the case.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Eagle Delaware
Rating: 1/5

Review: Party Goers BEWARE!!!!!  This place deserves zero stars. This place is a dump, not only is it dirty, the management lacks customer service. I'm honestly surprised they are in business.

I booked this place for my son's birthday party, if you want your kids to stay hydrated, forget it. The drinks you pay for in the party package will not come out until the food comes which is after the hour of play time. You are not allowed to bring your own water in, I was told I had to take it back out to the car. There are no water fountains to use either and they do not provide courtesy waters for parties. They do this so you'll buy the $1/bottle water,  as a host that can add up if you are buying water for the whole party. I ended up taking the kids out to the car in groups so they could drink water at the car.

Also, if you book a party room, you are not allowed to utilize the party room until after the first hour, when the food gets there. I booked it 4-6 and was told I had to leave the room until 5. Do not and I repeat DO NOT since on the bench outside the room, it is wobbly, my father-in-law almost busted himself falling off it.

Furthermore, do not talk to your friends at the party about the issues you are having with the party, the manager, Lynn Duphily, gets really mad and immature (mockingly immature) and will kick you out. I'm glad I got my refund and they didn't get an ounce of my money. To get the refund was an event in itself. After we packed everything up and everyone is waiting in the car, I went to get my refund receipt and was told "You'll get your refund whenever she is ready to give it to you". We left and had an amazing party elsewhere.

Reviewer: maria amreen
Rating: 3/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Jungle land is a very good place for kids, I have been here couple of times and my kids enjoyed alot.
However,
It is my sons birthday today which is on a monday and as they don’t offer birthday parties on Monday, I booked play for my 2 sons and 6 of his friends.

I called Jungle Land 1 time before booking and 1 time prior to coming on Monday for confirmation about few things, I asked them
if we can cut a cake, they told cake cutting is not allowed if it’s not booked for a party, which is understandable.
I also asked if I can get a balloon and click pics, the staff told yes I can.
I also asked if I can bring food and snacks
They told yes “any” food except for nuts.
I also checked website, it tells the same about food, “Please feel free to bring any food and drinks that you would like except nut products”.

I reached the venue without a cake as told by them
I got a number 3 balloon.,which they refused me to take inside, I agreed and kept back the balloon in my car.
I got pizza and noodles.
They told noodles are not allowed only pizza can be eaten, I agreed and kept back.
I agreed peacefully because I didn’t want my sons birthday to end on a bad note.

I just want Jungle Land to be more clear about the rules on there website and requests all the staff to be on the same page.
If they were clear about the rules, I would have only done what they expect, and it would have been the best experience.

-----------------------

Review: Kidzville with the boys last night in Perry Hall!  I was pleasantly surprised how cool the place is and they didn’t try to upcharge everything.  There weren’t any arcade games which I loved.  No tickets to win and cash in for some unnecessary junk. I think admission was 13.99 and you need slipper socks.  They were $2.95 so very reasonable.  It was a big indoor playground with lots of stuff for the kids to do. Perfrct for a rainy night.

The only food they sold was cheese or pepperoni pizza.  You had to buy a whole pizza.  $18 for a 16 inch cheese which was reasonable.  The pizza was also really good.

In addition to the pizzas they had a freezer of ice creams.  They also had water, juice, sodas and coffee pods.  Waters were $2 and juice was $2.50.  Thats all they had which was perfect.  They didn’t even sell candy. Prices were very reasonable!

The boys were exhausted when we left there.

I will definitely go back.

{Reviewer: TJ

This place needs a major overhaul or update . Loose. Ceiling tiles about to fall and the floor piano did work . Also it was very dark no lights on .

Reviewer: Baddie Homkes
Rating: 4/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Me and my son came here on Friday 5/31 a round 4:30 ish and had a great time the employee is very sweet and shes very polite and a great conversationalist the place was nice I also appreciate her for finding my son’s tablet as we left it after having so much fun the membership we used is also very great you save 6$ a visit will be back I will say the equipment could use a update

-----------------------

Reviewer: J S
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I recently took my daughter to the Pikesville Bubala Indoor Playground location at 3:50 p.m. The sign on the door said 10-5 p.m. It appeared to be closed as the lights were partially off, however, the door was open. We went inside only to find the employee hidden in one of the play areas with her tablet and it appeared she had been napping. When she saw us she got up and said they were closing because there were no customers. I stated that the hours listed said until 5 p.m. but the employee insisted that she was closing. I asked he if my daughter could play for the remaining of the time left and the employee said no. My daughter was visibly upset, and at that point, it wasn’t worth the argument, the employee had clearly decided to close, regardless of the fact that we were paying customers. It’s disappointing to see this location not being cared for, especially since it’s the closest indoor playground in the Pikesville area geared toward younger children.

I truly hope the owner takes the time to reevaluate the customer service standards and considers hiring staff who are genuinely committed to creating a positive experience for families, rather than simply showing up for a paycheck. Perhaps the owner would consider selling to someone who lives in the community and has a genuine passion for revitalizing this Bubala location, bringing it back to what it once was, or even making it better. This place has so much potential, and it would be a shame to see it close down permanently.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Geoffrey Clapp
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We hosted our daughters 3rd birthday party here and although the children had fun in the play area, we won’t be returning for two important reasons:

1) The chairs provided for the children are hazardous because of their design, causing them to collapse under the toddlers weight and usually leading the kids to bang their faces or chins on the table in front of them. This happened to at least 7 children in our party and parents had to constantly catch their kids to prevent more of them from falling and crashing into the table when just trying to sit on the chairs. It sounds trivial but it’s a major safety issue that really worsened our party experience.

2) The equipment and interior is pretty run down and worn out. There’s just no way to not notice how worn and dirty everything is. Because you’re paying the same amount as having your party at a nicer and newer facility, I would not recommend hosting a kids party here since you really don’t get the value for what you’re paying for.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Carrie Shaw Miller
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We had a party for 10 kiddos and they all had a blast. Bubalas made the whole process super easy and everything went very smoothly from start to finish!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Melissa Magassouba
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I was disappointed with the state of this play area during my recent visit. Several areas were poorly lit, making it difficult to see properly, as if some lights were out. The play equipment appeared worn and in need of maintenance, raising safety concerns. Additionally, the cleanliness of the space was questionable, which is especially concerning in an area meant for children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ena A Waskiewicz
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I shared all of this including pictures in an email to the owner. But I wanted to be sure I share the experience here as well. I threw a party for my 4 yo son today at Bubala in Reisterstown.

The party room itself was extremely run down. The paint is peeling and the furniture is torn apart - I’ve attached photos. I understand this is a children’s play center but as someone who paid over $20 per child attending this party; my expectation was that the party room would look presentable and I wouldn’t need to figure out how to hide the things which were falling apart.

The chairs in the party room are a hazard for small children. We had at least 5 kids fall down while sitting and the chairs collapse in on them. The bottoms are plastic instead of rubber; this combined with the vinyl flooring made them a liability and very easy for kids to hurt themselves.

Lastly, the person working today…I was told I’d have a host to help me decorate. Thank goodness I had my parents meet me because I received no help. The person working was lackluster, at best. They didn’t inform me when the pizzas arrived. Multiple guests shared how unpleasant the person working was at check in. The most conversation I got was when they told me we needed to leave in 10 mins for another party coming in and when they were ready to take my payment.

The saving grace was that my son and the kids had fun in the play space. I wouldn't recommend paying for a party here unless the above it ratified.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Cam Alli

Review: I had my daughter’s birthday party here and I can say the young lady that helped me was friendly however the place was not clean at all . The party room had stains all over the wall. The overhead didn’t work and they had it rolled up and there were missing paint spots on the wall as well as the party room had an odor to it. The floor was sticky and if the party room isn’t being cleaned I can only imagine if the play area gets sanitized.

Reviewer: Jessica Ullman
Rating: 5/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: We had my daughter's second birthday party here and it was such a wonderful time. The staff is incredibly friendly and the place was clean. The playground is on the smaller side which actually makes it perfect for 2 and 3 year olds. The party room is a lovely blank canvas for decorating with plenty of space. The pizza was decent and came in hot right before lunchtime. They let you bring in cold food, deserts and drinks and they were so easy going. You have the party room 30min in advance to set up and then access to it for the entire 2hrs party. A great deal and a really lovely party space for the little ones.

Reviewer: Ashley Emtcheu
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: The place is beyond my expectations. Perfect inside toddler playground for a child's birthday party. Everything was clean and disinfected (before arriving and leaving). The setup in the party room was perfect. We had the entire place to ourselves. Great children's music (Gracie's Corner) was played throughout the place. My daughter loves gracies corner. The staff was amazing and helped with everything from carrying in items for the planned party, decorating the party room, helping assist with scheduled activities-pizza, cake cutting, etc. The staff also ensured everyone was having a great time and helping whenever anyone needed anything (very attentive). I see why they are number 1 with toddler party's. My daughter loved having her 3rd birthday party here. My guest stated how this place was the best place they have been to for a toddler's party-parking was easy, spacious, and very kid friendly. Definitely plan on visiting this location again in the future.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tracy Keller
Rating: 4/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently revisited Bubala's Indoor Playground over the weekend, and I must say, my recent experience only reinforced my positive impressions from my initial visit. However, I can't help but express my dissatisfaction with the deletion of my previous review, which praised Dreshawna, one of Bubala's stellar employees. Initially, I was disheartened to find my earlier accolades for Dreshawna's exceptional cleaning skills erased from the platform. Nevertheless, my disappointment turned to delight upon returning to the facility and discovering that she not only still works there but continues to exhibit the same level of excellence that initially impressed me. The dedication to maintaining a clean and hygienic environment at Bubala's is truly commendable. The indoor playground itself continues to be a fantastic space for children to explore and play. While I stand by my previous praise for Dreshawna, I hope this review remains intact to convey my satisfaction with her consistent performance. My only suggestion would be to ensure that customer reviews are treated with the importance they deserve, fostering a transparent and honest reflection of the establishment's strengths.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Shanley Pearl
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Honest review! Read the reviews before you book a party, because I read the 1 star reviews, I avoided issues and had a wonderful time! My son had his 1st birthday there, perfect venue. We had soooo much fun.

I see people saying the staff is young & there’s no management on site, true! But I’m young too so I had a lot of fun with the staff lol. They legit just follow the rules to a T, if that bothers you idk what to tell you.

PAY THE EXTRA $100 TO BRING YOUR OWN FOOD! The pizza provided sucks lol. I don’t know *why* it costs more to bring food but it does.

The projector doesnt work. It’s there, but it’s not usable so don’t plan to use it.

You will get 30 mins to set up, so create all your decorations and organize them at home. Do your best! This is a children’s party not a wedding, the room is cute even without decor! I know we all love our kids but how much decorations does a kiddie party need?

WE HAD SO MUCH FUN! My son had fun, all the kids had fun & we made amazing memories. It is not a grandiose venue, but it’s affordable and fun. I still give it 5 stars & I might have his 2nd birthday party there too 🎉🥳

-----------------------

Reviewer: Marita Braxton
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My daughter just had her 2nd birthday party here. I booked a private party with and additional hour. I arrived to an empty facility at 3:15 (my party was scheduled for 4pm) was greeted by a young girl who advised that per management she was not allowed to let us in to doctorate until 3:30. That was strike one, during the party I ran out of plates and asked if I could get plates (which the facility provides for parties) and was advised because I brought my own decorations I could only be given 10 plates per management when I paid for a party for 25 kids (strike 2). When the pizza arrived it the establishment policy that we should feed 25 kids from one large pizza that is cut into tiny slices. I paid to have an extra hour on my party to be told that I would only have until 6:30 because it policy that the facility is clean and closed at 7pm. So at 6:30 the young ladies on staff began to clean over top of my guest! Which is totally unacceptable! So I’m essentially I did not get an extra hour, I paid for nothing. Although the staff is friendly they are merely children running a business. They blame everything on management, but there’s no management representation on site! When asked to have the manager number that request was denied! I low key want some of my money back! The place is cute for small children, but I would NEVER patronize this place again!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kami Hu
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Because this store is frequently closed and we were driving from downtown Baltimore, we called ahead today (7/25) about coming in and were told that they would stay open until 5pm. We arrived at 3:45 and the girl at the counter (AirPods in, talking on her phone) told us that they were closing early. We mentioned that we had called ahead and she said that due to low business volume the owner had said to close early. We asked if there was any way she could recontact the owner to stay open and she refused. We asked if my 4 year old could play for 10 minutes while she went about closing the shop (I dunno, closing the register and cleaning the bathroom perhaps?) and she refused. The additional overhead for 10-30 minutes of play would have been negligible, and my daughter’s disappointment was palpable. We intentionally don’t promise a trip to Bubala unless we confirm that they’re open for business, and this was poor customer service and frank laziness on this employee’s part. Sounds like it’s only Hyperkidz from now on.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Vidi Horwich
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: We visited Kidz Jungle World on Christmas Eve, and it was an absolute delight! Despite being a busy holiday, the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. The play equipment was impressively clean, showing the care and effort put into maintaining the facility.

One of the standout features for us was the high weight limit on the equipment, allowing parents to join in the fun without worry. It’s also fantastic that parents enter for free – a thoughtful touch that sets this soft play centre apart from others.

The entrance fee being a whole-day pass is excellent value, and we appreciated the flexibility it gave us. Our two-year-old absolutely loved exploring all the different areas, and we would have stayed even longer if we didn’t have other commitments.

Overall, we had a wonderful time and would highly recommend Kidz Jungle World to anyone looking for a fun, family-friendly outing. It’s a perfect spot for kids to play, laugh, and burn off energy while parents can relax or join in. A solid 5/5 experience!

Review: Highly recommend. My almost 3 year old had a fantastic time and after 1.5 hour’s he is worn out and satisfied. They had so many obstacles and my son didn’t want to leave. Take your child here if you want to tire him/her out.

We came near closing time and not once did we feel rushed to leave. The entire time she kept busy mopping and cleaning (which by the way as soon as you walk in you can smell the cleanliness of the place). Reviewer: J S
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I recently took my daughter to the Pikesville Bubala Indoor Playground location at 3:50 p.m. The sign on the door said 10-5 p.m. It appeared to be closed as the lights were partially off, however, the door was open. We went inside only to find the employee hidden in one of the play areas with her tablet and it appeared she had been napping. When she saw us she got up and said they were closing because there were no customers. I stated that the hours listed said until 5 p.m. but the employee insisted that she was closing. I asked he if my daughter could play for the remaining of the time left and the employee said no. My daughter was visibly upset, and at that point, it wasn’t worth the argument, the employee had clearly decided to close, regardless of the fact that we were paying customers. It’s disappointing to see this location not being cared for, especially since it’s the closest indoor playground in the Pikesville area geared toward younger children.

I truly hope the owner takes the time to reevaluate the customer service standards and considers hiring staff who are genuinely committed to creating a positive experience for families, rather than simply showing up for a paycheck. Perhaps the owner would consider selling to someone who lives in the community and has a genuine passion for revitalizing this Bubala location, bringing it back to what it once was, or even making it better. This place has so much potential, and it would be a shame to see it close down permanently.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Geoffrey Clapp
Rating: 2/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We hosted our daughters 3rd birthday party here and although the children had fun in the play area, we won’t be returning for two important reasons:

1) The chairs provided for the children are hazardous because of their design, causing them to collapse under the toddlers weight and usually leading the kids to bang their faces or chins on the table in front of them. This happened to at least 7 children in our party and parents had to constantly catch their kids to prevent more of them from falling and crashing into the table when just trying to sit on the chairs. It sounds trivial but it’s a major safety issue that really worsened our party experience.

2) The equipment and interior is pretty run down and worn out. There’s just no way to not notice how worn and dirty everything is. Because you’re paying the same amount as having your party at a nicer and newer facility, I would not recommend hosting a kids party here since you really don’t get the value for what you’re paying for.

Reviewer: Ena A Waskiewicz
Rating: 2/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I shared all of this including pictures in an email to the owner. But I wanted to be sure I share the experience here as well. I threw a party for my 4 yo son today at Bubala in Reisterstown.

The party room itself was extremely run down. The paint is peeling and the furniture is torn apart - I’ve attached photos. I understand this is a children’s play center but as someone who paid over $20 per child attending this party; my expectation was that the party room would look presentable and I wouldn’t need to figure out how to hide the things which were falling apart.

The chairs in the party room are a hazard for small children. We had at least 5 kids fall down while sitting and the chairs collapse in on them. The bottoms are plastic instead of rubber; this combined with the vinyl flooring made them a liability and very easy for kids to hurt themselves.

Lastly, the person working today…I was told I’d have a host to help me decorate. Thank goodness I had my parents meet me because I received no help. The person working was lackluster, at best. They didn’t inform me when the pizzas arrived. Multiple guests shared how unpleasant the person working was at check in. The most conversation I got was when they told me we needed to leave in 10 mins for another party coming in and when they were ready to take my payment.

The saving grace was that my son and the kids had fun in the play space. I wouldn't recommend paying for a party here unless the above it ratified.

Review: I recently revisited Bubala's Indoor Playground over the weekend, and I must say, my recent experience only reinforced my positive impressions from my initial visit. However, I can't help but express my dissatisfaction with the deletion of my previous review, which praised Dreshawna, one of Bubala's stellar employees. Initially, I was disheartened to find my earlier accolades for Dreshawna's exceptional cleaning skills erased from the platform. Nevertheless, my disappointment turned to delight upon returning to the facility and discovering that she not only still works there but continues to exhibit the same level of excellence that initially impressed me. The dedication to maintaining a clean and hygienic environment at Bubala's is truly commendable. The indoor playground itself continues to be a fantastic space for children to explore and play. While I stand by my previous praise for Dreshawna, I hope this review remains intact to convey my satisfaction with her consistent performance. My only suggestion would be to ensure that customer reviews are treated with the importance they deserve, fostering a transparent and honest reflection of the establishment's strengths.

Reviewer: Shanley Pearl
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Honest review! Read the reviews before you book a party, because I read the 1 star reviews, I avoided issues and had a wonderful time! My son had his 1st birthday there, perfect venue. We had soooo much fun.

I see people saying the staff is young & there’s no management on site, true! But I’m young too so I had a lot of fun with the staff lol. They legit just follow the rules to a T, if that bothers you idk what to tell you.

PAY THE EXTRA $100 TO BRING YOUR OWN FOOD! The pizza provided sucks lol. I don’t know *why* it costs more to bring food but it does.

The projector doesnt work. It’s there, but it’s not usable so don’t plan to use it.

You will get 30 mins to set up, so create all your decorations and organize them at home. Do your best! This is a children’s party not a wedding, the room is cute even without decor! I know we all love our kids but how much decorations does a kiddie party need?

WE HAD SO MUCH FUN! My son had fun, all the kids had fun & we made amazing memories. It is not a grandiose venue, but it’s affordable and fun. I still give it 5 stars & I might have his 2nd birthday party there too 🎉🥳

Reviewer: Marita Braxton
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My daughter just had her 2nd birthday party here. I booked a private party with and additional hour. I arrived to an empty facility at 3:15 (my party was scheduled for 4pm) was greeted by a young girl who advised that per management she was not allowed to let us in to doctorate until 3:30. That was strike one, during the party I ran out of plates and asked if I could get plates (which the facility provides for parties) and was advised because I brought my own decorations I could only be given 10 plates per management when I paid for a party for 25 kids (strike 2). When the pizza arrived it the establishment policy that we should feed 25 kids from one large pizza that is cut into tiny slices. I paid to have an extra hour on my party to be told that I would only have until 6:30 because it policy that the facility is clean and closed at 7pm. So at 6:30 the young ladies on staff began to clean over top of my guest! Which is totally unacceptable! So I’m essentially I did not get an extra hour, I paid for nothing. Although the staff is friendly they are merely children running a business. They blame everything on management, but there’s no management representation on site! When asked to have the manager number that request was denied! I low key want some of my money back! The place is cute for small children, but I would NEVER patronize this place again!

Reviewer: Kami Hu
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Because this store is frequently closed and we were driving from downtown Baltimore, we called ahead today (7/25) about coming in and were told that they would stay open until 5pm. We arrived at 3:45 and the girl at the counter (AirPods in, talking on her phone) told us that they were closing early. We mentioned that we had called ahead and she said that due to low business volume the owner had said to close early. We asked if there was any way she could recontact the owner to stay open and she refused. We asked if my 4 year old could play for 10 minutes while she went about closing the shop (I dunno, closing the register and cleaning the bathroom perhaps?) and she refused. The additional overhead for 10-30 minutes of play would have been negligible, and my daughter’s disappointment was palpable. We intentionally don’t promise a trip to Bubala unless we confirm that they’re open for business, and this was poor customer service and frank laziness on this employee’s part. Sounds like it’s only Hyperkidz from now on.

Review: After visiting Sunny Day over the past few months we decided to schedule my son's 4th birthday here. Caitlin was super responsive, thorough, and detail oriented. We supplied our dessert of choice while everything else was handled from the playlist to decorations to food and beverage for the children down to the goody bags (which were awesome). We were also welcomed to bring anything additional including food and beverage for the adults. With the package we selected we got to choose our own unique theme and she went above and beyond to supply the decor to go with it. I also loved how we could add on several additional things from a menu had we wanted to. Everyone had a great time and we are so happy we chose to hold our party here!

Reviewer: Nicki White
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: BEST PARTY PLACE FOR LITTLE PEANUTS!!!!!

We had our granddaughter's 4th birthday party at Sunny Day Play Cafe yesterday!  I can't say enough WONDERFUL things about the event.  The owners, Jesse and Caitlin, couldn't have been more accommodating.  Communication prior to the party was efficient and prompt.  They were great when I asked to bring in "adult" food for the mommies and daddies (instead of serving them the kid's pizza and chicken tenders) -- no problem was the response.  When I asked to bring in my own face painter and balloon artist -- no problem was the answer (they even set up a "station" for this!!).  When we got there, Jesse was cleaning and sanitizing the venue from a previous party -- the place was spotless when he was done!  Throughout the entire event, Jesse kept things running smoothly -- a feat when he had 25 four year old littles and approximately 35 adults partying on to celebrate our little peanut!  Sunny Day had loot bags prepared for all of our little guests so everybody left with some treats in addition to the smiles on their faces!!  Thank you Jesse and Caitlin --  this party was a huge success because of your amazing play cafe and your caring and creative hosting skills!!
We'll be back to visit and play soon!!  Thanks again!!!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lori Gordon
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We had my daughters 3rd birthday party at Sunny Day and it was amazing! The booking was seamless and Caitlin kept in communication regarding theme, guest list, etc. The space is huge and I love how the adults have a space of their own for coffee/eating/talking while the kids play. There are comfy couches for parents to sit positioned perfectly throughout the play area, as well. I especially loved the section catered to the "little" littles! We had some guests who were not yet a year of age and they had plenty of space to crawl, sit, and play away from the big kids and the big toys. The variety of pretend play is amazing, and the equipment is top notch. My favorite part was how CLEAN Sunny Day Play Cafe is. We had previous experience at a play place in West Chester and the lack of cleanliness, itself, kept us from going back. But Sunny Day Play Cafe was so clean, even the bathrooms! Caitlin was an amazing host and literally took care of everything down to party favor bags. We will 100% be back for more fun at Sunny Day Play Cafe!

Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Reviewer: david gardner

Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Reviewer: Rachel Martin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially a mom that needs to get out and socialize. Food is delicious!

-----------------------

Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

-----------------------

Review: N/A

Review: The best!!! Such a great place to take the grandkids... Plus they have wine and massage chairs. Their pretzels didn't suck at all... Highly recommend!!!!!!

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Reviewer: meghan c
Rating: 4/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Safety- the biggest priority at a kids park like this- was not monitored well here. There was just one person watching the whole area and he seemed to only watch the jumping part. There’s a whole seperate dodgeball part that wasn’t monitored. The trouble is it’s mixed ages and no one monitoring. You had grown adult men in there trying to chuck the ball at their kids but missing and hitting other smaller kids, as well as older male teenagers doing the same. You have very tiny kids like 4 year olds mixed with 17 year olds .. if there no age restrictions or age zones/ it should at least be heavily monitored. For paying $21 plus socks plus tax for 2 hours, there should be more surveillance. My 4 year old son snuck into the area and ( open entry ways ) and came out two seconds later with a bloody lip in several places. I had him stay out of there.
A boy about 10 years  old was on the ground after getting a friendly hit, then an older kid saw him on the ground , went almost two feet away from his face- and slammed a ball right into his eyes/ forehead. He was crying and rolling in pain on the mat. Everyone including adults just stepped around him continuing to play. I went up to him, helped him out, and had him show me to his mom ( he couldn’t see very well due to the eyes injury ). He seemed a boy the type of age and demeanor where he wouldn’t cry like that unless it was serious .
Another Saftey mishap is the  way to the doors / exit having no gate. The idea of parks like these are for parents to relax a little and not have to be so hypervigilant of their kids escaping out a door. Every park I’ve ever been to, there was ALWAYS a gate for entering and exiting the area. Several times I had to run after my son who didn’t see me sitting there at glance and thought I was in the bathrooms so he just easily walked right down the stairs, right where the exit door is to the street. I had to be so extra vigilant. I feel like there must be some sort of policy at these places for gates leading to exits. There are very small kids here too and it’s SO busy and chaotic you could loose track of your kid easily .
They don’t enforce trampoline rules like at other parks. My son just came to me saying a boy tackled him and my son was limping on one of his legs (my son is not one to want to stop the play and even ignored the bloody lip , this is the first time we’ve been to a play center and seen so many injuries from him and other kids ). Everyone just runs around crazy …
There needs to be more seating when it’s this busy and at least two watchers for the trampoline part ( or age separated parts ) and a seperate watcher for the dodgeball or I don’t consider it safe …

-----------------------

Review: This was my first visit to this location. I've heard a lot about the trampoline park and have seen many videos of it.

Each of the parties get their own room, along with pizzas and water bottles. Bottles. The parties can bring their own decorations, goodie bags, cakes, etc. those who are participating in the trampoline activities are given special socks to use on the trampoline. Along the trampolines were some seating area as well as some fancy massaging chairs (not free).

It seemed like all the kids are having a blast which is what matters in the end!

Reviewer: Libby Sponsler
Rating: 1/5
Time: 8 months ago
Review: Just had my son’s birthday party there tonight and will never go back! The only reason I am even giving this place a 1 is because the kids had a good time.
Cleanliness- gross, smells bad
Food- only option was pizza and their pizza is Gross!
Overall condition of park- run down and not safe! There was a huge hole in one of the trampolines which to me poses a huge safety issue. They also replaced their foam pit with a launching pad that collapsed with my son and friends inside of it. Their “fix” for both problems was duct tape.
Service - absolute zero and I’d NEVER recommend holding a party here. Got there 15 mins before the start of our party to set up (was told to arrive 15 mins early). There was another party going on in the room and didn’t get in until our party started. Our party host was nowhere to be found. There was only 1 person working the front desk so while there was an “expedited” line for party check ins- guests sat there waiting in regular line. I had to ask if someone could come help check in my guests that sat in line for 10-15 minutes which ate into their jump time. Then they weren’t telling the guests which party room to go to, forgot to give half of them socks so they had to go get back in line.  About 20 minutes into our party- our party host showed up to introduced herself and confirmed our food order. The parties are supposed to be an hour of play of play time, hour in party room.  An hour and 15 minutes after our party started and we hadn’t been called to our room for food- I started wondering if they forgot us. Go to the front desk to ask what time the pizza is going to be served for our party and was told I’d have to ask our host- to which I said- well where is she? The kids started filtering into the party room on their own out of hunger and being thirsty and the party host happened to be bringing pizza in.  I asked her, did you announce for his party to come back here? Nope.  So I asked if she could do that. The party host did not assist at all. My guests were helping pass out pizza and drinks. Usually at these places the party host cuts and passes out the cake. Nope me, my husband, and another mom took care of this. Now the party has ended. No party host in sight. Go to the front desk and ask if I need to check out and sign anything or do they just charge any balance to my card on file - complete check out and final payment at front desk. Then we literally broke down everything, packed it all up on our own and rolled it out to our car. We were unloading into our car when the party host came out to the parking lot asking if we needed our check to pay our bill. Nope- we did that 20 minutes ago through the front desk while you were nowhere to be found.
This is the worst experience I’ve had at these party venues and we will never be back even just for playtime.

Reviewer: Anna
Rating: 4/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: We love Altitude and are monthly members here. The trampolines are so fun, and their new jumping pad in place of the foam pit is really really fun. We love the dodgeball and basketball areas as well. Cleanliness is a concern, as it is with a lot of indoor play places, and the overall park is a bit run down, but management has addressed those concerns and is working on improvements. Be prepared to wash your hands frequently and well and use the hand sanitizer provided. They recently added in a giant landing pad in place of the foam pit, which is really fun. The dodgeball area definitely could use some more balls, since a lot of the ones there are stuck in the netting. A few of the nets and trampolines are damaged, with quick fixes like zip ties and duct tape, but again, I am pretty sure management is working to fix those issues, and have been communicative about any concerns! I would recommend going during the week during the work/school day if you can, (especially if you have little ones under 5) the weekends can get extremely busy and can get a little hectic for the smaller kiddos. Overall, it's a really fun way to get the energy out, for kids and adults who can jump with their kids - and is overall a really fun time!!

Reviewer: Rachel Martin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: No words to explain how awesome this place is. My 20 month old loves it so much. Sometimes as a mom you can lose yourself to being just a mom, but chasing my little one through the jungle gym really brought back my childhood and the child in me. Reminded me of the 90's when you had parties at a pizza place and you could run off and play or do arcades. It's very organized and clean. The staff are friendly and it's very safe. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially a mom that needs to get out and socialize. Food is delicious!

-----------------------

Reviewer: david gardner
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I love Cabin Fever and every thing the bring to the community. They took the stress out of the entire party, and all of the kids had a great time.  I cant recommend them enough.

We had my daughters Birthday Party there and Richard and Malachi greated us, offered a cart  helped bring in everything for the party.  We had dropped off decorations and the team had the party room all set.  They did a great job.  They played out how they suggested the event played out (play first, food, Birthday then game room).  We had 13 kids of different re at ages and they all loved the different areas in the play room.  The sensory quiet room was a big hit as well.  My kids came full of energy and left tired.  Win win!!!

When they made an announcement the the food was ready, the team swept in and quickly got the kids food, we sang and the team was able to distribute cake in an orderly fashioned in no time.

It was a smooth transition to the game room. They passed them out right before tidying up the room.    They recently got some new games for all kids ( and myself) of all ages.

Clean up was a breeze all we had to do was get the leftovers and gifts to the car.  Easy Peasy and the kids had a blast.  5 start great place for a kids to have fun and get out some excess energy.

I cant thank the entire team at Cabin Fever for a great experience.  Thank you so much!!!

Reviewer: Meg Koczorowski
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Our granddaughter was visiting from out of town and of course it was hot and so humid; so we needed to find a place we could take a two year old to enjoy playing.
Well, we hit the jackpot with Cabin Fever Play Center.  It is perfect for children of many ages.  They have a toddler area where younger ones can play, climb, build, and interact together.  The main play area is incredible! It has two slides that I noticed.  One right in the center and a spiraling tube slide towards the back.  There were swings within the gym the children could swing on, a "bug mat" to jump on the moving bugs, and stationary air guns that shot out nerf balls.  The stationary air guns ended up being one of my granddaughter's favorites.
There was also an arcade area in the back with a cafeteria area too.  The pizza was amazing!!!  We loved the seasoning on the crust ♡
There are massage chairs for parents or grandparents to utilize, too.  There was a room where the children could make their own stuffed animal friend.
What a wonderful place for children to be children and play together.  The facility was very clean, and everyone working there was so incredibly kind.
We will definitely be back again when my granddaughter is back in town.  Thank you for this amazing place for children to come play and enjoy themselves.  There needs to be more of these around different cities for the children.

Reviewer: Chasity Nelson
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Extremely kid friendly environment! I took my kids on a week day when it wasn't so busy. My 3 children were able to run about the play area and do their own separate activities and I was still able to keep up with where each of my children were. There were a few of the local regulars there when I took my children and they were very respectful young adults, they were great with children, and I honestly thought these you g adults worked at Cabin Fever judging by the way these young adults conducted themselves. It was very comforting to me, considering anytime I take my children somewhere I am the only adult present to keep up with all 3 of my children. The lady that ran the place was very helpful with getting us checked in and went above and beyond by helping me setup my first time funful membership. The place was clean, well set up, and the layout was safe... There is only 1 way in or out of the building and no blind spot areas. A parent can sit at the tables and see every part of the children's play area. The combination of safety, cleanliness, and service of Cabin Fever really impressed me and I will be taking my children back often! Businesses like this one really do stand out and make a huge difference in the community!

Reviewer: Aurora Webster
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 years ago
Review: I held my daughters 3rd birthday here today. Me and my family have been here one other time, and were completely SOLD. Today just sealed the deal! Everyone was so sweet and considerate from the very beginning! They made sure they went above and beyond to make sure everything was clean and prepared! They had the complete itinerary planned, but always confirmed with me prior to calling the announcements. Everything has gone absolutely smooth as a whistle this entire experience, from the first visit until now. The pizza was delicious and my party loved it. I have never had a smoother child's birthday party!  We all really liked it especially since  the parents got to stay and play too! We got card credits for the arcade so the bigger kids (and husbands) got to have fun more their age! They even had an alcohol menu which was great for the parents! They even had their version of a build-a-bear, that wasn't there the last time we went, so it was a super great surprise!! And the kids loved it! Everyone that got the bear got a discount too! It's so clean and they seriously were so accommodating it wasn't even funny!! We will definitely be back!!! 10/10 RECOMMEND!!!! 💛💛💛💛
